Turn batter into greased and floured 9-inch springform pan, spreading evenly.
Bake in preheated 325°F (165°C) oven 20 to 25 minutes (cake should test done with a toothpick — but dry).
Allow cake to cool in pan, then place in freezer for at least 2 hours. Once it's frozen, remove sides of springform pan. Invert cake onto wire rack and remove bottom of springform pan.

To make ganache: bring cream to a boil and pour over chocolate chips in a bowl. Whisk until completely smooth. Set wire rack containing cake onto a sheet pan with sides. Pour lukewarm ganache over cake, coating completely and repouring if necessary to cover well. Gently jiggle wire rack to help drain excess ganache. Ganache will lose its shine when set. Remove cake from wire rack with a wide spatula and place on a serving plate.

notes: Must freeze cake before unmolding and glazing
Bourbon can be omitted if preferred, add 1 tsp vanilla instead
From Paula Deen's Lady & Sons restaurant

recipes.title: Laughner's Millionaire's Pie
recipes.description: The crown jewel of desserts from Laughner's cafeteria - an ultra-rich pie with coconut, chocolate chips, and pecans.

ingredients.item: unbaked 10-inch pie shell, in its pan

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 325°F (165°C).
Toss together the coconut flakes, chocolate chips and chopped pecans. Place in pie shell.
Mix sugars, salt and melted margarine. Beat in corn syrup and vanilla.
Gently fold eggs into sugar mixture. Pour evenly over ingredients in prepared pie shell.
Bake 55-65 minutes, or until deep golden brown on top and nearly set in center.
Cool at room temperature.

notes: From famous Laughner's Cafeteria in Indiana - 'The Crown Jewel' of their desserts
Laughner's, 20 N Franklin Road at I-465; (317) 356-3388

flags.issue: Left side partially cut off - coconut/chips/pecans quantities estimated

recipes.title: Peppermint Candy Shortbread Cookies
recipes.description: Buttery shortbread cookies with crushed peppermint candy and vanilla frosting.

instructions.text: MIX butter, sugar, crushed candy and vanilla thoroughly using an electric mixer. Gradually blend in flour and corn starch.
FORM into 1-inch balls and place on parchment paper lined baking sheets. Gently press down on each cookie to flatten using fingers or a flat bottomed drinking glass.
[INFERRED] Bake at 325°F (165°C) for 25-30 minutes until edges are lightly golden.
Frosting: Combine confectioners sugar, milk, vanilla. Drizzle or spread on cooled cookies, top with crushed peppermint.

recipes.pan_size: Baking sheets lined with Reynolds Parchment Paper
notes: Instructions cut off at bottom - baking step inferred
Perfect for Christmas/holiday baking
Must use real butter, no substitutes

flags: Baking instructions completed from standard shortbread cookie technique

recipes.title: Favorite Chocolate Cake
recipes.description: Simple one-layer chocolate cake made with sour milk and boiling water for extra moistness.

instructions.text: Heat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour an 8-inch square baking pan; set aside.
Combine sugar and butter in large bowl. Beat at medium speed, scraping bowl often, until creamy.
Add sour milk, melted chocolate, egg and vanilla. Continue beating until smooth.
Reduce speed to low; add flour, baking soda and salt. Beat until well mixed.
Add boiling water; continue beating until smooth.
Pour batter into prepared pan. Bake for 35 to 40 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.
Dust cake with powdered sugar or serve with dollop of whipped cream, if desired.

recipes.pan_size: 8-inch square baking pan, greased and floured
notes: *Sour milk substitute: Add 3/4 teaspoon vinegar or lemon juice plus enough milk to equal 1/4 cup; let stand 5 minutes

recipes.title: Angel Lush
recipes.source_note: Publix Apron's Simple Meals recipe featuring Katie Brown
recipes.description: Light and refreshing layered dessert with angel food cake, pineapple pudding, and fresh berries.

ingredients.item: JELL-O Vanilla Flavor Instant Pudding & Pie Filling

ingredients.prep_note: such as strawberries, blueberries, or raspberries, rinsed

instructions.text: Combine in medium bowl, dry pudding mix and pineapple. Gently stir in whipped topping.
Slice cake horizontally into 3 layers. Place bottom cake layer on serving plate; top with 1/3 of the pudding mixture. Repeat layers two times.
Chill cake at least 1 hour. Top with berries just before serving. Store leftovers in refrigerator.

notes: Featured in Publix Apron's Simple Meals
JELL-O Brand and Cool Whip are proud sponsors of the Katie Brown Workshop on Public Television

recipes.title: Spiced Bundt Cake
recipes.description: Moist apple bundt cake with warm spices and a tangy citrus glaze - Americans love bundt cakes!

ingredients.prep_note: peeled and cut into 1-inch cubes (about 3 1/2 cups)

instructions.text: [INCOMPLETE - Baking instructions not visible in image. Standard bundt cake method would apply: sauté apples in butter with brown sugar, mix dry ingredients, cream wet ingredients, combine and fold in apples and walnuts, bake in greased bundt pan.]

notes: Recipe has citrus glaze with lemon
Sautéed apples lend a rich, smooth flavor
Instructions cut off in image

flags.issue: Instructions not visible in image - only ingredients shown

recipes.title: Captain "Hook Him" Cake
recipes.description: Moist rum-soaked bundt cake with pecans, yellow cake mix, and pudding - topped with buttery rum sauce.

instructions.text: Combine pecans and 1 tablespoon sugar; sprinkle in bottom of a 12-cup Bundt pan coated with cooking spray. Set aside.
Combine cake mix, pudding mix, 1/2 cup water, 1/2 cup rum and applesauce in a large mixing bowl. Beat at medium speed of a mixer until smooth.
Gradually add egg substitute, 1/4 cup at a time, and beat until blended.
Pour batter into prepared pan. Bake at 325°F (165°C) for 1 hour or until a wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pan on a wire rack 1 hour (do not invert).
Sauce: Combine 1 cup sugar, remaining 1/2 cup rum, butter and 1/4 cup water in a medium saucepan; bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring often. Boil 1 minute. Let sauce cool.
Prick surface of cake at 1-inch intervals with a wooden pick. Pour sauce evenly over cake. Let stand at least 2 hours before inverting and serving.

notes: Let cake stand at least 2 hours to absorb rum sauce
Do not invert pan until after sauce is absorbed

recipes.title: Waldorf-Astoria Chocolate Cake
recipes.description: Famous dense chocolate cake from the legendary Waldorf-Astoria Hotel, baked in a pipestem pan.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Blend sugar and butter, and add the eggs.
Add cooled melted chocolate.
Sift flour, baking powder and salt into sugar and butter, alternating with the milk. Add vanilla and nuts.
Bake in a greased pipestem pan for 45 minutes to one hour (usually takes 1 hour or a bit more). Do not invert pan when cake is done.
Let cool for 15 minutes, then remove to rack. Cool completely before frosting.

notes: Do not invert pan while cake is still hot
Classic recipe from the famous Waldorf-Astoria Hotel
Frosting recipe referenced but not shown

flags.issue: Frosting recipe referenced as 'at left' but not visible in image

recipes.title: Midnight Pudding
recipes.description: Elegant chocolate pudding with a dramatic white chocolate garnish - double boiler method.

instructions.text: Melt semisweet chocolate in top half of a double boiler over medium heat. Stir chocolate constantly with rubber spatula until completely melted and smooth, then remove from heat and set aside.
Heat half-and-half, 1/4 cup sugar, and the cocoa in a 3-quart saucepan over medium-high heat. When hot, whisk to dissolve sugar. Bring to a boil.
While cream is heating, whisk egg yolks, remaining sugar and cornstarch in a bowl until slightly thickened and lemon colored.
Pour boiling half-and-half mixture slowly into egg yolks and stir to combine.
Return mixture to saucepan and heat over medium-high heat, stirring constantly until it begins to boil and becomes quite thick, about 30 seconds.
Remove pan from heat and transfer mixture to a large bowl. Add melted chocolate. Then, place bowl in ice water and stir pudding until it is cold.
Fold in all but 2 tablespoons of the white chocolate into pudding.
To serve, place 3/4 cup of pudding into each of four dessert bowls and sprinkle half a tablespoon of white chocolate over top of each.

notes: Use ice bath to quickly cool the pudding
Reserve white chocolate pieces for garnish

recipes.title: Not Neiman-Marcus' Cookie Recipe
recipes.description: Legendary oatmeal chocolate chip cookies with ground oatmeal, grated chocolate bar, and chocolate chips - makes a huge batch!

ingredients.prep_note: ground to fine powder in blender or food processor

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Cream butter and both sugars in a large mixing bowl. Add eggs and vanilla.
In separate bowl, combine flour, powdered oatmeal, salt, baking powder and baking soda. Stir dry ingredients into butter and egg mixture until incorporated.
Add grated chocolate bar and stir until distributed. Add chocolate chips and nuts.
Roll cookie dough into 1 to 1½-inch balls and place 2 inches apart on a cookie sheet. Bake 6 to 10 minutes or until bottoms just begin to brown.
Remove cookie sheet from oven and let cool until cookies are set, about 3 minutes. Use spatula to remove cookies from pan to waxed paper. Let cool completely before storing.

notes: Famous 'Neiman Marcus cookie' urban legend recipe
Grind oatmeal to fine powder for best texture

recipes.title: Key Lime Pie
recipes.description: Classic Florida Key Lime Pie with sweetened condensed milk and fluffy meringue topping.

instructions.text: Pour sweetened condensed milk into mixing bowl; add lime juice, peel, salt and yolks. Beat until well blended. Turn filling into pie shell.
To make meringue, add cream of tartar to egg whites and beat until stiff. Add sugar gradually, beating until smooth and glossy.
Spread meringue over lime filling. Bake at 425°F (220°C) a few minutes or until meringue is brown.
Cool before serving.

notes: Classic Florida dessert
Key limes are smaller and more tart than Persian limes
Watch meringue carefully - browns quickly!

recipes.title: Georgia Peach Cobbler
recipes.description: A classic Southern peach cobbler with a buttery biscuit-like topping - a taste of Georgia.

instructions.text: For filling: Cook all ingredients together over medium heat until butter is melted and slight thickening has occurred (approx. 8-10 minutes).
Remove from heat and pour into buttered 8" round oven-proof dish (or individual dishes as shown).
For topping: Mix dry ingredients first and add butter and egg. Mix until thoroughly incorporated.
Spoon over top of filling to cover most of dish (mold with your hands). Place on baking sheet to catch any bubbling over.
Bake on middle rack of pre-heated oven at 400°F (200°C) for 30 minutes.

notes: Place on baking sheet to catch drips
Can use individual ramekins for single servings
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 263.jpeg

recipes.title: Sugar Cookie Cutouts
recipes.description: Classic sugar cookies perfect for rolling and cutting into holiday shapes - a perennial favorite for cookie exchanges.

instructions.text: In a medium bowl, cream together the butter and sugar.
Stir in the eggs and vanilla.
Sift together the flour and baking powder; stir into the creamed mixture, alternating with the heavy cream.
Cover dough and chill for 2 to 3 hours until firm.
Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease cookie sheets.
On a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough to 1/2-inch thickness.
Cut into shapes with cookie cutters. Place cutouts an inch apart on prepared cookie sheets.
Bake for 12 to 14 minutes in the preheated oven until bottoms and edges of cookies are light brown.
Remove from baking sheet and cool on wire racks. Decorate as desired with frosting and sprinkles.

notes: Choose treats with a wide appeal when baking for a cookie exchange
These classic recipes are perennial favorites

recipes.title: Cherry-Nut Cookies
recipes.description: Classic drop cookies with maraschino cherries and nuts - a colorful addition to any cookie platter.

instructions.text: Place shortening, vanilla, sugars and egg in a bowl and beat. Add nuts and cherries; mix well.
Sift together dry ingredients; mix about half of the sifted mixture into the batter.
Add remaining sifted mixture; knead dough with hands. Chill dough until firm.
Drop by teaspoonfuls onto an ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake at 400°F (200°C) for 6 to 8 minutes.
Garnish cookies, while still warm, with a sliver of cherry if desired.

notes: Pairs well with Sugar Cookie Cutouts for a cookie exchange

recipes.title: Buckeyes
recipes.description: Classic Ohio buckeye candies - peanut butter balls dipped in chocolate to resemble the nut of the buckeye tree.

instructions.text: Blend peanut butter, sugar, butter and vanilla.
Roll into 1-inch balls and place on a cookie sheet lined with wax paper.
Stick a toothpick into each ball, then chill in freezer until firm, about half an hour.
Stirring continuously, melt chocolate chips in a microwave oven or in the top of a double boiler.
Dip frozen peanut butter balls in the chocolate using the toothpick as a handle.
Leave a small circle of peanut butter showing at the top of the balls so they resemble a buckeye.
Put the dipped balls back on lined cookie sheet and refrigerate for 2 hours.

recipes.pan_size: Cookie sheets lined with wax paper
notes: Named after the Ohio state tree's nut
A beloved Midwestern holiday candy

recipes.title: Chocolate Drop Cookies
recipes.description: Soft, cake-like chocolate cookies made with buttermilk and cocoa - delicious with or without nuts.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 300°F (150°C). Lightly grease a cookie sheet or line it with parchment paper.
Mix dry ingredients (flour, baking soda, salt, cocoa).
Cream sugar and shortening, then beat in egg, buttermilk and vanilla.
Mix in nuts if using.
Place rounded tablespoons of dough on prepared baking sheets.
Bake 8 to 10 minutes.
Cool on baking sheet for 3 to 5 minutes before moving to a wire rack.

notes: Low baking temperature keeps cookies soft and cake-like

recipes.title: Almost Apple Pie
recipes.description: Apple pie filling sandwiched between a buttery oat crumb crust - all the flavors of apple pie in bar form.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Mix thoroughly for crumb mixture: oleo, brown sugar, flour, baking soda, salt, and rolled oats.
For apple mixture: Mix sliced apples with sugar and cinnamon.
Place half the crumb mixture in a greased 9x13" pan. Press and flatten with hands to cover bottom of pan.
Place apple mixture on pressed crust.
Cover with remaining crumb mixture. Pat lightly.
Bake at 375°F until golden and apples are tender.

notes: A wonderful fall dessert
Serve warm with vanilla ice cream

recipes.title: Grandmother's Nut Roll
recipes.source_note: Handwritten recipe card (partial - filling and rolling instructions)
recipes.description: Traditional walnut filling for nut roll or potica - a sweet, cinnamon-spiced walnut paste.

instructions.text: Combine walnut meats, sugar, cinnamon, and vanilla.
Add milk to make a spreadable paste.
Set on stove to heat gently (warming helps spread).
After dough rises, roll 1/4" thick in two parts.
Spread with nut mixture and roll like a jelly roll.
Place in greased bowl & set aside in warm place for 1/2 hour before baking.

notes: This is the filling portion of the recipe - use with your preferred sweet yeast dough
Similar to Poteca/Potica filling

flags: Partial recipe - filling and rolling instructions only, dough recipe on missing page

recipes.variant_notes: Similar filling to Poteca Loaf but with different proportions

recipes.title: Swedish Booch Cake (Raisin Cake)
recipes.source_note: Handwritten recipe card - 'Recipe from the kitchen of Elsie'
recipes.description: A moist raisin cake made with raisin broth for extra flavor, topped with a creamy vanilla frosting.

instructions.text: Boil 1 1/2 cups water with 1 cup raisins. Simmer 20 minutes.
Drain raisins, reserving 3/4 cup broth for the cake.
Add 1 tsp baking soda to the warm drained raisins and set aside.
Cream 3/4 cup oleo and 1 cup sugar. Add 1 egg and beat well.
Add 3/4 cup raisin broth and mix.
Sift flour with baking powder and spices. Add to creamed mixture.
Beat well. Fold in raisins and nuts. Add vanilla.
Pour into greased pan and bake at 350°F (175°C) until done.
FOR FROSTING: Beat 1 1/2 cups powdered sugar, 1/2 cup oleo, 1 egg, and 1 tsp vanilla until fluffy.
Frost cooled cake.

notes: The raisin broth adds moisture and deep flavor to the cake
Traditional Swedish-American recipe

recipes.title: Rhubarb Cake
recipes.description: A simple dump cake-style dessert with rhubarb, strawberry Jello, and marshmallows over a cake mix base.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a 9x13 pan.
Layer rhubarb in bottom of pan.
Sprinkle dry Jello over rhubarb.
Add marshmallows and sugar.
Prepare cake mix according to package directions and pour over top.
Bake for 1 hour.

notes: A dump cake style recipe - layers create a delicious fruit dessert

flags: Very brief recipe - instructions reconstructed from typical dump cake method

recipes.title: Refrigerator Lemon Cheesecake
recipes.source_note: Parade magazine - 'Cool Dessert for a Warm Day'
recipes.description: A light, no-bake cheesecake with a toasted oat crust and refreshing lemon filling - perfect for summer.

instructions.text: For crust: Toast oats in shallow baking pan in preheated 350°F oven about 10 minutes. Pour into bowl.
Add brown sugar; mix well. Add melted butter; mix thoroughly.
Pat into bottom of 9-inch spring-form pan. Refrigerate until ready to use.
For filling: Place gelatin in 2-cup liquid measuring cup. Add boiling water; stir until dissolved.
Add ice cubes to make 1 cup liquid; stir until melted. Set aside until ready to use.
Place cream cheese, sugar and vanilla in small mixer bowl; beat until creamy.
Add gelatin mixture. Fold in whipped evaporated milk.
Pour into crust and refrigerate several hours or overnight.
Decorate with grated lemon peel and whipped topping, if desired.

notes: *To whip evaporated milk: pour milk into freezer tray. Place in freezing compartment until ice crystals form around edges, then whip.
From Parade's Test Kitchen

recipes.title: Lemon Pudding Cake
recipes.description: A magical dessert that separates while baking into a light cake layer on top with lemon pudding underneath.

instructions.text: Heat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Beat egg whites until stiff. Set aside.
Beat egg yolks. Blend in lemon peel, juice and milk.
Add sugar, flour and salt. Beat until smooth.
Fold in beaten egg whites.
Pour into 1-quart casserole dish.
Place casserole in pan of hot water, 1 inch deep.
Bake 45-50 minutes until top is golden.

notes: The batter separates during baking - cake rises to top, pudding forms on bottom

recipes.title: Philip's Cherry Cheesecake
recipes.description: A simple baked cheesecake with a graham cracker crust, topped with cherry pie filling.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Soften cream cheese. Add sugar and vanilla; mix well.
Add beaten eggs and mix until smooth.
Pour into graham cracker crust.
Bake at 350°F for 40 minutes or until center is set.
Cool 3 hours or overnight.
Spread with cherry pie filling before serving.

recipes.pan_size: 9-inch pie plate with graham cracker crust
notes: Can use Neufchatel cheese for a lighter version

recipes.title: Date Nut Rolls
recipes.attribution: Lorraine Kalnins, for Mrs. R.K. Kinard
recipes.description: Old-fashioned date candy rolled with nuts - a traditional holiday confection.

instructions.text: Cook sugar, milk, margarine and salt to 234°F or until syrup forms soft ball in cold water.
Lower temperature, add dates and cook, stirring constantly until dates are melted in syrup.
Remove from heat. Add vanilla and nuts.
Beat until mixture is stiff, lighter in color and has lost its shine.
Form into a sausage-shaped roll, 1 1/2 inches in diameter.
Place on a wet cloth. Roll up. Let stand before slicing.

notes: A tried and true recipe
Rolling in wet cloth helps shape and cool the candy

recipes.title: Hermits Aboard Ship
recipes.description: Spiced bar cookies with dark corn syrup and raisins - a classic hermit recipe.

instructions.text: Grease and flour a 15x10x1-inch jellyroll pan.
Thoroughly stir together the flour, dry milk powder, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cinnamon and nutmeg.
In a large mixing bowl cream margarine and sugar.
Add corn syrup, water and egg. Gradually and thoroughly beat in flour mixture.
Stir in raisins.
Turn into prepared pan, spreading to edges.
Bake in a preheated 375°F oven until edges are brown - 25 minutes.
Cool in pan placed on wire rack.
Cut into 3 by 2 inch bars. Remove with a small metal spatula.
Store in a tightly covered tin box.

notes: Left side of clipping cut off - some ingredient amounts estimated
Hermits are a traditional New England spiced cookie

flags: Left side of clipping cut off - some ingredients partially reconstructed

recipes.title: Coffee Scotch Cookies
recipes.description: Rich butterscotch-flavored cookies with a hint of coffee and crunchy nuts.

ingredients.prep_note: or 1 cup white sugar + 1 tsp molasses

instructions.text: Cream butter, sugar, and coffee together until smooth.
Add white sugar and salt; cream well.
Add vanilla. Beat in eggs.
Sift flour and soda together; stir into batter.
Add nuts; mix well.
Shape dough into 2½-inch diameter rolls. Wrap and refrigerate to chill until firm.
Slice ¼ inch thick and place on ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 8-10 minutes until lightly browned.

notes: Instant coffee adds a subtle mocha flavor to these butterscotch cookies

recipes.title: Dry Milk Whipped Topping
recipes.description: A light whipped topping made from non-fat dry milk, a clever alternative to heavy cream.

instructions.text: Pour water, vanilla, and lemon juice into a deep 1-quart bowl.
Sprinkle dry milk powder over the water.
Beat with an electric beater until stiff, about 7-10 minutes.
Chill ½ hour before serving.

notes: For Orange Topping: add 1 tbsp grated orange rind

recipes.title: Jean's Butterscotch Pudding
recipes.description: A homemade butterscotch pudding made with brown sugar and egg yolks.

instructions.text: In a saucepan, combine brown sugar, flour, and cornstarch.
Beat egg yolks with milk and add to sugar mixture.
Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until thickened.
Remove from heat. Stir in butter and vanilla.
Pour into serving dishes and chill until set.

recipes.title: Mary's Glaze
recipes.description: A simple fruit glaze made with Jello, perfect for topping fruit pies or cheesecakes.

instructions.text: Mix water and cornstarch together until smooth.
Add Jello package.
Bring to a boil, stirring constantly, until clear and thickened.
Cool slightly before using as a glaze.

notes: Use strawberry Jello for strawberry pie, raspberry for berry desserts, etc.

recipes.title: Rhubarb Cream Pie
recipes.description: A classic custard-style rhubarb pie with a creamy filling. Multiple family versions exist.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 450°F (230°C).
Mix sugar, flour, and nutmeg together in a bowl.
Add beaten eggs and butter; mix well.
Place rhubarb in unbaked pie crust.
Pour the sugar-egg mixture over the rhubarb.
Bake at 450°F (230°C) for 10 minutes.
Reduce heat to 350°F (175°C) and bake for 30 minutes more, until filling is set.

notes: The high initial temperature helps set the crust, then lower temperature cooks the custard gently
recipes.variant_notes: See also: Virginia's Rhubarb Pie, Norma's Rhubarb Cream Pie, Martey's Rhubarb Cream Pie Custard

recipes.title: Virginia's Rhubarb Pie
recipes.description: Virginia's version of rhubarb pie with a longer baking time at lower temperature.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Beat egg lightly. Mix with sugar and flour.
Add water and mix well.
Place rhubarb in pie crust. Pour mixture over rhubarb.
Dot with margarine.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for about 1 hour until set and golden.

recipes.title: Norma's Rhubarb Cream Pie
recipes.source_note: Handwritten on 'Messages' notepad with teddy bear
recipes.description: Norma's version uses more rhubarb (4 cups) and a longer baking time.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Mix sugar, flour, and nutmeg together.
Add beaten eggs and mix well.
Place rhubarb in pie crust. Pour egg mixture over rhubarb.
Bake at 400°F (200°C) for 50-60 minutes until set and golden.

notes: Uses more rhubarb and nutmeg than other versions

recipes.title: Martey's Rhubarb Cream Pie Custard
recipes.description: Martey's custard-style rhubarb pie with water added for a creamier filling.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 450°F (230°C).
Mix sugar, flour, and nutmeg together. Add beaten eggs, butter, and water; mix well ahead of time.
Place rhubarb in pie crust. Pour custard mixture over rhubarb.
Bake at 450°F (230°C) for 10 minutes.
Reduce heat to 350°F (175°C) and bake for 30 minutes more until set.

notes: Mix custard ahead for smoother texture

recipes.title: Simple Rhubarb Pie
recipes.description: A simpler rhubarb pie with just one egg and basic ingredients.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Mix sugar and flour. Add whipped egg and water.
Place rhubarb in pie crust. Pour mixture over rhubarb. Dot with butter.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 45 minutes until set.

recipes.title: Key Lime Pie (Baked)
recipes.description: A classic baked Key lime pie with a light, fluffy filling using separated eggs.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 325°F (165°C).
Beat yolks of 4 eggs and white of 1 egg together until mixture is light colored and thick.
Add sweetened condensed milk and beat thoroughly.
Add lime juice and rind; stir until mixture thickens.
Beat remaining 3 egg whites until stiff. Fold into lime mixture.
Pour into baked pie shell.
Bake at 325°F (165°C) for about 15 to 20 minutes, or until set.
Decorate with whipped cream and grated lime rind if you wish.

notes: Use fresh Key limes for best flavor
Regular lime juice can substitute but flavor differs

recipes.title: Key Lime Pie (Key West Cook Book)
recipes.description: A no-bake Key lime pie with gelatin that sets without baking, from the Key West Cook Book.

instructions.text: Soak gelatin in lime juice and let dissolve.
Separate yolks from whites of eggs. Put ½ of the sugar in each bowl.
Beat yolk mixture until lemon colored.
Add lime juice with gelatin and sweetened condensed milk. Beat all thoroughly.
Beat egg whites with remaining sugar until stiff. Fold into lime mixture.
Pour into baked pastry shell.
Allow to set until congealed (refrigerate).
Sprinkle with grated green lime rind if desired.

notes: No-bake recipe - pie sets with gelatin
From the Key West Cook Book

recipes.title: Mile High Key Lime Pie
recipes.description: A lighter, no-bake Key lime pie using reduced-fat ingredients and Cool Whip for a fluffy texture.

instructions.text: Combine condensed milk, sour cream, lime juice, and food coloring in a bowl.
Mix well until thoroughly combined.
Fold in Cool Whip until evenly blended.
Pour into graham cracker crust.
Refrigerate at least 12 hours before serving.

notes: Reduced-fat version using fat-free condensed milk and reduced-fat sour cream

recipes.title: Refrigerator Millionaire's Pie
recipes.description: A no-bake tropical pie with pecans, coconut, and pineapple in a creamy filling.

instructions.text: In medium bowl, mix condensed milk, whipped topping, pecans, coconut, and drained pineapple.
When well mixed, add lemon juice.
Pour into pie crusts.
Garnish with cherries or favorite fruit if desired.
Refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.

notes: Makes 2 pies - great for gatherings

recipes.title: Baked Millionaire's Pie
recipes.source_note: Newspaper clipping ('You Asked for It' column, St. Petersburg Times)
recipes.description: A rich, baked pie loaded with coconut, chocolate chips, and pecans in a caramel-like filling.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 325°F (165°C).
Toss together coconut flakes, chocolate chips, and chopped pecans. Place in partially baked pie shell.
Mix sugars, salt, and melted margarine.
Beat in corn syrup and vanilla.
Gently fold beaten eggs into sugar mixture.
Pour evenly over ingredients in pie shell.
Bake at 325°F (165°C) for 55 to 65 minutes, or until deep golden brown on top and nearly set in center.
Cool at room temperature before serving.

notes: Similar to a Derby pie or pecan pie with added chocolate and coconut

recipes.title: Better Than Sex Cake
recipes.description: A layered poke cake with pineapple, bananas, pudding, and whipped topping. Best made 2 days ahead.

instructions.text: Bake yellow cake according to package directions in a 9x13 pan.
While cake is hot, boil sugar and crushed pineapple with syrup for 5 minutes.
Pour hot pineapple mixture over hot cake. Let cool completely.
Layer sliced bananas over cooled cake.
Prepare instant vanilla pudding according to package directions. Spread over bananas.
Top with Cool Whip.
Garnish with chopped nuts and maraschino cherries.
Refrigerate for 2 days before serving for best flavor.

notes: Must refrigerate 2 days for flavors to meld
A Southern potluck classic

recipes.title: ABC Ice Box Lemon Pie
recipes.description: A tangy lemon pie with a cooked filling and meringue topping, browned under the broiler.

instructions.text: Blend 1 cup sugar and cornstarch in a saucepan.
Add water and lemon juice. Beat together until smooth.
Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until thickened.
Beat egg yolks with lemon zest. Add to lemon mixture and cook well, stirring constantly.
Pour into graham cracker shell. Let cool.
Beat egg whites with 1/4 cup sugar and cream of tartar until stiff peaks form.
Spread meringue over filling, sealing to edges.
Brown under broiler, watching carefully to avoid burning.

notes: Watch meringue carefully under broiler - it browns quickly

recipes.title: Graham Cracker Crust
recipes.description: A simple homemade graham cracker crust with an oil option for a healthier version.

ingredients.prep_note: melted (OR 1/4 cup oleo + 1/4 cup canola oil)

instructions.text: Combine graham cracker crumbs, melted margarine (or oleo/oil mixture), and sugar.
Mix until well combined and crumbly.
Press firmly into bottom and up sides of pie pan.
Use as directed in recipe, or bake at 350°F for 8-10 minutes for a crispier crust.

notes: Can substitute half the margarine with canola oil for a lighter crust

recipes.title: Linda's Pie
recipes.description: A simple no-bake cream cheese pie, light and creamy.

instructions.text: Beat cream cheese and sugar together until smooth.
Fold in Cool Whip until well blended.
Pour into graham cracker crust.
Refrigerate until set, at least 2 hours.

notes: Top with fresh fruit if desired

recipes.title: Ethel's Pie Crust
recipes.description: A tender, flaky pie crust made with Crisco, egg, and a touch of vinegar.

ingredients.prep_note: enough to make 1 cup with egg

instructions.text: Mix flour, Crisco, salt, and baking powder until crumbly.
Beat egg in a measuring cup. Add water to make 1 cup total liquid.
Add vinegar to egg-water mixture.
Add wet ingredients to flour mixture and mix until dough forms.
Divide into portions and roll out for pies.

notes: The vinegar helps make a tender, flaky crust
Makes enough for 3-4 single crusts

recipes.title: Janet's Pie
recipes.description: A creamy no-bake pie with cream cheese, with an optional peanut butter variation.

instructions.text: Beat cream cheese and sugar (or peanut butter) together until smooth.
Add half of the Cool Whip (about 6 oz) and mix well.
Pour into prepared crust.
Spread remaining Cool Whip on top.
Refrigerate until set.

notes: For peanut butter version: substitute 3/4 cup or more peanut butter for the sugar

recipes.title: Cream Cheese Jello
recipes.description: A creamy Jello salad or dessert with cream cheese for richness.

instructions.text: Soften cream cheese in a bowl.
Dissolve Jello in hot water, stirring until completely dissolved.
Add Jello mixture to cream cheese and mix until smooth.
Add cold water and mix well.
Pour into mold or dish and refrigerate until set, about 4 hours.

notes: Use 2 boxes Jello for stronger flavor
Can add fruit when partially set

recipes.title: Janet's Fruit Pie Glaze
recipes.description: A versatile Jello-based glaze for fresh fruit pies, can be sweetened with Equal or sugar.

instructions.text: Combine Jello, water, and cornstarch in a saucepan.
Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until thick and clear.
Remove from heat and add Equal or sugar to taste.
For blueberry pie, use any red Jello. For peaches, use orange Jello.
Add fresh fruit to glaze and pour into pie crust.

notes: Red Jello works for blueberry pie
Orange Jello for peach pie
Can use sugar-free sweetener

recipes.title: Fudge Batter Pudding
recipes.description: A magical self-saucing chocolate pudding that creates its own fudge sauce on the bottom while baking.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Mix melted oleo, 1/2 cup sugar, and vanilla.
Sift together flour, 4 tbsp cocoa, baking powder, and salt. Add to sugar mixture alternately with milk.
Stir in chopped nuts. Pour into greased 8x8 baking dish.
Mix remaining 1/2 cup sugar and 4 tbsp cocoa; sprinkle over batter.
Pour boiling water over top. Do not stir.
Bake at 350°F for 40 minutes. Pudding will have chocolate sauce on bottom and cake on top.

notes: The boiling water creates a fudge sauce that sinks to the bottom
Serve warm with ice cream

recipes.title: Mary's Cookies
recipes.description: Oatmeal raisin cookies where the eggs and raisins are beaten together first for extra flavor.

instructions.text: Beat eggs, add raisins and vanilla. Let stand 1 hour (or beat until raisins are blended).
Cream oleo and sugars together.
Mix flour, salt, baking soda, and cinnamon. Add to creamed mixture.
Stir in oatmeal, then fold in egg-raisin mixture.
Drop by spoonfuls onto baking sheet.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 12 minutes.

notes: Variation: use 2 eggs and cut sugar to 1 1/2 cups total
Letting eggs stand with raisins softens the raisins

recipes.title: Min's Raisin Drop Cookies
recipes.description: Soft raisin cookies where the raisins are simmered until plump before adding to the dough.

instructions.text: Simmer raisins in water until water is absorbed. Cool.
Cream shortening, sugar, and eggs until fluffy.
Add vanilla.
Mix flour, baking soda, and salt. Add dry ingredients to creamed mixture.
Fold in cooled raisins. May need to add a little more flour.
Shape into balls and roll in sugar.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 10-12 minutes until lightly browned.

notes: Simmering the raisins makes them extra plump and flavorful

recipes.title: Date Filling
recipes.description: A simple cooked date filling for cookies, bars, or pastries.

instructions.text: Combine dates, water, and sugar in a saucepan.
Cook slowly over low heat, stirring frequently, until thick.
Cool before using as a filling.

notes: Use for date bars, filled cookies, or thumbprint cookies

recipes.title: Betty Crocker's Dropped Filled Cookies
recipes.description: A versatile drop cookie base that can be filled with your choice of filling.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Mix shortening and brown sugar together until creamy.
Beat in eggs.
Stir in sour milk (or buttermilk or water).
Mix flour, baking soda, and salt. Add to wet ingredients and mix well.
Drop by teaspoonfuls onto greased cookie sheet. Place 1/2 tsp filling on top of each, then cover with another teaspoon of dough.
Bake at 400°F (200°C) for 8-10 minutes.

notes: Use your own filling - date, raisin, mincemeat, or fruit jam
Recipe continues on back of card

recipes.title: Orange Kiss-Me Cake
recipes.description: A moist orange cake made by grinding a whole orange with raisins and walnuts, topped with a cinnamon-walnut streusel.

ingredients.prep_note: pulp and rind, reserve juice for topping

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour a 12x8x2 or 13x9x2 inch pan.
Grind together the orange (pulp and rind), raisins, and 1/4 cup walnuts. Reserve juice for topping.
Sift together flour, baking soda, salt, and 1 cup sugar.
Add shortening and 3/4 cup milk. Beat for 2 minutes (300 strokes) until well blended.
Add eggs and 1/4 cup milk. Beat for 2 minutes.
Fold orange mixture into batter.
Pour into prepared pan. Bake at 350°F for 40-50 minutes.
Drip 1/3 cup orange juice over warm cake.
Combine 1/3 cup sugar, cinnamon, and 1/4 cup chopped walnuts. Sprinkle over cake. Decorate with orange slices.

notes: If using self-rising flour, omit salt and decrease soda to 1/4 teaspoon

recipes.title: Elsie's Old Fruit Cake
recipes.description: A spiced applesauce fruit cake with cocoa, dates, raisins, and nuts.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 325°F (165°C). Grease and flour a 9x13 inch pan or tube pan.
Cream sugar and shortening. Add eggs and beat well.
Mix flour, salt, spices, cocoa, and baking soda.
Add dry ingredients alternately with applesauce to creamed mixture.
Fold in dates, raisins, and nuts.
Pour into prepared pan. Bake at 325°F for 60 minutes until done.

notes: The cocoa adds depth without making it a chocolate cake

recipes.title: Elsie's Date Nut Cake (ALT)
recipes.description: A dense, rich fruit and nut cake loaded with dates, nuts, and candied cherries.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 300°F (150°C). Grease and flour a tube pan or loaf pans.
Combine nuts, dates, pineapple, and cherries in a large bowl.
Beat eggs with salt and sugar until light.
Sift flour and baking powder together. Add to egg mixture.
Pour batter over fruit and nut mixture. Stir to coat.
Pack into prepared pan. Bake at 300°F for about 1 hour.

notes: The batter is minimal - mostly coating the fruits and nuts

recipes.title: Guava Sauce Cake
recipes.description: A tropical Florida cake made with guava sauce, loaded with fruit and pecans.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 300°F (150°C). Grease and flour a tube pan.
Cream sugar and oleo. Add eggs and beat well.
Add guava sauce and mix.
Sift flour, soda, and baking powder. Add to batter.
Fold in fruit and pecans.
Pour into prepared pan. Bake at 300°F for about 1 hour.

notes: A Florida specialty using guava sauce
Noted as 'My last recipe' - perhaps a treasured family recipe

recipes.title: Neiman Marcus $250 Cookies
recipes.description: The legendary oatmeal chocolate chip cookies with grated Hershey bar, supposedly charged at $250.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Blend oatmeal in blender to a fine powder.
Cream butter and sugars. Add eggs and vanilla.
Mix flour, blended oatmeal, salt, baking powder, and soda. Add to creamed mixture.
Stir in chocolate chips, grated Hershey bar, and nuts.
Roll into balls. Bake at 375°F for about 10 minutes.

notes: The famous urban legend recipe
Blending the oatmeal is the secret
Recipe can be halved

recipes.title: Dump Cake
recipes.description: The ultimate easy cake - just dump the ingredients and bake. Cherry and pineapple with cake mix.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a 13x15 inch oblong pan, dump crushed pineapple and spread evenly.
Spoon cherry pie filling on top of pineapple.
Spread dry cake mix evenly over cherry and pineapple mixture.
Slice margarine into patties and place on top of cake mix.
Top with nuts.
Bake at 350°F for approximately 30 minutes or until top is golden brown.

notes: No mixing required - literally dump and bake
Serve warm with ice cream or whipped cream

recipes.title: Reese's Chocolate Peanut Butter Cookies
recipes.description: Rich chocolate cookies studded with peanut butter chips, inspired by Reese's candy.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Mix flour, cocoa, and soda together well.
In another bowl, cream butter and sugar. Add eggs and vanilla; beat well.
Add dry ingredients to creamed mixture; mix well.
Stir in peanut butter chips.
Drop by spoonfuls onto cookie sheets.
Bake at 350°F for 8-9 minutes. Do not overbake!

notes: Do not overbake - they should be slightly soft when done
Use more cocoa for deeper chocolate flavor

recipes.title: Jubilee Jumbles
recipes.description: Soft, cakey cookies with evaporated milk, frosted with burnt butter glaze while warm.

instructions.text: Mix shortening, sugars, and eggs together.
Stir in 1 cup evaporated milk and vanilla.
Sift flour, soda, and salt together. Stir into batter. Add nuts.
Chill dough for 1 hour.
Drop by spoonfuls onto greased cookie sheet. Bake at 375°F for 10-12 minutes.
For Burnt Butter Glaze: Heat 2 tsp butter until browned. Beat in confectioners sugar and 1/4 cup evaporated milk until smooth.
Frost cookies while still warm.

notes: Variations: Add 1 cup coconut, OR seedless raisins, OR chocolate chips
The burnt butter frosting is the signature touch
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 794.jpeg

recipes.title: Gen's Nut Cookies
recipes.description: Rich sour cream cookies rolled out, dipped in egg white, then coated in cinnamon-sugar nuts.

instructions.text: Cream shortening and sugars. Add egg yolks, vanilla, and 1 tbsp cinnamon. Mix well.
Add flour alternately with sour cream. Stir in 1 cup ground nuts.
Mix together coating: 1 cup ground nuts, 4 tbsp sugar, and 1 tsp cinnamon.
Roll out cookies. Dip in slightly beaten egg whites, then coat in nut mixture.
Place on cookie sheets. Bake at 350°F for 10-12 minutes until lightly browned.

notes: The sour cream makes these incredibly tender
The nut coating gives a beautiful finish
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 796.jpeg

recipes.title: Chocolate Dipped Macaroons
recipes.description: Chewy coconut macaroons dipped in melted semi-sweet chocolate for an elegant finish.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 325°F (165°C). Grease and flour cookie sheets.
Mix coconut, sugar, flour, and salt together.
Stir in egg whites and almond extract; blend well.
Drop by tablespoons onto prepared cookie sheets.
Bake at 325°F for 20 minutes or until edges are golden brown.
Remove to wire rack to cool completely.
Melt chocolate. Dip half of each macaroon into melted chocolate.
Place on wax paper lined tray. Refrigerate until chocolate is firm.

notes: Can dip fully or just half of each cookie
Store in airtight container

recipes.title: Filled Oatmeal Cookies
recipes.description: Rolled oatmeal cookies meant to be filled with date or fruit filling.

instructions.text: Cream shortening, butter, and brown sugar together.
Add eggs and beat well.
Mix flour, baking powder, salt, and baking soda. Add to creamed mixture.
Stir in oats.
Roll out dough 1/4 inch thick on floured surface.
Cut with cookie cutter. Place on cookie sheets.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 10-12 minutes.
Cool and sandwich with date filling or jam.

notes: Use date filling recipe for traditional filled cookies
Can use any jam or preserves

recipes.title: Chuck Fruit Cake Cookies
recipes.description: Drop cookies loaded with candied fruit, dates, and nuts - like fruitcake in cookie form.

instructions.text: Cut candied fruit. Add dates and fruit cake mix. Dredge with 1 cup flour.
Add chopped nuts to fruit mixture.
Cream butter and brown sugar until fluffy.
Beat in eggs, vanilla, and rum flavoring.
Mix remaining 2 1/2 cups flour with soda and cinnamon. Blend into creamed mixture.
Mix fruit and dates into batter very well. May need extra flour.
Drop by spoonfuls onto cookie sheets. Bake at 350°F for 10-15 minutes.

notes: Usually needs extra flour
Great for holidays

recipes.title: Chocolate Chunk Cookies
recipes.description: Oatmeal chocolate chunk cookies with a touch of molasses for depth.

ingredients.prep_note: (or 1 cup total white sugar with 1 tsp molasses)

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Chop chocolate into chunks (or use chocolate chips).
Cream oleo and sugars. Add molasses if using. Beat in egg and vanilla.
Mix flour, oats, and baking soda. Stir into creamed mixture.
Fold in chocolate chunks and nuts.
Drop by spoonfuls onto cookie sheets. Bake at 375°F for 10 minutes.

notes: Molasses adds depth but can substitute 1 cup white sugar for the brown/white combo

recipes.title: Sheila's Chocolate Chip Cookies
recipes.description: A classic chocolate chip cookie recipe.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Mix flour, baking soda, and salt in a bowl. Set aside.
In another bowl, beat softened butter with sugars, vanilla, and water until creamy.
Add eggs and beat well.
Add flour mixture and mix until combined.
Stir in chocolate chips.
Drop by spoonfuls onto cookie sheets. Bake at 375°F for about 10 minutes.

notes: A touch of water helps with texture

recipes.title: Pecan Pie Cookies
recipes.description: Buttery cookies with a gooey pecan pie filling pressed into each one - like miniature pecan pies.

instructions.text: For cookies: Stir together oleo, sugar, dark syrup, and egg yolks. Beat thoroughly.
Stir in flour. Chill dough several hours.
For filling: Cook confectioners sugar, butter, and corn syrup over medium heat until mixture reaches full boil.
Remove from heat, stir in pecans. Chill filling.
Beat egg whites slightly.
Roll dough into balls and brush with egg white. Place on greased cookie sheet, leave 2 inches between each.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 7-8 minutes.
Roll 1/2 tsp pecan filling into ball and press into center of each cookie.
Bake 5 minutes longer, or until lightly browned.

notes: The filling is added partway through baking
Like mini pecan pies in cookie form

recipes.title: Norma's Potato Chip Cookies
recipes.description: Unique buttery cookies with crushed potato chips for a sweet-salty crunch.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Cream butter and sugar. Add vanilla and mix well.
Stir in crushed potato chips and chopped nuts.
Add flour and mix until combined.
Form into balls and place on cookie sheet. Press down slightly.
Bake at 350°F for 10-12 minutes until lightly browned.

notes: The potato chips add a wonderful salty crunch
A vintage classic

recipes.title: Chocolate Cake (My Recipe)
recipes.source_note: Handwritten recipe ('my recipe') - Also known as 'Crazy Cake' - Grandma Baker's recipe
recipes.description: A vintage wacky cake style chocolate cake made without eggs, using vinegar for leavening. Includes chocolate frosting.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a 9x13 inch pan.
Mix flour, 2 cups sugar, 6 tbsp cocoa, and salt in pan.
Make 3 wells. Pour oil in one, vanilla in another, vinegar in third.
Pour water over all and mix until smooth. Add baking soda and mix quickly.
Bake at 350°F for 30-35 minutes until done.
For frosting: Combine 1 cup sugar, oleo, remaining cocoa, and milk in saucepan.
Bring to boil, stirring constantly. Boil 1 minute. Pour over warm cake.

notes: No eggs required - a Depression-era 'wacky cake'
The vinegar reacts with baking soda for leavening
Grandma Baker (Fran) called this 'Crazy Cake'
After cooling, Grandma would coat with a generous layer of peanut butter, then pour 3-minute fudge on top
3-minute fudge recipe is in MomMom Baker's collection

recipes.title: Utterly Deadly Southern Pecan Pie
recipes.description: A rich Southern pecan pie made with cane syrup, boiled sugar, and plenty of pecans.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C) - moderate oven.
Boil sugar and cane syrup together for 2-3 minutes.
Beat eggs until not too stiff.
Pour hot syrup slowly into beaten eggs, mixing constantly.
Add butter, vanilla, and pecan meats (broken rather coarsely).
Turn into raw pie shell.
Bake in moderate oven about 45 minutes, or until set.

notes: The name says it all - incredibly rich!
Southern cane syrup is key for authentic flavor

recipes.title: Rum Balls
recipes.description: Classic no-bake rum balls made with vanilla wafers, pecans, cocoa, and rum, rolled in confectioners sugar.

instructions.text: Grind vanilla wafers into fine crumbs.
Grind pecans.
Mix all ingredients together (crumbs, pecans, cocoa, corn syrup, rum).
Rub hands with confectioners sugar and roll mixture into 1/2-inch balls.
Roll balls in confectioners sugar.
Refrigerate for 1 hour.
Roll again in confectioners sugar before serving.

notes: No baking required
Best made a day ahead to allow flavors to meld

recipes.title: Hanna Baker's Raisin Cookies
recipes.description: Soft raisin cookies with warm spices and chopped nuts, made with boiled raisins for extra moistness.

instructions.text: Add 1 cup of water to 2 cups seedless raisins and boil for 5 minutes. Cool.
Cream 1 cup shortening, add 2 cups sugar.
Add 3 eggs and beat well.
Add 1 teaspoon salt and cooled raisin mixture. Add 1 cup chopped nut meats.
Sift together 4 cups sifted flour, 1 tsp baking powder, 1 tsp baking soda, 2 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp cinnamon, 1/4 tsp each nutmeg and allspice.
Add dry ingredients to raisin mixture and blend.
Drop by teaspoons onto greased cookie sheet.
Wet fork and press down slightly.
Bake at 400°F (200°C) for 12 to 15 minutes.

notes: Boiling the raisins first makes them plump and adds moisture to the cookies

recipes.title: Rhubarb Cake (Jello Dump Cake)
recipes.description: A simple dump cake with rhubarb, strawberry jello, and marshmallows, baked and served upside down with whipped cream.

instructions.text: Layer cut up rhubarb in bottom of baking pan.
Sprinkle sugar over rhubarb.
Sprinkle dry strawberry jello over sugar.
Add layer of mini marshmallows.
Sprinkle dry cake mix on top.
Bake until done.
Turn upside down to serve. Serve with whipped cream.

notes: Dump cake style - no mixing required
May need to drizzle melted butter over cake mix before baking

flags: Temperature and bake time not specified in original

recipes.variant_notes: Simplified dump cake version with jello

recipes.title: Elda's No Fail Pie Crust
recipes.description: A reliable pie crust recipe using Spry shortening, egg, and vinegar for tenderness.

instructions.text: Mix flour and salt together.
Cut in Spry (shortening) until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Beat egg with vinegar.
Add egg mixture and water to flour mixture.
Mix until dough comes together (add water as needed).
Divide into portions, roll out, and use as needed.

notes: Vinegar makes the crust tender
Spry can be substituted with Crisco or other shortening

recipes.title: Cracker Candy (Christmas Crack)
recipes.description: Addictive toffee-topped saltine crackers with melted chocolate - also known as Christmas Crack.

instructions.text: Line a 9x13 inch pan with one layer of soda crackers.
In a saucepan, simmer 1 cup oleo and 1 cup brown sugar for 3 minutes.
Pour toffee mixture over crackers.
Put in 450°F (230°C) oven for 5 minutes.
Remove from oven and immediately sprinkle chocolate chips over top.
Let chocolate melt, then spread evenly around.
Cool completely before breaking into pieces.

notes: Also known as 'Christmas Crack' due to its addictive nature
Can add chopped nuts on top of chocolate if desired

recipes.title: Hurricane Cake
recipes.description: A German chocolate cake baked over a coconut-nut base with swirled cream cheese topping. Also known as Earthquake Cake.

instructions.text: Spray a 9x13 inch pan.
Mix nuts and coconut evenly on bottom of pan.
Prepare cake mix according to package directions.
Pour batter on top of nut mixture. Do not mix.
Beat butter, powdered sugar, and cream cheese until smooth.
Drop cream cheese mixture by teaspoon on top of batter (do not drop by edge of pan).
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 55 minutes.

notes: Also called Earthquake Cake - the cream cheese sinks and creates 'fault lines'
Do not mix layers - they create marbled effect when baked

recipes.title: Refrigerator Oatmeal Cookies
recipes.description: Crispy slice-and-bake oatmeal cookies made with lard for extra goodness.

instructions.text: Cream shortening (lard), gradually add brown and white sugar, beating until light.
Add well-beaten eggs and vanilla and mix well.
Sift flour, baking powder, and salt together several times. Stir into first mixture.
Add rolled oats and nuts and stir until thoroughly mixed.
Form into long rolls and chill in refrigerator several hours, preferably overnight.
Slice very thin and bake on ungreased cookie sheet at 350°F (175°C) for 7 to 8 minutes.
Bake slightly longer if cookies are cut thicker.

notes: Lard gives these cookies extra crispness and flavor

recipes.title: Ginger Snaps
recipes.description: Crisp, spicy ginger snap cookies with bread crumbs for extra crunch.

instructions.text: Sift together flour, sugar, soda, salt, cinnamon, and ginger.
Add crumbs, molasses, shortening, and water. Mix together thoroughly.
Roll thin on lightly floured board and cut with cookie cutter.
Bake on ungreased baking sheet at 375°F (190°C) for 10 minutes.

notes: Bread crumbs add extra crispness to these cookies

recipes.title: Pineapple Cookies
recipes.description: Soft, fruity drop cookies made with crushed pineapple and chopped nuts.

instructions.text: Cream shortening. Add sugar slowly and continue creaming.
Add eggs, slightly beaten. Blend well.
Add vanilla and pineapple.
Mix and sift dry ingredients. Add to first mixture gradually.
With the last addition of flour mixture, add nut meats.
Drop cookies from teaspoon on a greased cookie sheet.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) about 12 minutes.

notes: Use undrained pineapple for moist, flavorful cookies

recipes.title: Quick 'n Easy Key Lime Pie with Foolproof Meringue
recipes.description: A quick key lime pie with cooked cornstarch-stabilized meringue that won't weep.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 300°F (150°C).
In a small saucepan, combine cornstarch, sugar, and water. Cook and stir until thick and clear. Set aside.
Beat egg yolks slightly. Stir in condensed milk. Add lime juice and blend well.
Spread filling in warm pie crust.
Whip egg whites and salt until soft peaks form.
Continue beating while spooning in the warm cornstarch mixture. Continue whipping until stiff peaks form.
Spread meringue over filling, sealing to edge of crust.
Bake at 300°F (150°C) for about 30 minutes.
Cool completely on a rack out of drafts before refrigerating.

notes: The cornstarch stabilizes the meringue to prevent weeping

recipes.title: Min's Famous Lemon Pie
recipes.description: A classic lemon meringue pie with a tangy filling and fluffy meringue topping.

instructions.text: Combine cornstarch, 1 1/4 cups sugar, lemon juice, and lemon rind.
Beat egg yolks and add to cornstarch mixture.
Gradually add boiling water, stirring constantly.
Heat to boiling point and boil gently 4 minutes, stirring all the time.
Pour into baked pie shell.
Beat egg whites until stiff but not dry.
Gradually beat in the 6 tablespoons sugar.
Spread meringue over top of pie, carefully sealing in all the filling.
Bake in hot oven at 425°F (220°C) for 4-5 minutes or until browned.
Cool on cake rack away from drafts. Serve cold.

notes: Cool away from drafts to prevent meringue from weeping

recipes.title: Spice Cake
recipes.description: A moist spice cake made with strong coffee, sour milk, and raisins, topped with egg white frosting.

instructions.text: Cream shortening with brown sugar.
Add egg yolks (reserve whites for frosting).
Add coffee and spices.
Add sour milk with baking soda dissolved in it.
Fold in chopped raisins.
Add flour gradually until batter is proper consistency.
Bake in greased pan at 350°F (175°C) until done.
Frost with egg white frosting.

notes: Use whites of eggs for frosting (7-minute frosting style)

flags: Flour amount flexible - 'enough to make batter'
Temperature not specified - standard cake temp used

recipes.title: Crazy Cake with Fudge Frosting
recipes.description: A classic Depression-era chocolate cake made without eggs, milk, or butter, topped with quick fudge frosting.

instructions.text: For cake: Mix flour, 2 cups sugar, 6 tbsp cocoa, baking soda, and salt in a large bowl.
Add water and oil. Beat until smooth.
Pour into greased 9x13 pan.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 25-30 minutes.
For frosting: Combine 1 cup sugar, cocoa, butter, milk, and salt in saucepan.
Bring to a full boil and boil for 1 1/2 minutes.
Remove from heat, add vanilla, and spread on cooled cake.

notes: Also known as Wacky Cake or Depression Cake
No eggs, milk, or butter in the cake itself

recipes.title: Snickerdoodles
recipes.description: Classic cinnamon-sugar coated cookies with cream of tartar for that signature tangy flavor.

instructions.text: Mix shortening, 1 1/2 cups sugar, and eggs together.
Sift flour, cream of tartar, baking soda, and salt. Stir into creamed mixture.
Chill dough.
Mix 2 tsp sugar and 2 tsp cinnamon together for rolling.
Roll dough into balls the size of small walnuts.
Roll balls in cinnamon-sugar mixture.
Bake until lightly browned.

notes: Cream of tartar gives these their distinctive tangy flavor
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 845.jpeg

flags: Temperature not specified - standard cookie temp used

recipes.title: English Toffee
recipes.description: Classic buttery toffee with pecans, cooked in a skillet.

instructions.text: Melt oleo in skillet until it bubbles but does not brown.
Add sugar, water, and pecans.
Cook over moderate heat until sugar is light brown.
Pour into greased pan.
Blot excess oleo with paper towel.
Cool and break into pieces.

notes: Blotting excess butter helps the toffee set properly

recipes.title: English Toffee (Dorie's Chocolate-Topped)
recipes.description: Buttery toffee cooked to hard crack stage, topped with melted chocolate and nuts.

instructions.text: Cook sugar and butter together to 310°F (hard crack stage).
Remove from heat and stir in 1/2 cup almonds or pecans.
Spread on flat surface to cool.
Melt 12 oz chocolate bar over hot water.
Pour melted chocolate over cooled candy.
Break up when cool.

notes: Use a candy thermometer for best results
recipes.variant_notes: Chocolate-topped version with candy thermometer method

recipes.title: Crazy Cake with Peanut Butter
recipes.description: Depression-era chocolate cake with vinegar, topped with fudge frosting and peanut butter.

instructions.text: Mix flour, 2 cups sugar, 6 tbsp cocoa, baking soda, and salt.
Add vinegar, oil, vanilla, and water. Mix well.
Pour into greased 9x13 pan. Bake at 350°F (175°C) for about 30 minutes.
Cool slightly and spread peanut butter on top.
For frosting: Combine 1 cup sugar, 1/4 cup cocoa, liquid, butter, and salt.
Bring to good boil, cook for 1 1/2 minutes.
Add vanilla and beat to spreading consistency.
Spread over peanut butter layer.

notes: Double frosting recipe and cook 3 min for fudge consistency
Peanut butter layer goes under the frosting
recipes.variant_notes: Adds peanut butter layer between cake and frosting

recipes.title: No Bake Oatmeal Fudge Cookies
recipes.description: Quick no-bake cookies with chocolate, peanut butter, and oatmeal.

instructions.text: Combine sugar, milk, butter, and cocoa in a saucepan.
Bring to a boil and boil for 1-2 minutes (to soft ball stage).
Remove from heat.
Add peanut butter, vanilla, and oatmeal. Mix well.
Drop by spoonfuls onto wax paper.
Let cool and set.

notes: Work quickly - mixture sets fast
Marked as 'Best recipe' on original card

recipes.title: Shortbread Cookies
recipes.description: Simple, buttery shortbread cookies with just three ingredients.

instructions.text: Mix soft butter and sugar together.
Stir in flour and mix well.
Chill dough.
Roll to 1/3 inch thickness.
Cut out shapes.
Bake at 300°F (150°C) for 20 minutes.
Do not let them get brown.

notes: Add 1/4 tsp baking powder for pop tarts variation
Low temperature keeps cookies pale and tender

recipes.title: Pie Crust (Graham Cracker Type - Healthy)
recipes.description: A healthier pie crust alternative made with wheat germ, soy flour, oatmeal, and yeast, pressed like graham cracker crust.
recipes.servings_yield: 3 pie crusts (2 large, 1 small) OR 2 medium

instructions.text: Mix all ingredients together with fork until well combined.
Divide into 3 portions (2 large and 1 small, or 2 medium).
Pat around edge and bottom of pie pans evenly, as for graham cracker crust.
Bake in 300°F (150°C) oven for about 10 minutes or until browned lightly.

notes: High protein, healthy alternative to graham cracker crust
Good for no-bake pie fillings
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 855.jpeg

recipes.title: Min's Drop Sugar Cookies
recipes.description: Soft drop sugar cookies with cinnamon, flattened with a sugar-dipped glass.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Sift together flour, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon.
Cream oleo and 1 cup sugar with vanilla.
Add egg and cream until mixture is fluffy.
Add flour mixture to sugar mixture and mix until smooth.
Add 2 tablespoons milk.
Drop by teaspoon onto ungreased cookie sheet.
Flatten with bottom of glass dipped in sugar.
Bake at 400°F (200°C) until lightly browned.

notes: Dip glass in water first, then sugar, for best flattening

recipes.title: Ma Cooper's Molasses Cookies
recipes.description: Old-fashioned soft molasses cookies with warm spices.

instructions.text: Cream sugar and shortening together.
Add molasses, cinnamon, ginger, and salt.
Dissolve baking soda in 1 cup hot water and add to mixture.
Add enough flour to make a dough that can be rolled.
Roll out and cut with cookie cutter.
Bake until done.

notes: Flour amount is flexible - add until dough is rollable
Recipe continues on back of card (not shown)
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 862.jpeg

flags: Recipe continues on back of card - some details may be missing
Temperature not specified - standard cookie temp used

recipes.title: Ma Cooper's White Cookies
recipes.description: Soft, cakey white cookies flavored with nutmeg, made with sour milk.

instructions.text: Cream sugar and shortening together.
Add eggs and beat well.
Add sour milk.
Dissolve baking soda in 1/3 cup sweet milk and add.
Add baking powder, salt, and nutmeg.
Add enough flour to make a soft dough.
Drop by spoonfuls onto cookie sheet and bake until done.

notes: Temperature not specified - standard cookie temp used
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 863.jpeg

recipes.title: Freda's Molasses Cookies
recipes.description: Soft, spiced molasses cookies made with ginger and cinnamon.

instructions.text: Cream shortening and sugar together.
Add eggs, molasses, and cold water. Cream together.
Sift together ginger, cinnamon, flour, baking soda, and salt.
Add dry ingredients to creamed mixture.
Chill dough.
Roll out and cut, or drop by spoonfuls.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 8-10 minutes.

notes: Chill dough for easier handling

recipes.title: Ida's Drop Molasses Cookies
recipes.description: Soft molasses drop cookies with cold strong coffee for extra depth of flavor.

instructions.text: Cream shortening and sugar.
Add well-beaten eggs and molasses.
Mix flour, salt, soda, cinnamon, and ginger.
Add dry ingredients alternately with cold coffee.
Drop from teaspoon onto cookie sheet.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 15 minutes.

notes: Cold strong coffee adds depth to the molasses flavor

recipes.title: Peanut Brittle
recipes.description: Classic homemade peanut brittle with raw peanuts, cooked to golden perfection and pulled thin.

instructions.text: Mix sugar, Karo syrup, and 1 cup cold water in heavy saucepan.
Cook until soft ball/crack stage (275°F/135°C).
Add butter and raw peanuts.
Cook until peanuts are well done (golden brown), stirring constantly.
Remove from heat.
Mix baking soda, vanilla, and salt dissolved in 2-3 tsp cold water.
Quickly stir soda mixture into hot candy (it will foam).
Pour onto 3 buttered cookie sheets.
Pull thin when cool enough to touch.

notes: Use raw peanuts - they cook in the candy
Pull while still warm for thin brittle

recipes.title: Mino's B.S. Cookies (Butterscotch Oatmeal)
recipes.description: Hearty oatmeal cookies with peanut butter, butterscotch chips, grated carrots, and raisins.

instructions.text: Cream peanut butter and butter together.
Add brown and white sugar, beating until light.
Combine oats, flour, salt, and baking powder.
Beat egg with milk.
Stir both mixtures into peanut butter batter.
Fold in carrots, raisins, and butterscotch chips.
Drop by tablespoon, 2 inches apart, onto ungreased baking sheet.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 10 minutes.

notes: B.S. stands for Butterscotch
Grated carrot adds moisture and nutrition

recipes.title: Best Peanut Butter Cookie
recipes.description: Classic peanut butter cookies with the signature fork marks, using both brown and white sugar.

ingredients.prep_note: or 1 tsp molasses added to white

instructions.text: Cream shortening and peanut butter together.
Add granulated and brown sugar, mixing well.
Blend in egg.
Mix flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt.
Add dry ingredients to creamed mixture.
Roll dough into balls.
Place on cookie sheet and flatten with fork (making criss-cross pattern).
Bake at 375°F (190°C) until lightly brown.

notes: Classic fork marks create signature look
Can use 1 tsp molasses + white sugar instead of brown sugar

recipes.title: Rhubarb Cake (Simple Dump)
recipes.description: A simple rhubarb dump cake with jello, marshmallows, and cake mix - minimal effort, maximum flavor.

instructions.text: Place cut rhubarb in bottom of 9x13 pan.
Sprinkle sugar over rhubarb.
Sprinkle dry jello over sugar.
Add marshmallows.
Prepare cake mix according to package directions and pour over top.
Bake until done.

notes: Layer ingredients - do not mix
Temperature not specified - standard cake temp used

recipes.title: Butterscotch Cookies - Mom Baker's
recipes.description: Classic butterscotch cookies with brown sugar and nuts.

instructions.text: Cream butter and sugar together.
Add beaten eggs.
Sift soda and cream of tartar with 2 cups flour.
Add dry mixture to creamed mixture with vanilla.
Add remaining flour and nuts.
Drop by spoonfuls onto cookie sheet.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 10-12 minutes until golden.

notes: Temperature not specified on card - 350°F is standard for similar cookies
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 878.jpeg

recipes.title: Date Cake (Good)
recipes.description: Moist date cake with nuts, using the classic soda-soaking method for dates.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour a 9x13 pan or bundt pan.
Dissolve baking soda in warm water. Pour over cut-up dates and soak for a few minutes.
Cream butter and sugar until fluffy.
Add egg and mix well.
Add soaked dates with liquid.
Add vanilla, nuts, flour, salt, and baking powder. Mix until combined.
Pour into prepared pan and bake at 350°F for 45-50 minutes until toothpick comes out clean.

notes: Marked 'Good' on original card
Soaking dates in soda water softens them and adds moisture
Temperature not specified - 350°F is standard
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 882.jpeg

recipes.title: Impossible Lemon Pie
recipes.description: Self-crusting lemon coconut pie made in a blender - the crust forms itself during baking.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a 10-inch pie pan.
In blender, combine sweetened condensed milk, water, lemon juice, eggs, butter, and vanilla.
Blend on low for 3 minutes.
Pour into greased pie pan.
Let stand 5 minutes.
Sprinkle coconut over top.
Bake at 350°F for 35-40 minutes, until knife comes out clean.
Cool before serving.

notes: Part of the 'Impossible Pie' family where crust forms during baking
Blender method creates smooth filling

recipes.title: Fig Bar Cookies
recipes.description: Homemade fig bars with a sweet fig filling wrapped in tender cookie dough.

instructions.text: Make filling: Combine chopped figs, sugar, water, and lemon juice in a saucepan.
Cook over medium heat, stirring, until thick like jam. Cool completely.
Make dough: Mix brown sugar, eggs, and vanilla together.
Stir in flour, baking soda, and salt. Mix until dough forms.
Turn out on floured board and knead a few times until smooth.
Roll dough into a 12x14 inch oblong.
Cut dough into 4 strips, each 3 1/2" wide and 12" long.
Spoon filling in a mound down the center of each strip.
Using a spatula, turn in sides of each strip to enclose filling. Press edges together.
Turn seam side down. Use sharp knife to cut each strip into 10 pieces.
Place on greased cookie sheet.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 10-12 minutes or until puffed and firm to touch.

notes: Similar to commercial Fig Newtons but homemade
Let filling cool completely before assembling

recipes.title: Date Filled Sugar Cookies
recipes.description: Classic rolled sugar cookies with a sweet date filling.

instructions.text: Make filling: Combine dates, sugar, and water in saucepan. Simmer 5 minutes until thick.
Add lemon juice and pinch of salt to filling. Cool completely.
Cream shortening and sugars until fluffy.
Add egg, milk, and vanilla. Mix well.
Sift together flour, salt, and baking soda. Add to creamed mixture.
Chill dough for 1 hour.
Roll dough 1/8 inch thick. Cut into rounds.
Place filling on half the rounds, top with remaining rounds, press edges to seal.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 10-12 minutes until lightly golden.

notes: Chill time helps dough roll easily
Temperature not on card - 375°F is standard for filled cookies
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 888.jpeg

recipes.title: Drop Filled Cookies with Dates
recipes.description: Soft drop cookies filled with a sweet date mixture.

instructions.text: Make filling: Combine dates, water, and sugar. Cook slowly until thick. Cool.
Mix soft shortening, brown sugar, and eggs together until creamy.
Stir in sour milk or buttermilk (or water).
Add flour, baking soda, and salt. Mix well.
Drop by teaspoonfuls onto greased cookie sheet.
Top each with small amount of date filling, then another small amount of dough.
Bake at 400°F (200°C) for 8-10 minutes.

notes: Can substitute water for sour milk if needed
Work quickly with warm dough

recipes.title: Anise Snaps
recipes.description: Crisp, thin cookies flavored with anise seed - a traditional European-style cookie.

instructions.text: Sift together cake flour, baking soda, cream of tartar, and salt.
Cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add beaten eggs and beat well.
Mix well, then add flour mixture and anise seed.
Blend until smooth dough forms.
Chill dough several hours or overnight.
Roll dough 1/8 inch thick on floured surface.
Cut into shapes.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) until lightly brown, about 8-10 minutes.

notes: Must chill dough before rolling
Traditional European-style cookie
Anise gives distinctive licorice flavor

recipes.title: Thumbprint Cookies (Whole Wheat)
recipes.description: Healthier thumbprint cookies made with whole wheat flour, honey, and olive oil.

instructions.text: Mix flour, honey, olive oil, salt, vanilla, and beaten eggs together well.
Gather dough into a ball and chill for 1 hour.
Roll dough in your hands to form small balls.
Dip balls in chopped nuts and place on cookie sheet.
Make a thumbprint indentation in the top of each cookie.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 12-15 minutes.
Fill thumbprints with jam or jelly after baking if desired.

notes: Healthier version using olive oil instead of butter
Temperature not on card - standard 350°F assumed
Fill with jam after baking

recipes.title: Pecan Crunch Crust
recipes.description: Crunchy pecan and bread crumb crust for pies or desserts.

instructions.text: Chop pecans in blender until finely ground.
Mix pecans, bread crumbs, melted shortening, and sugar together.
Press mixture onto bottom of greased cake pan.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 10-12 minutes until golden, or use unbaked with no-bake fillings.

notes: Can be prebaked or used unbaked depending on filling
Temperature not specified - 350°F is standard

recipes.title: Banana Pound Cake
recipes.description: Dense, rich pound cake with mashed bananas and pecans - perfect for banana bread lovers.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 325°F (165°C). Grease and flour a 10-inch tube pan.
Beat shortening at medium speed with electric mixer 2 minutes or until creamy.
Gradually add sugar, beating 5 to 7 minutes.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating just until yellow disappears.
Combine mashed banana, buttermilk, and vanilla.
Combine flour, baking soda, and salt.
Add flour mixture to shortening mixture alternately with banana mixture, beginning and ending with flour mixture. Mix at low speed after each addition just until blended.
Stir in pecans.
Spoon batter into prepared pan.
Bake at 325°F for 1 hour and 30 minutes or until wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean.
Cool in pan on wire rack 15 minutes; remove cake from pan, and cool completely on wire rack.

notes: Great for breakfast or dessert
Use very ripe bananas for best flavor

recipes.title: Mrs. DeMarco's $5,000 Caramel Apple Cake
recipes.description: Prize-winning moist apple cake with caramel cinnamon frosting.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (325°F for glass pan). Grease 13x9-inch pan.
Lightly spoon flour into measuring cup; level off.
In large bowl, combine first nine ingredients (flour through eggs); beat 3 minutes at medium speed.
Stir in apples, nuts and raisins.
Pour into greased pan.
Bake 30 to 40 minutes until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.
Cool.
In small bowl, blend Frosting ingredients until smooth. Spread over cake.

notes: $5,000 prize-winning recipe
If using self-rising flour, omit salt, baking powder and soda
Glass pan requires lower temperature

recipes.title: Peach Pie (Simple)
recipes.description: Classic peach pie with butter and a top crust.

instructions.text: Put peaches in pie shell.
Sprinkle dry ingredients (sugar, flour, salt) over peaches.
Dot with butter.
Add lemon juice if desired.
Add top crust and crimp edges.
Bake at 425°F for 30-40 minutes until golden brown.

notes: Adjust sugar based on sweetness of peaches
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 528.jpeg

recipes.title: Cherry Dream Pie
recipes.description: No-bake cherry pie with cream cheese base and cherry jello topping.

instructions.text: Soften cream cheese with 1-2 tbsp milk.
Spread cream cheese mixture over baked pie shell.
Dissolve small package cherry Jello in 1 cup boiling water.
Cool to syrupy consistency.
Add 1 can cherry pie filling to jello mixture.
Chill until partially set.
Pour into crust over cream cheese layer.
Chill until firm.
Add whipped cream to serve.

notes: No-bake refrigerator pie
Let jello cool to syrupy before adding pie filling
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 528.jpeg

recipes.title: Peach Pie
recipes.description: Simple handwritten peach pie with butter and flour topping.

instructions.text: Put peaches in pie shell.
Mix sugar, flour, and salt; sprinkle dry ingredients over peaches.
Dot with butter and add lemon juice if desired.
Add top crust.
Bake at 425°F (220°C) for 30-40 minutes until golden brown.

notes: Handwritten version - simpler than magazine clipping version
recipes.variant_notes: Handwritten family version with slightly different proportions

conversion_assumptions: Sugar amount varies by peach sweetness

recipes.title: Cherry Dream Pie
recipes.description: Cream cheese and cherry pie filling in a baked shell with Jello.

instructions.text: Soften cream cheese with 1-2 tbsp milk.
Spread cream cheese mixture over baked pie shell.
Dissolve small package cherry Jello in 1 cup boiling water.
Cool Jello until syrupy.
Add 1 can cherry pie filling to the syrupy Jello.
Chill until partially set.
Pour into crust over cream cheese layer.
Chill until firm.
Top with whipped cream to serve.

notes: No-bake filling
Handwritten family version

recipes.title: Rhubarb Pie
recipes.description: Simple rhubarb pie with egg-thickened filling.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Mix sugar, flour, beaten egg, and water together.
Let mixture set while making crust and cutting rhubarb.
Add chopped rhubarb to the sugar mixture.
Pour filling into unbaked pie crust.
Dot with margarine.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for about 1 hour until filling is set and crust is golden.

notes: Oleo = margarine
Can add top crust if desired

recipes.title: Rhubarb Cake
recipes.description: Easy rhubarb dessert using yellow cake mix with Jello and marshmallows.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Spread rhubarb in bottom of a 9x14-inch pan.
Sprinkle sugar over rhubarb.
Sprinkle dry Jello over the sugar.
Spread marshmallows evenly over top.
Prepare cake mix according to package directions.
Pour cake batter over marshmallow layer.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 1 hour.

notes: Strawberry Jello pairs well with rhubarb
8 tbsp Jello = about 1 large (6 oz) box
Marshmallows melt into the rhubarb layer

recipes.title: Marg's Cherry Pie
recipes.description: Cherry pie with a coconut crumb crust - half on bottom, half on top.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Mix flour, oleo, and sugar together well until crumbly.
Add coconut and mix to combine.
Use half the mixture for the bottom crust, pressing into a lightly greased pan.
Add cherry pie filling over the crust.
Sprinkle remaining crumb mixture over the cherries.
Bake at 400°F (200°C) for 30 minutes.

notes: Crumb-style pie rather than traditional crust
Oleo = margarine

recipes.title: Crazy Cake with Fudge Frosting
recipes.description: Grandma Baker's signature depression-era chocolate cake (also called Wacky Cake) topped with peanut butter and fudge frosting. A family tradition!

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Mix flour, sugar, cocoa, baking soda, and salt in a 9x13 pan.
Make 3 wells in the dry ingredients.
Add vinegar in one well, oil in another, and vanilla in the third.
Pour water over all and beat until smooth.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 25-30 minutes.
Let cool slightly, then spread a generous layer of peanut butter over the warm cake.
Top with fudge frosting (recipe follows).

notes: Also known as 'Wacky Cake' - a depression-era recipe with no eggs, butter, or milk
Grandma Baker's tradition: spread peanut butter on warm cake, then pour fudge frosting over
The 3-minute fudge recipe is in MomMom Baker's collection

recipes.title: Fudge Frosting
recipes.source_note: handwritten recipe card (on Crazy Cake card)
recipes.description: Quick-cooked fudge frosting to pour over Crazy Cake with peanut butter.

instructions.text: Combine sugar, cocoa, milk, butter, and salt in a saucepan.
Bring to a full boil.
Boil for 1½ minutes (or 3 minutes for thicker fudge).
Remove from heat.
Add vanilla and beat to spreading consistency.
Pour over peanut butter layer on cake while still warm.

notes: Pour over peanut butter layer while frosting is still pourable
Double recipe and cook 3 minutes for standalone fudge

recipes.title: No Bake Oatmeal Fudge Cookies
recipes.description: Classic no-bake cookies with chocolate, peanut butter, and oatmeal. Labeled as the 'Best recipe'!

instructions.text: Combine sugar, milk, cocoa, and salt in a saucepan.
Bring to a boil and boil for 1 minute (or to soft ball stage).
Remove from heat.
Add butter, oatmeal, peanut butter, and vanilla.
Mix until well blended.
Drop by teaspoonfuls onto wax paper.
Let cool and set before serving.

notes: Labeled 'Best recipe' on original card
Crunchy peanut butter adds texture
Work quickly - mixture sets fast

recipes.title: Shortbread Cookies
recipes.description: Classic 3-ingredient shortbread cookies - simple and buttery.
