recipes.title: Pumpkin Bars
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: Combine flour, sugar, baking powder, cinnamon, soda, salt, and cloves.
Stir in eggs, pumpkin, and cooking oil till thoroughly combined.
Spread batter into an ungreased 15x10x1-inch baking pan.
Bake in a 350° oven for 25 to 30 minutes or till a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean.
Cool on a wire rack. Frost with Cream Cheese Frosting. Cut into bars.

notes: Applesauce Bars: Prepare as above, except substitute applesauce for the pumpkin.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Peanut Butter Bars
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: Combine about half of the flour, the brown sugar, peanut butter, shortening, egg, milk, vanilla, and soda.
Beat with an electric mixer on medium to high speed till thoroughly combined.
Beat in remaining flour. Stir in oats.
Spread batter into an ungreased 8x8x2-inch baking pan.
Bake in a 375° oven for 15 to 18 minutes or till a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean.
Cool in pan on a wire rack. Frost with Peanut-Butter Frosting. Cut into bars.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Chocolate Revel Bars
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Our staff has loved these tempting bars for years.

instructions.text: In a mixing bowl beat the 1 cup margarine or butter with an electric mixer on medium to high speed for 30 seconds.
Add about half of the flour, the brown sugar, eggs, 2 teaspoons of the vanilla, and the baking soda. Beat till thoroughly combined.
Beat in remaining flour. Stir in oats.
In a medium saucepan combine chocolate pieces, sweetened condensed milk, and the 2 tablespoons margarine or butter. Cook over low heat till chocolate melts, stirring occasionally.
Remove from heat. Stir in walnuts and remaining 2 teaspoons vanilla.
Press two-thirds (about 3 1/3 cups) of the rolled-oats mixture into the bottom of an ungreased 15x10x1-inch baking pan.
Spread chocolate mixture over the oat mixture. Using your fingers, dot remaining oat mixture over chocolate.
Bake in a 350° oven about 25 minutes or till top is lightly browned (chocolate mixture will still look moist).
Cool on a wire rack.

notes: Whole Wheat Chocolate Revel Bars: Prepare as above, except reduce all-purpose flour to 1 1/2 cups and add 1 cup whole wheat flour.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Fudge Brownies
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: A chocolate delight even without the frosting.

ingredients.item: No-Cook Fudge Frosting or 1/3 recipe Chocolate Glaze

instructions.text: In a medium saucepan melt margarine and chocolate over low heat. Remove from heat.
Stir in sugar, eggs, and vanilla. Beat lightly by hand just till combined.
Stir in flour and 1/2 cup nuts.
Spread batter into a greased 8x8x2-inch baking pan.
Bake in a 350° oven 30 minutes.
Cool on a wire rack. Frost or glaze top. If desired, sprinkle with chopped nuts. Cut into bars.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Cake Brownies
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: In a large saucepan heat sugar, margarine or butter, and cocoa powder over medium heat till margarine melts, stirring constantly.
Remove from heat. Add eggs and vanilla. Beat lightly just till combined.
Combine flour, baking powder, and soda. Add dry ingredients and milk alternately to the chocolate mixture, beating after each addition.
Stir in nuts. Pour batter into a greased 15x10x1-inch baking pan.
Bake in a 350° oven about 20 minutes or till a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean.
Cool in pan on a wire rack. Frost with No-Cook Fudge Frosting. Cut into bars.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Buttermilk Brownies
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: The buttermilk adds a delightful tang to these moist, fine-textured brownies.

instructions.text: In a mixing bowl combine flour, sugar, baking soda, and salt. Set aside.
In a medium saucepan combine the 1 cup margarine or butter, the water, and the 1/3 cup unsweetened cocoa powder. Bring mixture just to boiling, stirring constantly. Remove from heat.

Add the chocolate mixture to dry ingredients and beat with an electric mixer on medium to high speed till thoroughly combined. Add eggs, the 1/2 cup buttermilk, and the 1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla. Beat for 1 minute (batter will be thin).
Pour the batter into a greased and floured 15x10x1-inch baking pan. Bake in a 350° oven about 25 minutes or till a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean.
Meanwhile, for frosting, in a medium saucepan combine the 1/4 cup margarine or butter, the 3 tablespoons unsweetened cocoa powder, and the 3 tablespoons buttermilk. Bring to boiling.
Remove from heat. Add powdered sugar and the 1/2 teaspoon vanilla. Beat till smooth. Stir in chopped pecans, if desired.
Pour warm frosting over the warm brownies, spreading evenly. Cool in pan on a wire rack. Cut into bars.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Toffee Bars
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: For an easy topping, sprinkle chocolate pieces over the hot bars. See the note below for details.

instructions.text: In a mixing bowl beat the 1/2 cup margarine or butter, the sugar, and salt with an electric mixer on medium to high speed till thoroughly combined.
Stir in flour. Press into the bottom of an ungreased 13x9x2-inch baking pan.
Bake in a 350° oven about 15 minutes or till edges are lightly browned.

In a heavy medium saucepan heat condensed milk and the 2 tablespoons margarine or butter over medium heat till bubbly, stirring constantly. Cook and stir for 5 minutes more. (Mixture will thicken and become smooth.)
Stir in the 2 teaspoons vanilla. Spread over baked layer.
Bake for 12 to 15 minutes or till golden.

For fudge icing, in a small saucepan heat chocolate and the 2 tablespoons margarine or butter over low heat till melted, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat; stir in powdered sugar and the 1 teaspoon vanilla.
Stir in enough hot water (1 to 2 tablespoons) to make an icing of pouring consistency. Spread over warm cookie and immediately cut into bars. Cool.

notes: Note: To save effort when frosting the cookie, substitute one 6-ounce package semisweet chocolate pieces for the fudge icing. Sprinkle pieces over the cookie immediately after removing from the oven. Let stand for 2 to 3 minutes or till softened. Spread evenly over top. Cool; chill 5 to 10 minutes or till chocolate layer is set. Cut into bars.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Fudge Ecstasies
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: If ever a cookie deserved its name, it's this one.

instructions.text: In a heavy medium saucepan heat half of the chocolate pieces, the unsweetened chocolate, and margarine or butter till melted, stirring occasionally.
Add eggs, sugar, flour, vanilla, and baking powder. Beat till thoroughly combined.
Stir in remaining chocolate pieces and nuts.
Drop by rounded teaspoons 2 inches apart onto a greased cookie sheet.
Bake in a 350° oven for 8 to 10 minutes or till edges are firm and surfaces are dull and cracked.
Cool cookies on a wire rack.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Hermits
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: raisins, currants, or diced mixed candied fruits and peels

instructions.text: In a mixing bowl beat margarine or butter with an electric mixer on medium to high speed for 30 seconds.
Add about half of the flour, the brown sugar, egg, milk, vanilla, soda, cinnamon, nutmeg, and cloves. Beat till thoroughly combined.
Beat in remaining flour. Stir in raisins and nuts.
Drop by rounded teaspoons 2 inches apart onto a greased cookie sheet.
Bake in a 375° oven about 10 minutes or till edges are lightly browned.
Cool cookies on a rack.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Ranger Cookies
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: crisp rice cereal or rolled oats
snipped pitted whole dates, or raisins

instructions.text: Beat margarine with an electric mixer on medium to high speed for 30 seconds.
Add about half of the flour, the sugars, egg, vanilla, baking powder, and soda. Beat till thoroughly combined.
Beat in remaining flour. Stir in cereal, coconut, and dates.
Drop by rounded teaspoons onto an ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake in a 375° oven about 8 minutes or till done.
Cool on cookie sheet 1 minute. Remove; cool on rack.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Santa's Whiskers
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: The coconut on the edges forms the whiskers. (Pictured on page 101.)

ingredients.item: finely chopped candied red or green cherries

instructions.text: Beat margarine with an electric mixer on medium to high speed for 30 seconds.
Add about half of the flour, the sugar, milk, and vanilla. Beat till thoroughly combined.
Stir in remaining flour. Stir in cherries and pecans.
Shape into two 8-inch rolls. Roll in coconut.
Wrap in waxed paper; chill 2 to 24 hours.
Cut into 1/4-inch slices. Place on an ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake in a 375° oven 10 to 12 minutes or till edges are golden.
Cool cookies on a wire rack.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Date Pinwheel Cookies
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: For filling, in a medium saucepan combine dates, water, and the 1/3 cup sugar. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cook and stir about 2 minutes or till thick. Stir in lemon juice and the 1/2 teaspoon vanilla; cool.

In a mixing bowl beat margarine or butter and shortening with an electric mixer on medium to high speed for 30 seconds. Add about half of the flour, the 1/2 cup sugar, the brown sugar, egg, milk, the 1 teaspoon vanilla, the baking soda, and salt. Beat till thoroughly combined. Beat in remaining flour. Cover and chill 1 hour or till easy to handle.

Divide dough in half. Roll half of the dough between waxed paper into a 12x10-inch rectangle. Spread half of the filling over dough. Roll up from one of the long sides. Moisten and pinch edges to seal. Wrap in waxed paper or clear plastic wrap. Repeat with remaining dough and filling. Chill 2 to 24 hours.
Cut into 1/4-inch slices. Place 1 inch apart on a greased cookie sheet. Bake in a 375° oven for 10 to 12 minutes or till edges are lightly browned. Cool cookies on a wire rack.

notes: Date-Filled Rounds: Prepare as above, except on a lightly floured surface, roll half of dough at a time about 1/8 inch thick. Cut with a 2 1/2-inch-round cutter. Place a rounded teaspoon of filling on half of the rounds; spread to within 1/2 inch of edges. Top with remaining rounds; seal edges with tines of a fork. Place on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake in a 375° oven for 10 to 12 minutes or till edges are lightly browned. Makes about 36.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Chocolate-Coconut Pinwheels
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: The taste of these cookies will remind you of German chocolate cake.

instructions.text: For filling, in a mixing bowl beat cream cheese, the 1/3 cup sugar, and the vanilla till smooth. Stir in coconut and nuts. Set aside.

In a mixing bowl beat margarine with an electric mixer on medium to high speed for 30 seconds. Add about half of the flour, the 1 cup sugar, the cocoa powder, egg, milk, and soda. Beat till thoroughly combined. Beat in remaining flour.

Roll half of the dough between waxed paper into a 10x8-inch rectangle. Spread half of the filling over dough. Roll up from one of the long sides. Moisten and pinch edges to seal. Wrap in waxed paper or clear plastic wrap. Repeat with remaining dough and filling. Chill 3 to 24 hours.
Cut into 1/4-inch slices. Place 1 inch apart on a greased cookie sheet. Bake in a 375° oven about 8 minutes or till edges are lightly browned. Cool cookies on a wire rack.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Tiny Tarts
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: To make pecan tassies, use the pecan filling.

instructions.text: For pastry, in a mixing bowl beat margarine or butter and cream cheese till thoroughly combined. Stir in flour.

Press a rounded teaspoon of pastry evenly into the bottom and up the sides of each of 24 ungreased 1 3/4-inch muffin cups. Fill each pastry-lined muffin cup with about 1 heaping teaspoon desired filling. Bake in a 325° oven about 30 minutes or till pastry is golden and filling is puffed. Cool slightly in the pan, then remove and cool completely on a wire rack.

notes: Pumpkin Filling: Beat together 1 egg, 1/2 cup canned pumpkin, 1/4 cup sugar, 1/4 cup milk, and 1 teaspoon pumpkin pie spice.
Pecan Filling: Beat together 1 egg, 3/4 cup packed brown sugar, and 1 tablespoon margarine or butter, melted. Stir in 1/2 cup coarsely chopped pecans.

Lemon-Coconut Filling: Divide 1/4 cup coconut among the pastry-lined muffin cups. Combine 2 eggs, 1/2 cup sugar, 2 tablespoons margarine or butter, melted, 1/2 teaspoon finely shredded lemon peel, and 1 tablespoon lemon juice. Spoon mixture over coconut in pastry-lined muffin cups.

Spiced Fruit Filling: In a small saucepan combine 1 1/2 cups chopped mixed dried fruit and 1 1/2 cups apple juice or water. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer about 8 minutes or till fruit is very tender. Drain. Stir in 1/4 cup orange marmalade, 1 teaspoon ground nutmeg, and 1/4 teaspoon ground cloves.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Brandy Snaps
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Fill these delicate, lacy cookies with plain or flavored whipped cream.

instructions.text: In a mixing bowl combine brown sugar, margarine, molasses, and brandy. Stir in flour, ginger, and nutmeg till thoroughly combined.
Line a cookie sheet with foil. Grease the foil. Drop batter by level teaspoons 5 inches apart onto foil.

Bake in a 350° oven for 5 to 6 minutes or till bubbly and deep golden brown. Let stand 2 minutes or till set. Immediately remove from foil. With the flat side to the inside, roll each cookie around a metal cone or the greased handle of a wooden spoon, or shape over the bottom of a muffin cup. Cool. (If the cookies harden before you can shape them, return them to the hot oven for 1 minute or till softened.)

notes: Pecan Snaps: Prepare as above, except reduce flour to 1/2 cup and add 1 cup ground pecans, hazelnuts (filberts), or almonds. Omit ginger and nutmeg.
Cinnamon Snaps: Prepare as above, except substitute honey for the molasses and ground cinnamon for the ginger. Omit the nutmeg.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Jam Thumbprints
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: A great way to show off your favorite homemade jam.

ingredients.item: strawberry, cherry, or apricot jam or preserves

instructions.text: In a mixing bowl beat margarine or butter with an electric mixer on medium to high speed for 30 seconds. Add about half of the flour, the sugar, egg yolks, and vanilla. Beat till thoroughly combined. Beat in remaining flour. Cover and chill about 1 hour or till easy to handle.

Shape dough into 1-inch balls. Roll balls in egg whites, then in walnuts. Place 1 inch apart on a greased cookie sheet. Press centers with your thumb. Bake in a 375° oven for 10 to 12 minutes or till edges are lightly browned. Cool cookies on a wire rack. Just before serving, fill centers with jam or preserves.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Chocolate Crinkles
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: In a mixing bowl combine beaten eggs, sugar, melted chocolate, cooking oil, baking powder, and vanilla. Gradually add flour to chocolate mixture, stirring till thoroughly combined. Cover and chill for 1 to 2 hours or till easy to handle.

Shape dough into 1-inch balls. Roll balls in powdered sugar to coat generously. Place 1 inch apart on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake in a 375° oven for 8 to 10 minutes or till edges are set and tops are crackled. Cool cookies on a wire rack. If desired, sprinkle with additional powdered sugar.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Seven-Minute Frosting
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: This glossy, divinitylike frosting requires a sturdy portable electric mixer.
recipes.servings_yield: Frosts tops and sides of two 8- or 9-inch cake layers or top and sides of one 10-inch tube cake

ingredients.item: cream of tartar or light corn syrup

instructions.text: In the top of a double boiler combine sugar, water, egg whites, and cream of tartar.
Beat with an electric mixer on low speed for 30 seconds.
Place over boiling water (upper pan should not touch water).
Cook, beating constantly with the electric mixer on high speed, about 7 minutes or till frosting forms stiff peaks.
Remove from the heat; add vanilla. Beat 2 to 3 minutes more or till of spreading consistency.

notes: Peppermint Frosting: Prepare as above, except substitute a few drops of peppermint extract for the vanilla. Garnish cake with crushed peppermint candies.

recipes.title: Fluffy White Frosting
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.servings_yield: Frosts tops and sides of two 8- or 9-inch cake layers or one 10-inch tube cake

instructions.text: In a saucepan combine sugar, water, and cream of tartar. Cook and stir till bubbly and sugar dissolves.

In a small mixer bowl combine egg whites and vanilla. Add sugar mixture very slowly to egg whites, beating constantly with an electric mixer on high speed about 7 minutes or till stiff peaks form (tips stand up).

recipes.title: Creamy White Frosting
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Firm enough to use for piping decorations.
recipes.servings_yield: Frosts tops and sides of two 8- or 9-inch cake layers

ingredients.item: lemon extract, orange extract, or almond extract

instructions.text: Beat shortening, vanilla, and extract with an electric mixer on medium speed for 30 seconds.
Slowly add half of the powdered sugar, beating well.
Add 2 tablespoons milk. Gradually beat in remaining powdered sugar and enough remaining milk to make of spreading consistency.

recipes.title: Cream Cheese Frosting
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: The tangy flavor of the cream cheese provides a nice accent to both cakes and cookies.
recipes.servings_yield: Frosts tops and sides of two 8- or 9-inch cake layers

instructions.text: In a bowl beat together cream cheese, margarine or butter, and vanilla till light and fluffy.
Gradually add 2 cups powdered sugar, beating well.
Gradually beat in enough remaining powdered sugar to make frosting of spreading consistency.
Cover cake; store in refrigerator.

notes: Chocolate Cream Cheese Frosting: Prepare as above, except substitute 1/2 cup unsweetened cocoa powder for 1/2 cup powdered sugar.

recipes.title: Powdered Sugar Icing
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.servings_yield: Makes 1/2 cup or enough to drizzle over one 10-inch tube cake

instructions.text: Mix powdered sugar, vanilla, and 1 tablespoon milk or juice.
Stir in milk or juice, 1 teaspoon at a time, till of drizzling consistency.
(Let cake stand 2 hours before slicing.)

notes: Chocolate Powdered Sugar Icing: Prepare as above, except add 2 tablespoons unsweetened cocoa powder to the powdered sugar.
Liqueur Powdered Sugar Icing: Prepare as above, except substitute 1 tablespoon desired liqueur for the first 1 tablespoon milk or juice.

recipes.title: Petits Fours Icing
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: This glossy icing coats cake cutouts beautifully. Use it with Petits Fours (see recipe, page 78) or Hot-Milk Sponge Cake (see recipe, page 85).
recipes.servings_yield: Makes about 3 1/2 cups or enough for 36 to 40 petits fours

instructions.text: In a medium saucepan combine sugar, water, and cream of tartar. Bring mixture to boiling over medium-high heat, stirring constantly till sugar dissolves (allow 5 to 9 minutes).
Reduce heat to medium-low. Clip a candy thermometer to the side of the saucepan.
Cook till thermometer registers 226°, stirring only as necessary to prevent sticking.
Remove saucepan from the heat. Cool at room temperature, without stirring, to 110° (allow about 1 hour).
Add vanilla. Stir in enough powdered sugar (about 4 cups) to make of drizzling consistency.
If necessary, beat icing with a rotary beater or wire whisk to remove any lumps.
If desired, stir in a few drops of food coloring.

notes: Note: If icing becomes too thick, beat in a few drops of warm water.

assumptions: Inferred 1.0 for sifted powdered sugar (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Butter Frosting
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: An easy-to-spread frosting in six flavors.
recipes.servings_yield: Frosts tops and sides of two 8- or 9-inch cake layers

instructions.text: In a bowl beat butter or margarine till fluffy.
Gradually add 2 cups of the powdered sugar, beating well.
Slowly beat in the 1/4 cup milk and vanilla.
Slowly beat in remaining sugar. Beat in additional milk, if needed, to make of spreading consistency.
Tint with food coloring, if desired.

notes: Chocolate Butter Frosting: Prepare as above, except beat 1/2 cup unsweetened cocoa powder into butter.

Mocha Butter Frosting: Prepare as above, except beat 1/2 cup unsweetened cocoa powder into butter or margarine. Add 1 tablespoon instant coffee crystals to the 1/4 cup milk. Let stand 3 minutes; stir well.

Lemon or Orange Butter Frosting: Prepare as above, except substitute fresh lemon juice or orange juice for the milk and add 1/2 teaspoon finely shredded lemon peel or 1 teaspoon finely shredded orange peel with the juice.
Peanut-Butter Frosting: Prepare as above, except substitute creamy peanut butter for the butter or margarine.

recipes.title: No-Cook Fudge Frosting
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.servings_yield: Frosts tops and sides of two 8- or 9-inch cake layers

instructions.text: Mix powdered sugar and cocoa.
Add margarine, boiling water, and vanilla. Beat with an electric mixer on low speed till combined.
Beat for 1 minute on medium speed.
Cool for 20 to 30 minutes or till of spreading consistency.

recipes.title: Chocolate-Sour-Cream Frosting
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.servings_yield: Frosts tops and sides of two 8- or 9-inch cake layers

instructions.text: In a saucepan melt chocolate and margarine over low heat, stirring frequently.
Cool about 5 minutes.
Stir in sour cream. Gradually add powdered sugar, beating till smooth and of spreading consistency.
Store cake in the refrigerator.

notes: Microwave directions: In a 1 1/2-quart casserole micro-cook chocolate pieces and margarine, uncovered, on 100% power (high) for 1 to 2 minutes or till softened, stirring once. Stir till smooth. Cool 5 minutes. Continue as above.

recipes.title: Chocolate Glaze
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.servings_yield: Glazes top of a 10-inch tube cake or tops of two 8- or 9-inch cake layers

instructions.text: In a small saucepan melt chocolate and margarine or butter over low heat, stirring frequently.
Remove from heat; stir in powdered sugar and 3 tablespoons hot water.
Stir in additional hot water, if needed, to make of drizzling consistency.
Spoon over cake, allowing excess to drip down sides.

notes: Microwave directions: In a 1-quart casserole micro-cook chocolate and margarine or butter, uncovered, on 100% power (high) for 1 to 1 1/2 minutes or till softened, stirring once. Stir till smooth. Continue as above.

recipes.title: Rocky Road Frosting
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.servings_yield: Frosts top of one 8- or 9-inch cake layer

instructions.text: In a medium saucepan combine 1/2 cup marshmallows, the chocolate, margarine, and 2 tablespoons water.
Cook and stir over low heat till marshmallows and chocolate melt.
Cool 5 minutes.
Add powdered sugar and vanilla; beat till smooth.
Stir in 1/2 cup marshmallows and the walnuts.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Coconut-Pecan Frosting
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.servings_yield: Frosts top of one 13x9-inch cake or tops of two 8- or 9-inch cake layers

instructions.text: In a saucepan beat egg slightly. Stir in milk, sugar, and margarine.
Cook and stir over medium heat about 12 minutes or till thickened and bubbly.
Stir in coconut and pecans. Cool thoroughly.
Spread on cake.

recipes.title: Broiled Coconut Topping
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Bake the cake in a metal pan so it's broiler-ready.

instructions.text: In a bowl beat sugar and margarine till combined.
Stir in milk. Stir in coconut and, if desired, nuts.
Spread over warm cake in pan.
Broil about 4 inches from heat for 3 to 4 minutes or till golden. Serve warm.

recipes.title: Penuche Frosting
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.servings_yield: Immediately frost tops of two 8- or 9-inch cake layers or top of one 13x9-inch cake

instructions.text: In saucepan melt margarine; stir in brown sugar.
Cook and stir till bubbly. Remove from the heat.
Add milk; beat vigorously till smooth.
Add powdered sugar; beat by hand till of spreading consistency.
Immediately frost.

notes: Microwave directions: In a 1-quart casserole micro-cook margarine on 100% power (high) for 1 to 1 1/2 minutes or till melted. Stir in brown sugar. Cook on high for 1 to 2 minutes or till bubbly over entire surface, stirring every minute. Add 3 tablespoons milk; continue as above.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Choose-a-Fruit Filling
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: No liqueur on hand? Substitute two tablespoons orange juice for the liqueur.
recipes.servings_yield: Makes enough to spread between two 8- or 9-inch cake layers (about 1 1/4 cups)

ingredients.item: pitted dark sweet cherries, peach slices, blueberries, or crushed pineapple

instructions.text: Drain fruit, reserving 3/4 cup liquid. Cut up any large pieces of fruit.
In a medium saucepan combine reserved liquid and cornstarch; add fruit.
Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir 2 minutes more.
Stir in liqueur. Cool.
Cover; chill thoroughly without stirring.

notes: Microwave directions: Drain and cut up fruit as above. In a 4-cup measure stir together reserved fruit liquid and cornstarch; add fruit. Micro-cook, uncovered, on 100% power (high) for 3 to 4 minutes or till mixture is thickened and bubbly, stirring every minute. Cook on high for 30 seconds more. Stir in liqueur. Cool. Cover; chill.

recipes.title: Lemon Filling
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Transforms a simple cake into a luscious dessert.
recipes.servings_yield: Makes enough to spread between two 8- or 9-inch cake layers (about 1 cup)

instructions.text: In a small saucepan combine sugar and cornstarch.
Stir in water. Stir in egg yolks, lemon peel, and juice.
Cook and stir over medium heat till bubbly. Cook for 2 minutes more.
Stir in margarine or butter till melted.
Cover surface with clear plastic wrap; cool.

notes: Microwave directions: In a 1-quart casserole combine sugar and cornstarch. Stir in water. Stir in egg yolks, lemon peel, and lemon juice. Micro-cook, uncovered, on 100% power (high) for 3 to 4 minutes or till thickened and bubbly, stirring every minute. Cook 30 seconds more. Stir in margarine till melted. Cover; cool.

recipes.title: Banana Cream Cheese Dessert
recipes.description: A layered dessert with cream cheese crust, bananas, pineapple, and whipped topping.

instructions.text: Crust: Mix first 3 ingredients (likely graham cracker crumbs, sugar, margarine). Cut in margarine. Add vanilla and water.
Roll out for 9 inch pie plate. Bake 8 minutes at 400°F.
Filling: Soften cream cheese and mix with powdered sugar. Pour into baked shell and chill 1 to 2 hours.
Layer on cream cheese mixture: bananas mixed with lemon juice, whipped topping, and pineapple (drained). Sprinkle with nuts and cherries.
Serve with chocolate sauce.

notes: Crust ingredients partially cut off in image

recipes.title: Chocolate-Peanut Butter Pie
recipes.description: A decadent layered pie with chocolate and peanut butter mousse in a graham cracker crust.

ingredients.item: store bought chocolate graham cracker pie crust

instructions.text: In a heavy 2 quart saucepan with wire whisk, beat the milk, cornstarch, egg yolks, and 1/3 cup sugar until well blended.
Sprinkle the unflavored gelatin evenly over the milk and egg yolk mixture; let stand 1 minute to soften gelatin slightly.
Cook over low heat, stirring the mixture constantly, until it thickens and boils. Boil for 1 minute, stirring occasionally.
Spoon 1 cup mixture into small bowl; stir in peanut butter until blended. Stir melted chocolate into remaining mixture in saucepan.
Refrigerate both mixtures until each mounds slightly when dropped from a spoon, then spoon chocolate mixture into chocolate pie crust.
Put rest of peanut butter mixture aside. In a large bowl, with mixer at high speed, beat egg whites until soft peaks form.
Gradually sprinkle 1/3 cup of sugar in egg whites, beating until sugar dissolves and whites stand in stiff peaks.
In a small bowl with same beaters on medium speed, beat 1/4 cup heavy or whipping cream until stiff peaks form.
With rubber spatula or wire whisk, fold the chilled peanut butter mixture and whipped cream and egg whites.
Spoon the peanut butter mixture evenly over the chocolate mixture in pie crust. Refrigerate 2 hours. Serve with Cool Whip or just as is.

notes: 280 calories per serving

recipes.title: Banana Split Pie
recipes.description: A frozen dessert pie with a cocoa crust - recipe continues on next page.

instructions.text: [INFERRED] Mix flour, sugar, and cocoa for crust.
[INFERRED] Cut in margarine, add vanilla and water.
[INFERRED] Press into pie plate and bake.
[INFERRED] Recipe continues on next page with filling instructions.

notes: Recipe continues on next page - only cocoa crust shown here

flags.issue: Only beginning of recipe shown - continues on next page

recipes.title: Pie Crusts
recipes.description: Basic pie crust recipe that freezes well - makes 8 portions.

instructions.text: Put flour, sugar, salt, and shortening into bowl and mix well until crumbly.
In a small bowl, beat together vinegar, egg, and water.
Stir into flour mixture.
Shape into 8 equal parts. Freeze until ready to use.

notes: Freezes well

recipes.title: Zapplenut Pie
recipes.description: A unique pie combining zucchini, apples, raisins and walnuts - tastes like apple pie!

instructions.text: Soak raisins in warm water until they look puffy, then drain.
Peel, core, and cut apples and zucchini into thin slices. Place raisins, apples, and zucchini in large bowl.
Sift dry ingredients (except lemon rind) 3 times. Combine with apple mix and let stand for 30 minutes.
Preheat oven to 425°F.
Alternate layers of apple mix and walnuts in a pie crust building to a pyramid in the center.
Dot with butter. Combine vanilla and lemon juice and sprinkle over the top.
Add top crust and slit. Moisten edge with 1 egg, beaten, and thinned with water.
Bake 15 minutes and reduce heat to 375°F for an additional 35 minutes.
Remove from oven and brush top with milk and sprinkle with sugar. Bake 5 more minutes.
Cool on rack. Serve warm.

notes: Zucchini mimics apple texture - a great way to use garden zucchini

recipes.title: Cranberry Apple Pie
recipes.description: A festive double-crust pie with apples and whole berry cranberry sauce.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F. Combine apples and cranberry sauce in a medium bowl.
Combine brown sugar, flour, cinnamon, and nutmeg in a separate bowl.
Add dry mixture to apple-cranberry mixture; mix well.
Press one pie crust into a slightly greased pie pan and top with second crust.
Crimp edges and cut slits in top crust.
Bake 1 hour, or until crust is golden brown.

recipes.title: French Silk Chocolate Pie
recipes.description: Rich, silky chocolate pie topped with whipped cream and toasted almonds.

instructions.text: Using electric beater, cream butter and sugar.
Add chocolate and vanilla.
Add chilled eggs, one at a time, beating 2 minutes after each.
Pour into baked pie shell. Chill 1 hour.
Top with whipped cream. Sprinkle with almonds.

recipes.title: Peanut Butter Pie
recipes.description: Creamy no-bake peanut butter pie - makes two pies!

instructions.text: Beat cream cheese until creamy; beat in powdered sugar, then peanut butter.
Add milk slowly.
Fold in Cool Whip until all ingredients are well mixed.
Pour into 2 baked pie shells. Sprinkle with chopped peanuts (optional).
Refrigerate 3 to 4 hours.

notes: Makes 2 pies

recipes.title: Pecan Pie
recipes.description: Classic Southern pecan pie with Karo syrup.

instructions.text: Mix ingredients in preceding order.
Bake at 400°F for 15 minutes, then at 350°F for 35 to 45 minutes, or until silver knife inserted comes out clean.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 287)

recipes.title: Surprise Cake
recipes.description: Easy cake with cream cheese and Dream Whip topping.

ingredients.item: cherry pie filling or other fruit topping

instructions.text: Take first 3 ingredients and use hands to mix and spread in 8x8 inch pan.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 28 minutes.
Take next 2 ingredients and mix. Combine with 1 (8 ounce) Dream Whip and spread on cake while hot.
Spread with cherry pie filling or other fruit topping.

assumptions: Assumed 1.5 cup can for cherry pie filling or other fruit topping
Estimated 8 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Zucchini Cake
recipes.description: Moist zucchini cake - no frosting needed.

instructions.text: Combine eggs, oil, vanilla, sugar, and zucchini.
Add dry ingredients. Beat well.
Bake in ungreased 9x13 inch pan for 45 minutes at 350°F (175°C).
No frosting needed - sprinkle with powdered sugar if desired.

assumptions: Estimated 8 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Apple-Nut Coffee Cake
recipes.description: Moist coffee cake with apples, nuts, and cinnamon topping.

instructions.text: Grease pan with shortening.
In medium bowl, stir flour, baking powder, soda, and salt.
In large bowl, use spoon to beat together sugar and shortening till fluffy.
Beat in egg and vanilla till well mixed.
Peel apple; chop it up. Stir half the flour mixture into the sugar mixture.
Stir in sour cream. Stir rest of flour mixture. Stir in chopped apple.
Spread in pan.
Crush nuts; put in small bowl. Mix brown sugar, butter, and cinnamon.
Sprinkle over coffee cake.
Turn oven to 350°F (175°C). Bake 25 to 30 minutes, or till done.
Hint - serve warm.

notes: Best served warm

assumptions: Estimated 6 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Cranberry-Cheese Coffee Cakes
recipes.description: Yeast coffee cake with cranberry filling.

ingredients.item: grated lemon peel or almond extract

instructions.text: Prepare yeast dough according to package directions with flour, sugar, salt, shortening, water, milk, and egg.
Let rise. Roll out and fill with cranberry sauce mixed with lemon peel or almond extract.
Shape, let rise, and bake according to yeast bread instructions.

notes: Recipe continues from previous page

missing_inputs: Not in database: whole berry cranberry sauce
assumptions: Estimated 6 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Lemon Cake
recipes.description: Easy lemon cake mix cake with apricot nectar.

instructions.text: Mix ingredients for cake and beat on high for 2 minutes.
Pour in greased and floured pan and bake in 300°F (150°C) oven.
Bake in 13x9 inch pan for 35 minutes, or tube pan for 1 hour.

notes: Icing: 1 1/2 cups powdered sugar, 3 tbsp lemon juice. Mix icing ingredients and drizzle on cooled cake.

assumptions: Estimated 4 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Lemon Surprise
recipes.description: Layered lemon pudding dessert with cream cheese.

instructions.text: Mix flour and oleo together and spread in a 9x13 inch ungreased pan.
Press firmly to form a solid crust. Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 15 minutes and cool.
Mix together cream cheese and sugar until fluffy; add 1 cup Cool Whip and mix well.
Spread over crust.
Mix until thick, instant pudding and milk.
Spread over cream cheese layer, then cover pudding with remaining Cool Whip.
Refrigerate until ready to serve.

assumptions: Estimated 8 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Sour Cream Nut Pound Cake
recipes.description: Rich pound cake with pecan-cinnamon swirl.

instructions.text: Cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating 30 seconds after each.
Separately, combine flour, soda, and salt. Stir 1/3 flour into butter mixture and mix with spoon.
Add 1/2 sour cream; mix 1/3 flour, mix rest of sour cream.
Stir remaining flour and vanilla; mix well.
Combine ingredients in topping: 1/2 cup chopped pecans, 1/2 tsp cinnamon, 2 tsp sugar.
Sprinkle 1/3 of topping in greased and floured tube or Bundt pan.
Pour 1/2 cake batter over topping, 1/3 topping mixture, rest of cake batter, top with remaining topping.
Bake at 325°F (165°C) for 1 1/2 hours. Invert cake to cool.

notes: Topping: 1/2 cup chopped pecans, 1/2 tsp cinnamon, 2 tsp sugar

assumptions: Estimated 8 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Chocolate Cake Roll
recipes.description: Light chocolate sponge cake rolled with ice cream filling.

instructions.text: Beat eggs and vanilla until fluffy. Add sugar gradually and beat until thick.
Sift dry ingredients over egg mixture and fold in with rubber spatula.
Spread into jelly roll pan that has been greased and lined with greased wax paper.
Bake 10 minutes at 350°F (175°C), or till toothpick comes out clean when testing.
Turn cake upside down on rack that is covered with a linen towel generously sprinkled with confectioners sugar.
Let stand a few minutes and then peel off wax paper and sprinkle with confectioners sugar.
Roll up. Let cake roll cool before filling.

notes: Ice Cream Filling: Beat egg whites with cream of tartar and sugar. Unroll cake and spread with ice cream. Roll up cake and spread top and sides with whipped egg whites. Brown in broiler. (For kids, you can use marshmallow cream.)

assumptions: Estimated 6 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Golden Delicious Apple Cake
recipes.description: Moist apple cake with cinnamon and nuts.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Beat butter, sugar, eggs, and water together.
Stir in flour, soda, salt, and spices.
Add vanilla, apples, and 1/2 cup nuts. Mix thoroughly.
Pour into well greased and floured 13x9 inch pan.
Sprinkle top with 1/3 cup brown sugar and 1/2 cup nuts.
Bake 55 minutes at 350°F (175°C), serve with ice cream.
Serves 16.

recipes.title: Jewish Apple Cake
recipes.description: Traditional layered apple cake with cinnamon-sugar apples.

instructions.text: Combine flour and baking powder; add to other ingredients and mix well.
Pour half of batter into greased and floured tube pan.
Place apple mixture (apples tossed with sugar and cinnamon) in center and top with other half of batter.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 1 1/2 hours.

assumptions: Estimated 12 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Crazy Cake
recipes.description: Easy chocolate cake mixed right in the pan - no eggs needed.

instructions.text: Mix ingredients in a large bowl; place in a 9 inch oblong cake pan.
Cook at 350°F (175°C) for about 45 minutes.
Check with knife; if done, knife will come clean.
Let cool until warm to touch.
Spread peanut butter on top; let cool for a couple hours, then top off with Three Minute Fudge.
This was passed down from Greg's Mom, Fran Baker, to me. Makes 15 to 20 servings.
Begin early in day.

notes: Use 1/8 of the recipe for the cake - handwritten note on original

recipes.title: Fresh Orange Loaf Cake
recipes.description: Moist orange-flavored loaf cake.

instructions.text: Beat all ingredients, except eggs, for 2 minutes.
Add 2 eggs. Beat well.
Pour into greased loaf pan.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for approximately 1 hour (or till knife comes out clean when inserted in center of loaf).
Cool.

assumptions: Estimated 8 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Filling for Chocolate Cake Roll - German Chocolate
recipes.description: Rich German chocolate filling with coconut and pecans.

instructions.text: Place butter, egg yolks, and milk in double boiler and cook over water till thick.
Add pecans and coconut. Cool slightly.
Unroll cake and spread with whipped cream.
Roll up and spread milk mixture on top and sides.

assumptions: Used standard can size (1.25 cups) for sweetened condensed milk
Estimated 12 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Banana Split Cake
recipes.description: No-bake layered dessert with graham cracker crust and fruit.

instructions.text: Spread cracker crumbs on bottom of pan. Melt margarine; pour over crumbs. Pat down.
Mix milk and lemon juice and spread over crumbs.
Cut up bananas and place in pan.
Drain pineapple and put over bananas.
Cover with Cool Whip.
Top with chopped nuts, cherries, etc.
Cool in refrigerator 1 to 2 hours.

assumptions: Used standard can size (1.25 cups) for condensed milk
Used standard can size (1.5 cups) for pineapple chunks
Estimated 12 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Chocolate Eclair Cake
recipes.description: No-bake layered dessert with graham crackers and pudding.

instructions.text: Use 9x13 inch pan. Line bottom of ungreased 9x13 inch pan with single layer of graham crackers.
Mix pudding and milk until thickened. Blend in Cool Whip.
Spread 1/2 mixture on graham crackers.
Add a second layer of crackers and top with rest of pudding mixture.
Add a third layer of graham crackers.
Warm frosting in microwave 30 seconds to make more spreadable and frost top layer of crackers.
Refrigerate at least 4 hours before serving to soften crackers, overnight is fine.

assumptions: Assumed 1.5 cup can for chocolate fudge frosting
Estimated 4 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Chocolate Mayonnaise Cake with Chocolate Fudge Icing
recipes.description: Moist chocolate cake made with mayonnaise.

instructions.text: Sift together flour, sugar, baking soda and powder, and cocoa.
In a separate bowl, mix together cold water, mayonnaise, vanilla, then add this to dry ingredients and blend well.
Pour into 9x13 inch greased and floured pan.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 25 to 30 minutes.

notes: Icing: 1 cup sugar, 1/4 cup cocoa, 1/4 cup milk, 1/4 cup butter, 2 tsp vanilla (add later). Bring ingredients to a boil in saucepan and boil exactly 1 minute, stirring constantly. Remove from flame. Add 2 teaspoons vanilla and cool slightly. Beat until spreading consistency.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Orange Juice Cookies
recipes.description: Soft orange-flavored drop cookies with orange icing.

instructions.text: Cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Mix in eggs, orange juice, and orange peel.
Add flour and baking soda. Fold in nuts.
Drop by teaspoonful on baking sheet.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 10 minutes, or until golden brown. Cool.

notes: Icing: 1 1/2 cups powdered sugar, 3 tbsp butter (room temperature), 1 1/2 tbsp orange juice, 2 tsp grated orange peel. Blend in medium bowl until smooth. Frost cookies.

assumptions: Estimated 8 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Pumpkin Cookies
recipes.description: Soft spiced pumpkin cookies with cream cheese frosting.

instructions.text: Mix sugar, pumpkin, and shortening.
Combine flour, baking soda, baking powder, and cinnamon.
Add to mixture and mix well.
Stir in raisins and nuts.
Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake until light brown (8 to 10 minutes).
Glaze with cream cheese frosting.

assumptions: Estimated 8 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Reese's Peanut Butter Cup Cookies
recipes.description: Peanut butter cookies with miniature peanut butter cups.

instructions.text: In a large mixing bowl, cream peanut butter, oleo, 1/3 cup sugar, and brown sugar.
Add egg, milk, and vanilla; beating well.
Combine flour and baking soda and gradually add to creamed mixture, blending thoroughly.
Shape dough into 1 1/2 inch balls; roll in sugar.
Place on ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 10 to 12 minutes.
Remove from oven. Immediately place unwrapped peanut butter cup miniature in center of each cookie, pressing down.

assumptions: Estimated 12 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Ginger Crinkles
recipes.description: Classic crinkled ginger cookies rolled in sugar.

instructions.text: Combine oil and sugar. Add egg and stir in molasses.
Sift flour, baking soda, cinnamon, and ginger.
Add to first mixture.
Roll in balls and then roll in confectioners sugar.
Place on ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 6 minutes.

assumptions: Estimated 6 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Grandma's Butter Cookies
recipes.description: Rich butter cookies with hard-boiled egg yolks.

instructions.text: Cream sugar and butter together.
Add grated egg yolks. Stir in milk and almond extract.
Combine flour and salt and add to other ingredients.
Roll out or drop by teaspoonfuls.
Decorate with nuts, cherries, or jam dollop in center.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 10 to 15 minutes.

assumptions: Estimated 8 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Marvelous Macaroons
recipes.description: Coconut almond macaroons.

instructions.text: Combine coconut, sugar, flour, and salt in mixing bowl.
Stir in egg whites and almond extract.
Stir in almonds. Mix well.
Drop from teaspoon onto lightly greased baking sheets.
Garnish with candied cherry halves if desired.
Bake at 325°F (165°C) for 20 to 25 minutes, or until edges of cookies are golden brown.
Remove from baking sheet immediately. Makes about 2 1/2 dozen.

recipes.title: Oatmeal Carmelitas
recipes.description: Oatmeal cookie bars with caramel and chocolate chips.

instructions.text: Heat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease 9x13 inch pan.
Mix crust ingredients at low speed until crumbly.
Press half, about 3 cups, of mixture in bottom of pan.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 10 minutes.
Sprinkle warm crust with chocolate chips and nuts.
In small bowl, combine caramel topping and flour.
Drizzle over top and sprinkle with remaining crumb mixture.
Bake 18 to 22 minutes. Refrigerate 1 to 2 hours.

notes: Recipe continues from previous page

assumptions: Estimated 12 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Chocolate Snow Top Cookies
recipes.description: Rich chocolate cookies rolled in powdered sugar.

instructions.text: Combine and set aside flour, baking powder, and salt.
Melt chocolate chips and butter.
Beat together sugar, vanilla, and eggs.
Add egg mixture to chocolate mixture; beat well. Add flour mixture; mix well.
Freeze dough until firm. Shape into 1 inch balls.
Roll in sifted confectioners sugar.
Place on ungreased cookie sheet and bake 10 minutes (until top cracks).
Cool and remove.

assumptions: Estimated 8 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Come and Get-Um Cookies
recipes.description: Peanut butter cookies with chocolate chips and peanuts.

instructions.text: Sift flour, soda, and salt.
Blend sugars, shortening, peanut butter, eggs, and vanilla and beat well.
Mix in chocolate and peanuts.
Form in balls and place on greased cookie sheet.
Press down with a floured fork.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 12 to 15 minutes.

assumptions: Estimated 8 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: End of the Month Cookies
recipes.description: Versatile cookie recipe using whatever ingredients you have on hand.

instructions.text: Cream together fat, sugar, eggs, and flavoring.
Sift together salt, soda, baking powder, and flour.
Add to creamed mixture. Add liquid and mix together. Chill well.
Roll out and cut as desired; roll in small balls.
Pat them in a flat pan to make bar cookies; or bake on greased pan at 375°F (190°C) for 8 minutes.
Watch carefully.

notes: A missionary 'hand-me down' recipe
Variations: Put in raisins, chocolate chips, coconut, nuts, orange peel, or leave them plain. Roll them in cinnamon sugar or frost with confectioners frosting.

assumptions: Estimated 12 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Decorator Frosting
recipes.description: Smooth frosting for decorating cookies and cakes.

instructions.text: Mix all ingredients. Beat well (up to 10 minutes) until smooth and creamy.
Use with frosting bags and tips to decorate cookies and cakes.

assumptions: Estimated 4 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Brown-Eyed Susans
recipes.description: Butter cookies topped with chocolate mint candy.

instructions.text: Cream butter, sugar, egg, salt, and vanilla.
Stir in 1 3/4 cups all-purpose flour.
Chill 1 hour. Shape into 1 inch diameter balls.
Place on ungreased cookie sheet.
Top each with chocolate mint candy wafer (not cream filled).
Bake at 400°F (200°C) for 8 to 10 minutes.

assumptions: Estimated 6 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Chocolate Covered Cherry Cookies
recipes.description: Chocolate cookies with a maraschino cherry center and chocolate topping.

instructions.text: In a large bowl, stir together flour, cocoa powder, salt, baking powder, and baking soda.
In a mixer bowl, beat together butter and sugar on low speed until fluffy.
Add egg and vanilla; beat well.
Gradually add dry ingredients; beat until well blended.
Shape into 1 inch balls; place on an ungreased cookie sheet.
Press down the center of the dough with your thumb.
Drain cherries, reserving the juice. Place a cherry in each cookie center.
In a small saucepan, combine chocolate pieces, condensed milk, and heat until chocolate melts.
Stir in 4 teaspoons of reserved cherry juice.
Spoon about 1 teaspoon of frosting on each cookie.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for about 10 minutes.

assumptions: Estimated 8 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Cream Cheese Filling for Danish
recipes.description: Sweet cream cheese filling for Danish pastries.

instructions.text: Mix cream cheese, egg yolk, 1/4 cup sugar, and flour until smooth.
Use as filling for Danish pastries.
Top with egg white wash, almonds, and remaining sugar before baking.

assumptions: Estimated 6 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Sour Cream Coffee Cake
recipes.description: Rich coffee cake with brown sugar swirl.

instructions.text: Butter a 10 inch tube pan. Sift flour once; measure. Add baking powder and soda; sift again.
Set aside. Cream butter well with 1 cup sugar until light and fluffy.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each.
Blend in vanilla and lemon juice.
Add flour mix alternating with sour cream, beginning and ending with dry ingredients.
Mix brown sugar and cinnamon.
Pour half of batter into pan. Sprinkle with 1/2 brown sugar mix.
Cover with remaining butter and top with remaining brown sugar mix.
Bake in 350°F (175°C) oven for 45 to 50 minutes. Cool 10 minutes; remove from pan.

assumptions: Estimated 8 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Festive Fruitcake
recipes.description: Easy fruitcake made with quick bread mix.

ingredients.item: Pillsbury nut or date quick bread mix

instructions.text: Grease and flour bottom and sides of a 12 cup Bundt pan or 2 loaf pans.
Combine eggs, water, and oil in large bowl.
Add remaining ingredients, except corn syrup.
Stir by hand until combined and pour into greased pan.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 65 to 85 minutes, until toothpick comes out clean.
Cool 30 minutes and remove from pan.
If desired, glaze with warm corn syrup before serving.

assumptions: Estimated 8 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Christmas Jello
recipes.description: Layered red and green Jello dessert with cream cheese.

instructions.text: Dissolve lime Jello with 1 cup hot water, then 2 cups cold water.
Add drained pineapple. Pour into 9x13 inch pan and refrigerate.
When firm, mix sugar and cream and heat until sugar dissolves.
Soften unflavored gelatin in 1/2 cup cold water.
Mix into sugar and cream mixture. Add nuts and pour into pan.
When this is firm, dissolve strawberry Jello in 1 cup hot water.
Add frozen strawberries. Pour over white layer and refrigerate.

missing_inputs: Not in database: finely chopped nuts
assumptions: Estimated 6 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Cranberry Apple Crisp
recipes.description: Warm apple crisp with cranberry sauce and granola topping.

instructions.text: Combine apples and cranberries in 10x6 inch baking dish.
Combine granola, coconut, and margarine. Sprinkle over apples.
Bake, covered, at 400°F (200°C) for 15 minutes.
Uncover and cook 10 to 15 minutes, till crisp and brown.

missing_inputs: Not in database: whole cranberry sauce
assumptions: Estimated 4 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Layered Strawberry Cracker Dessert
recipes.description: Light no-bake strawberry dessert with graham crackers.

instructions.text: Prepare Jello according to package directions. Chill until slightly thickened (consistency of unbeaten egg whites, 1 1/2 hours in refrigerator).
Slice strawberries, reserving a few whole berries for garnish if desired.
Sprinkle sliced berries with sugar.
Fold whipped topping into Jello mixture, folding well. Add berries.
Place 9 graham cracker squares in bottom of 9 inch square pan.
Spread half of Jello mixture over crackers.
Repeat layer. Chill until firm, about 3 hours.
Cut into squares; top with additional Cool Whip.

assumptions: Estimated 12 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Salted Nut Roll Bars
recipes.description: Layered bars with marshmallows, peanut butter, and salted peanuts.

instructions.text: Mix together flour, 1/2 cup oleo, baking soda, egg yolks, brown sugar, baking powder, and 1 tsp vanilla and pat into a 9x13 inch pan.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 12 minutes.
Sprinkle with 3 cups of mini-marshmallows and bake for 2 to 3 minutes.
Melt together: corn syrup, 2 tsp vanilla, 1/4 cup oleo, and peanut butter chips.
Add Rice Krispies and salted peanuts.
Spread on marshmallow base. Cool and cut into bars.

assumptions: Estimated 8 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Cake Brownies
recipes.description: Light and cakey chocolate brownies.

instructions.text: Melt chocolate and butter. Mix flour with baking powder.
Beat eggs well. Gradually beat in sugar.
Blend in chocolate and vanilla. Mix in flour. Add nuts.
Bake in 350°F (175°C) oven for 25 minutes.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Cherry Cobbler
recipes.description: Easy cherry cobbler with self-rising batter.

instructions.text: Combine first 5 ingredients.
Melt shortening in an 8x8x2 inch pan.
Pour batter into melted shortening (do not stir).
Top with cherries and bake at 325°F (165°C) until golden brown.
(Cherries will be at the bottom.)

assumptions: Estimated 6 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Nut Goodie Bars
recipes.description: Layered chocolate and peanut butter bars with maple filling.

ingredients.prep_note: regular dry, do not use instant

instructions.text: Mix and melt the chips and peanut butter. Put half into a buttered 12x16 inch pan and freeze.
Mix oleo, milk, and pudding together. Boil 1 minute. Add maple flavoring and powdered sugar.
Spread on top of frozen mixture and put back in freezer.
Add peanuts to remaining chocolate mixture and spread over filling.
Keep refrigerated. Cut into small squares.

notes: Keep refrigerated

recipes.title: Oatmeal Peanut Butter Bars
recipes.description: Chewy oat bars with peanut butter frosting.

instructions.text: Mix butter, sugars, eggs, vanilla, and peanut butter until smooth.
Sift together flour, soda, and salt. Add to peanut butter mix.
Add oats and stir until moist.
Spread in greased 9x13 inch pan. Pat until smooth.
Bake at 375°F for 20 to 25 minutes. Cool.
For frosting, mix powdered sugar, margarine, and peanut butter. Add enough milk for spreading consistency.
Cut into bars.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Date Dessert
recipes.description: Layered date and cookie dessert with whipped topping.

instructions.text: Crush cookies. Put all but 1/4 cup crumbs into square dish, 8 to 10 inches.
Bring to boil dates, water, and salt. Reduce heat and simmer 3 minutes.
Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla and marshmallows. Cool a little and stir in nuts.
Spread on top of crumbs. Top with whipped topping. Sprinkle with reserved crumbs.
Refrigerate.

notes: Reserve 1/4 cup cookie crumbs for topping

recipes.title: Thousand Dollar Bars
recipes.description: Layered graham cracker bars with chocolate chips, coconut and walnuts.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F. Melt butter in 9x12 inch baking pan.
Sprinkle graham cracker crumbs over butter to cover it evenly, then do the same with the rest of the ingredients.
Sprinkle chocolate chips evenly, walnuts, next, and then coconut in layers.
Pour sweetened condensed milk over all and bake at 350°F for approximately 30 minutes, or until light brown around edge.
Cool and refrigerate. Cut into bars.

notes: For variation, I have used raisins and peanut butter chips.

assumptions: Used standard can size (1.25 cups) for sweetened condensed milk

recipes.title: Date Nut Bar
recipes.description: Simple date and walnut bars.

instructions.text: Mix all dry ingredients together and sprinkle over date and nut mixture.
Add melted butter.
Bake in buttered pan 30 minutes at 350°F.
Cut into 3/4 x 2 inch bars (sprinkle with confectioners sugar while still hot if desired).

notes: Can sprinkle with confectioners sugar while still hot

recipes.title: Nut Chocolate Bars
recipes.description: Chocolate bars with walnuts.

instructions.text: Recipe continues on next page - instructions not fully visible.

notes: Partial recipe - instructions cut off

recipes.title: Snowballs
recipes.description: Buttery walnut cookies rolled in powdered sugar.

instructions.text: Cream butter and sugar until fluffy. Add unbeaten egg and vanilla; beat well.
Sift together dry ingredients. Blend into creamed mixture. Add walnuts and chill for 30 minutes.
Roll dough into balls the size of large marbles. Bake 8 to 10 minutes.
Roll at once in confectioners sugar. Cool and roll again in sugar.

notes: Chill dough 30 minutes before rolling

recipes.title: Thumbprint Cookies
recipes.description: Pecan-coated cookies with jam centers.

instructions.text: Mix shortening, oleo, egg yolk, and vanilla. Add flour and salt. Roll in balls about the size of walnuts.
Dip balls in beaten egg white. Roll in chopped pecans.
Bake at 350°F for 5 minutes. Remove from oven; make a thumbprint in center of each cookie. Finish baking.
Frost, if desired, with jam or a mix of confectioners sugar, water, and food color.

recipes.title: Black Bottoms
recipes.description: Chocolate cupcakes with cream cheese and chocolate chip topping.

instructions.text: Mix in a bowl: cream cheese, eggs, 2/3 cup sugar, 1/4 tsp salt, and chocolate chips. Set aside.
Sift together: flour, cocoa, baking soda, 1 cup sugar, and 1/2 tsp salt.
Add to dry ingredients: water, oil, vinegar, and vanilla.
Pour flour/cocoa batter into muffin pan (lined or greased) to 1/3 full. Top each with cheese mixture.
Garnish with chopped almonds. Bake at 350°F for 30 to 35 minutes.

notes: Garnish with chopped almonds before baking

recipes.title: Naturally Sweet Apple Crisp
recipes.description: Healthy apple crisp with whole wheat flour and oats, no added sugar.

instructions.text: Place apples in 8x8x2 inch pan. Mix lemon, apple juice, and pour over apples.
Mix flour, oats, spices, and add margarine and mix until crumbly.
Sprinkle evenly over apples.
Bake 45 minutes at 350°F.

notes: No added sugar - naturally sweetened with apple juice

recipes.title: Raisin Pudding
recipes.description: Baked raisin pudding with brown sugar sauce.

instructions.text: Sift together flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar.
Blend in 2 tablespoons shortening. Add 1 cup of raisins and 1/2 cup milk.
Pour into casserole. Bake at 375°F for 30 minutes.
Cover with sauce made from: 1 3/4 cups boiling water, 1 cup brown sugar, 1 tbsp butter.
Serve warm.

recipes.title: Rice Pudding
recipes.description: Creamy stovetop rice pudding with cinnamon.

instructions.text: In a heavy pot, cover rice with water and boil until water is absorbed.
Add milk and sugar and boil, stirring constantly.
Beat eggs and slowly add to mixture.
Place mixture in dish and sprinkle cinnamon on top.
Cover with plastic wrap and place in the refrigerator.

notes: Serve chilled

recipes.title: Strawberry Pretzel Jello
recipes.description: Three-layer dessert with pretzel crust, cream cheese, and strawberry jello.

ingredients.prep_note: juice and all (if 20 oz, remove 1/2 cup)

instructions.text: Part 1: Mix together pretzels, melted butter, and 3 tbsp sugar. Press into 9x13 inch pan. Bake at 400°F for 7 minutes. Cool.
Part 2: Blend cream cheese, 1/2 cup sugar, and Cool Whip together and spread over cooled crust. Refrigerate.
Part 3: Dissolve jello in boiling water. Add pineapple and frozen strawberries.
Mix together and pour over cream cheese layer. Refrigerate approximately 4 hours.

notes: A classic layered dessert - pretzel crust must be completely cooled before adding cream cheese layer

recipes.title: Three Minute Fudge
recipes.description: Quick and easy stovetop fudge, ready in just 3 minutes of cooking.

instructions.text: Mix oleo, milk, sugar, cocoa, and salt in a saucepan. Bring to a rolling boil.
Boil for 3 minutes. Take off burner; add vanilla. Let cool.
Use on Crazy Cake just as fudge is starting to set. Or put peanuts in to make turtles.
Place on wax paper until cool. Enjoy - yum yum!

notes: Can be used as frosting on Crazy Cake or made into turtle candies with peanuts

recipes.title: Homemade Pie Crust
recipes.source_note: Printed from Libby's Pumpkin Pie Mix packaging
recipes.description: A basic homemade pie crust recipe for a single 9-inch deep-dish pie.

instructions.text: Combine flour and salt in medium bowl.
Cut in vegetable shortening with pastry blender or two knives until mixture is crumbly.
Sprinkle with water; blend until mixture holds together.
Shape dough into ball; place on lightly floured surface.
Roll out dough to 1/8-inch thickness.
Line pie plate with pastry. Turn edge under; crimp edge as desired.

notes: To make two crusts, double all ingredients and divide dough in half

recipes.title: Easy Pumpkin Pie
recipes.source_note: Product label from Libby's Easy Pumpkin Pie Mix
recipes.description: Simple pumpkin pie using Libby's Easy Pumpkin Pie Mix with evaporated milk.

instructions.text: Mix pumpkin pie mix, evaporated milk and eggs in large bowl.
Pour into pie shell.
Bake in preheated 425°F (220°C) oven for 15 minutes.
Reduce temperature to 350°F (175°C); bake for 50-60 minutes or until knife inserted near center comes out clean.
Cool on wire rack for 2 hours. Serve immediately or refrigerate.

notes: Do not freeze, as this will cause the crust to separate from the filling.
See inside label for Pie Baking Tips and Tricks.

missing_inputs: Not in database: unbaked deep-dish pie shell
assumptions: Used standard can size (1.875 cups) for Libby's Easy Pumpkin Pie Mix

recipes.title: Apple-Mincemeat Pie
recipes.description: Orange liqueur, walnuts and mincemeat give this apple pie real holiday personality.

ingredients.prep_note: about 3 lbs., peeled, cored and cut into 1" pieces (about 6 cups)

ingredients.item: orange liqueur, orange juice or rum

instructions.text: For pastry, in bowl combine flour with salt. With pastry blender or two knives, cut in butter and shortening until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Stir in ice water, 1 tbsp at a time, until dough just starts to form. Divide dough in half; shape into 2 disks. Wrap and refrigerate at least 30 minutes.
For filling, preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). In bowl combine apples, mincemeat, walnuts and liqueur. Stir in brown sugar and cornstarch. Let stand 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, on lightly floured surface roll out 1 disk of dough to fit 9" pie pan; transfer to pan. Roll out remaining dough into 10" circle.
With pastry wheel or knife cut dough into 1/2"-wide strips.
Spoon apple mixture into pie shell; arrange dough strips over filling in lattice pattern.
Trim and flute edges. Brush milk over dough; sprinkle with granulated sugar. Transfer pie to foil-lined baking sheet.
Bake 50 minutes or until crust is golden brown and filling is bubbling. Cool completely on wire rack.

recipes.title: Pfeffernüsse (German Pepper Cookies)
recipes.source_note: Magazine clipping from Woman's World 1/26/96, page 27
recipes.description: Traditional German pepper cookies named for the pepper in every bite. Adjust pepper to suit your taste.

instructions.text: [Mix ingredients and refrigerate dough overnight - beginning of instructions partially obscured]
Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Bake 10 minutes or until tops crack.
Roll hot cookies in confectioners' sugar.
Cool completely. Store uncovered 1 week or until cookies harden.

notes: Traditional German Christmas cookie
Store uncovered to allow cookies to harden
Flour amount missing from clipping - likely 2-3 cups

recipes.title: Cindy's Fruit Salad (Ambrosia)
recipes.source_note: Handwritten recipe card on Christmas card
recipes.description: Creamy fruit salad with tropical fruits, coconut, and pecans.

instructions.text: [Instructions not written on card - typical preparation: Drain canned fruits. Whip cream with sugar and vanilla. Fold in sour cream. Combine all fruits, coconut, and pecans. Fold in cream mixture. Refrigerate before serving.]

notes: Family recipe from Mrs Cindy Baker
Christmas card notation: 'Bringing the hope of Jesus to light at Christmas'

flags: Instructions not written on original card - inferred from standard ambrosia preparation
Some ingredient quantities difficult to read in handwriting

assumptions: Used standard can size (1.5 cups) for pineapple tidbits
Used standard can size (1.375 cups) for mandarin oranges
Estimated 12 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Strawberry Jam Dandies
recipes.description: Delicious sandwich cookie flavored with ground almonds, layered with lemon icing, filled with strawberry preserves.

instructions.text: In large bowl, measure almonds, flour, butter, almond extract, and confectioners' sugar. Mix until well blended.
Shape into ball, wrap and refrigerate 2 hours or until dough is firm enough to handle.
Preheat oven to 375°F. On lightly floured surface, roll half of dough 1/8" thick. Cut into rectangles, keeping remaining dough refrigerated.
Place rectangles on cookie sheet, 1/2 inch apart. Bake 10 minutes or until golden. Remove to wire racks to cool completely.
In small bowl, stir lemon juice and confectioners' sugar until smooth. Spread thin layer of icing on cookies without cut-out centers; top each with a cookie with cut-out center.
Fill each of the cut-out centers with strawberry preserves, gently smoothing to edge of the centers.
Store in tightly covered container; use up within 2 days. Just before serving, sprinkle cookies with confectioners' sugar.

assumptions: Assumed 1.5 cup can for blanched whole almonds

recipes.title: Sugar Cookies
recipes.description: Classic rolled sugar cookies decorated with cream and nonpareils.

instructions.text: In large bowl, measure first 8 ingredients. With mixer at medium speed, beat until well mixed, occasionally scraping bowl.
Shape into ball; wrap; refrigerate 3 hours, until easy to handle. Preheat oven to 400°F.
Grease cookie sheets. On floured surface, roll half of dough; refrigerate rest. For crisp cookies, roll paper thin; for soft cookies, roll 1/4-inch thick.
With floured cookie cutters, cut dough into shapes; reroll trimmings and cut more shapes.
Place 1/2 inch apart on cookie sheets. Brush tops with cream; sprinkle with choice of toppings; bake 8 minutes or until very light brown. With pancake turner remove to racks; cool.

missing_inputs: Not in database: nonpareils or other decorations
assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for heavy or whipping cream

recipes.title: Dutch Butter Cookies
recipes.description: Buttery slice-and-bake cookies topped with candied ginger.

instructions.text: In large bowl, measure first 7 ingredients. With mixer at low speed, beat until blended.
With hands, on waxed paper, roll into three 6-inch-long rolls. Flatten each slightly to shape into a bar. Wrap; refrigerate 2 hours or up to 1 week.
Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease cookie sheets. In cup with fork, beat yolk with water. Slice one roll of dough at a time crosswise into 1/4-inch-thick slices. Place, 1 inch apart, on cookie sheets.
Brush each cookie with egg-yolk mixture and press chopped ginger into tops.
Bake 10 minutes, until lightly browned. With spatula remove to wire racks to cool.

recipes.title: Snickerdoodles
recipes.description: Classic cinnamon-sugar rolled cookies with crackled tops.

ingredients.prep_note: divided - 1 1/4 cups for dough, 2 tbsp for coating

instructions.text: In large bowl, measure flour, butter, cream of tartar, baking soda, salt, vanilla, eggs, and 1 1/4 cups sugar. With mixer at low speed, beat until blended, occasionally scraping bowl.
Shape dough into a ball; wrap with plastic wrap. Refrigerate 2 hours, until easy to handle.
Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). In small bowl, mix cinnamon with 2 tablespoons sugar.
With hands, shape dough into 1 1/2-inch balls. Roll dough balls in cinnamon mixture to coat lightly.
Place dough balls, about 2 inches apart, on ungreased large cookie sheets. With dull edge of knife, mark each cookie several times if desired.
Bake 10 to 12 minutes until lightly browned. Remove to wire racks to cool.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Molasses Spirals
recipes.description: Spiced molasses cookies piped in a spiral pattern.

instructions.text: In large bowl, measure all ingredients. With mixer at low speed, beat until blended, occasionally scraping bowl with rubber spatula.
Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease large cookie sheets.
Spoon dough into decorating bag fitted with 1/4-inch writing tube.
For each cookie, pipe dough in a continuous spiral beginning with a 2-inch circle and narrowing the spiral to a point in the center, about 2 inches apart.
Bake 8 to 10 minutes, until golden brown. Remove cookies to wire racks; cool.

notes: Requires piping bag with writing tube

recipes.title: Moravian Ginger Cookies
recipes.description: Traditional thin, crisp ginger cookies from the Pennsylvania Dutch tradition.

instructions.text: In 2-quart saucepan, measure butter, brown sugar, and molasses; cook over medium heat until sugar dissolves and butter melts, stirring mixture occasionally.
Remove from heat, stir in flour and remaining ingredients until well blended. Spoon onto waxed paper; cover and refrigerate 2 hours, until firm enough to roll.
Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease cookie sheet.
On floured surface with floured rolling pin, roll half of dough into a 10" by 10" square.
With pastry wheel or knife, cut the dough into 2 1/2" by 2 1/2" squares. Place squares about 1 inch apart on greased cookie sheet.
With fork, gently prick squares in many places to make a design. Lightly sprinkle with sugar.
Bake about 7 minutes. With pancake turner, remove cookies to wire racks to cool; repeat with remaining dough.

notes: Traditional Pennsylvania Dutch cookie
The Moravians were quick to use spices brought to the port of Philadelphia

recipes.title: Snickerdoodle Cheesecake Bars
recipes.description: Cinnamon-sugar cheesecake bars with snickerdoodle-style crust.

instructions.text: Heat oven to 325°F. Line 8-inch square baking dish with foil, leaving ends of foil hanging over sides of dish.
Combine flour, 1/4 cup sugar and 1 tbsp cinnamon in medium bowl. Cut in butter with pastry blender or 2 knives until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Reserve 1/2 cup crumb mixture for later use; press remaining crumb mixture onto bottom and 1/2 inch up sides of dish. Bake 25 min. or until lightly browned.
Meanwhile, beat cream cheese, vanilla and 1/2 cup of the remaining sugar in large bowl with mixer until blended. Add eggs, one at a time, mixing on low speed after each just until blended. Set aside.
Combine remaining sugar (2 tsp) and remaining cinnamon (1/8 tsp).
Pour cream cheese mixture into crust; top with reserved crumb mixture and cinnamon sugar.
Bake 45 to 50 min. or until center of cheesecake is almost set; cool completely.
Refrigerate cheesecake 4 hrs. Use foil handles to remove cheesecake from dish before cutting into bars.

recipes.title: Coffee Cake (Bread Machine Dough)
recipes.description: Classic cinnamon-pecan coffee cake made with bread machine dough.

instructions.text: Measure all ingredients into bread pan.
Select Dough setting. Press "Start/Stop".
When unit signals and display reads 0:00, press "Start/Stop" and remove dough.
Pat dough into greased 9-inch round, or 5 x 7-inch oblong cake pan.
Add topping: Drizzle 2 Tbsp melted butter over dough.
In small bowl, mix 1/2 cup sugar, 1 tsp ground cinnamon, and 1/2 cup chopped pecans; sprinkle onto butter.
Cover; let rise in warm place about 30 minutes.
Bake in preheated oven at 375°F (191°C) for 20 to 25 minutes, until golden brown.
Cool 10 minutes in pan on rack.
Drizzle with powdered sugar glaze if desired.

recipes.pan_size: 9-inch round or 5 x 7-inch oblong cake pan
notes: Dough Setting – Not for Timer
Topping ingredients: 2 Tbsp butter (melted), 1/2 cup sugar, 1 tsp ground cinnamon, 1/2 cup chopped pecans

recipes.title: Powdered Sugar Glaze
recipes.description: Simple vanilla glaze for coffee cakes and sweet rolls.

instructions.text: In a small bowl, combine all ingredients and blend until smooth.
Spread or drizzle glaze on slightly warm coffee cake or sweet rolls.

notes: For Coffee Cakes and Sweet Rolls

recipes.title: Cinnamon Rolls (Bread Machine Dough)
recipes.description: Classic cinnamon rolls made with bread machine dough and topped with powdered sugar glaze.

instructions.text: Combine all ingredients for Classic White recipe in bread pan. Select Dough setting. Press "Start/Stop".
When unit signals and display reads 0:00, press "Start/Stop" and remove dough.
On a lightly floured surface, roll dough into rectangle (15 x 9 inches).
Spread soft butter on dough.
Mix sugar and cinnamon; sprinkle over butter.
Roll up tightly, beginning at 15-inch side. Pinch edges to seal.
Stretch roll to make even. Cut nine 1-1/2-inch slices.
Arrange in a greased 9 x 9 x 2-inch square pan, spacing evenly.
Cover; let rise until double in size, about 40 minutes.
Preheat oven to 375°F (191°C).
Bake 25 to 30 minutes or until golden brown.
Cool on wire rack for 10 minutes.
Top warm rolls with glaze if desired.

notes: Dough Setting – Timer OK
All ingredients should be at room temperature (70°F-80°F/21°C-27°C)

assumptions: Inferred 1.0 for Powdered Sugar Glaze (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Choco-Banana Spread
recipes.description: Sweet chocolate and banana spread for toast or bread.

instructions.text: Mix mashed banana with melted chocolate chips.

assumptions: Estimated 4 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Browned Butter Glaze
recipes.description: Rich glaze with nutty browned butter flavor.

instructions.text: Heat margarine in 1-quart saucepan over medium heat until light brown; cool.
Stir in powdered sugar and vanilla.
Stir in milk until smooth and thin enough to drizzle.

assumptions: Estimated 4 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Cinnamon Glaze
recipes.description: Simple cinnamon-flavored drizzle glaze.

instructions.text: Mix all ingredients until thin enough to drizzle.

assumptions: Estimated 4 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Citrus Glaze
recipes.description: Bright citrus glaze with lemon or orange.

instructions.text: Mix all ingredients until thin enough to drizzle.

assumptions: Estimated 4 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Creamy Vanilla Glaze
recipes.description: Classic vanilla drizzle glaze.

instructions.text: Mix all ingredients until thin enough to drizzle.

assumptions: Estimated 4 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Apple Pie Filling
recipes.description: Homemade apple pie filling made with cinnamon, sugar and lemons - ready in just 30 minutes. Great for pies or canning.

instructions.text: Toss apple slices with lemon juice as soon as you've cut them and add to large dutch oven with water.
Whisk in the sugar, cornstarch, cinnamon, salt, and nutmeg until well combined.
Bring to a boil on high heat then lower to medium heat and simmer until apples are softened and sauce has thickened, about 8-10 minutes.
Cool completely before using in a recipe (especially pie) or canning.

notes: 125 kcal per serving
Can be used for pie filling or canning

recipes.title: Homemade Apple Pie Filling (Dorothy Kern)
recipes.description: Easy apple pie filling that tastes better than canned. Can be frozen for later use.

instructions.text: Place apples in a large bowl and toss with lemon juice.
Place water, sugar, cornstarch, cinnamon, salt, and nutmeg in a medium saucepan. Stir to combine then bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring often.
Once the mixture boils, boil it for two minutes. Add the apples, turn to a simmer, and cover.
Cook, stirring often, until the apples soften, about 5-8 minutes.
Pour into jars to cool to room temperature then cover and refrigerate. The mixture will thicken more as it cools.

notes: 133 kcal per serving
Can be frozen for later use

flags: Cinnamon amount (1/4 cup) seems unusually high - verify if should be 1/4 tsp

recipes.title: Butter Pie Crust
recipes.description: Pie crust from scratch that makes a pie extra special. Flavorful, flaky, easy to handle and bakes beautifully.

instructions.text: Combine flour and salt in bowl; cut in butter with pastry blender or fork until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Stir in enough water with fork, just until flour is moistened.
Divide dough in half; shape each half into ball. Flatten slightly. Wrap 1 ball in plastic food wrap; refrigerate.
