In another small bowl with mixer beat egg white until soft peaks form. At high speed, gradually beat in 1/4 cup sugar until stiff, glossy peaks form.
Remove from oven. Spread apricot preserves over base; top with meringue. Bake 20 minutes or till lightly browned.
Cool 15 minutes; cut into 4x1 inch strips. Store immediately.

notes: Topping cookies: Evenly spread apricot preserves over cooked base, then top with meringue

assumptions: Estimated 6 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Peanut-Choco Nuggets
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.source_note: Cookbook page 350 - Nut and grain cookies
recipes.description: Half of America's peanut crop goes into peanut butter. Combined with chocolate for these superb cookies.

instructions.text: Prepare Chocolate Filling: In heavy 2-quart saucepan over low heat, heat chocolate pieces until melted and smooth, stirring often.
Remove saucepan from heat; with wooden spoon stir in peanut butter, cocoa, peanuts, and confectioners' sugar until blended.
Drop by teaspoon-fuls onto ungreased cookie sheet. With fingers, smooth and shape into mounds. Cover; refrigerate 30 minutes.
Meanwhile, prepare Cookie-Shell Dough: In large bowl with hand, quickly knead the flour, butter, vanilla, and 1 cup confectioners' sugar until blended and stiff.
With hands, gently shape stiff dough into a 25-inch-long log. With sharp knife, carefully cut the log into 50 1/2-inch slices. Preheat the oven to 400°F.
Place a mound of Chocolate Filling on a slice of Cookie-Shell Dough; shape the dough around filling to cover completely, pinching the edges to seal.
Shape cookie into a 2-inch-long log; place on ungreased cookie sheets. Repeat with remaining chocolate filling and dough.
Bake 10 to 12 minutes, until golden. With pancake turner, remove to wire racks; cool. Onto waxed paper, measure 1/4 cup sugar.
When cold, roll cookies in the confectioners' sugar to coat completely. Store in tightly-covered container to use up within 1 week.

recipes.title: Peanut Butter Candy Tops
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Peanut butter cookies with chocolate candy press-ins

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 300°F. Into large bowl, measure all ingredients except candies. With mixer at low speed, beat until well blended, occasionally scraping bowl with rubber spatula.
Shape dough into 1-inch balls. Place balls, about 2 inches apart, on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake 12 minutes, until lightly browned.
Remove from oven, quickly press 3 or 4 candies into tops; return to oven; bake 3 minutes.
With pancake turner, carefully remove cookies to wire racks; cool.

recipes.title: Almond Lace Rolls
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Delicate lace cookies rolled around a wooden spoon handle

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease and flour large cookie sheet. Into large skillet, measure all ingredients except confectioners' sugar.
Cook over low heat, stirring, until butter melts and mixture is blended. Keeping over very low heat, drop 4 heaping teaspoonfuls, 2 inches apart, onto cookie sheet; bake 5 minutes.
With metal spatula, quickly remove cookies, one by one, and immediately roll around wooden spoon handle.
Cool; repeat until all batter is used, greasing and flouring cookie sheet each time.
To serve, dust with confectioners' sugar.

notes: Shaping rolls: One by one, roll around wooden spoon handle
Work quickly as cookies harden fast

recipes.title: Filbert Cookie Rafts
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: In blender at medium speed, blend filberts and 2 tablespoons sugar until very finely ground.
Into medium bowl, measure remaining ingredients. Knead until blended and dough holds together.
Preheat oven to 325°F. On waxed paper with floured rolling pin, roll out half dough into a 6" by 6" square. Cut into sixteen 1½" by 1½" squares.

With metal spatula, place on ungreased cookie sheet. With dull edge of knife, lightly mark each with three parallel lines. Bake 12 to 15 minutes, until lightly browned. Remove to wire racks; cool. Repeat with remaining dough.

notes: 53 cals per cookie

assumptions: Inferred 2 for butter or margarine (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Poppy-Seed Pinwheels
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: In large bowl with mixer at high speed, beat sugar and ½ cup butter until light and fluffy. Add flour, vanilla, salt, and egg; at low speed, beat until blended, occasionally scraping bowl with rubber spatula.
Shape into ball, wrap and refrigerate 1 hour, until firm enough to handle.
Meanwhile, stir remaining butter diced and 4 tablespoons butter into poppy seeds.

On waxed paper, roll half of dough into 9" by 8" rectangle; spread with half poppy-seed filling. Starting at narrow side, roll jelly-roll fashion; wrap and refrigerate 1 hour, until firm. Repeat with remaining dough and filling.
Preheat oven to 375°F. Slice one ½ inch apart on ungreased cookie sheets; bake 10 to 12 minutes, until lightly browned. Cool on wire rack; repeat with remaining roll.

assumptions: Inferred 2 for butter or margarine (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Frosted Snowmen
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.prep_note: cinnamon candies, chocolate chips, decors, marshmallows

instructions.text: Into large bowl, measure first 7 ingredients. With mixer at low speed, beat until blended. With wooden spoon, stir in oatmeal.

Preheat oven to 375°F. With floured hands, shape mixture into thirty-six ¾-inch balls, thirty-six 1-inch balls. Place 1-inch balls, 2 inches apart, on ungreased cookie sheets; place ¾-inch balls ½ inch above 1-inch balls.
Bake 10 to 12 minutes, until golden. With metal spatula, remove to wire racks to cool.
Prepare frosting: In medium bowl with mixer, beat confectioners' sugar, cream of tartar, and egg whites until blended. Increase speed to high and beat 1 minute.
Dip front of each ball into frosting to cover. Place frosted-side up, on wire racks; decorate quickly. Let frosting dry, about 1 hour.

notes: 135 cals per cookie

assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for cream of tartar

recipes.title: Jolly Santas
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: Into large bowl, measure all ingredients except Ornamental Cookie Frosting and currants. With mixer at low speed, beat until blended, scraping bowl with rubber spatula. Shape into a ball; wrap and refrigerate 3 hours.

Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease large cookie sheet. On lightly floured surface with floured rolling pin, roll one-third of the dough ⅛-inch thick, keeping remaining dough refrigerated. With floured 3-inch round cookie cutter, cut into rounds. Place on cookie sheet, 1 inch apart.
Bake 12 minutes, until lightly browned. With metal spatula, immediately remove cookies to wire racks; cool. Repeat with remaining dough.
Prepare Ornamental Cookie Frosting. Decorate cookies: With frosting, attach 2 currants on each for eyes, decorate with red and white frostings to make "Santa faces." Let frosting dry.

notes: 140 cals per cookie

missing_inputs: Not in database: Ornamental Cookie Frosting

recipes.title: Peanut Butter Fudge
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Variation of Chocolate Fudge using peanut butter.

instructions.text: Prepare as for Chocolate Fudge but use ¼ cup creamy peanut butter for butter and substitute 1 cup chopped salted peanuts for walnuts.

notes: 160 cals per piece

assumptions: Inferred 2 for creamy peanut butter (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Chocolate-Marshmallow Fudge
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Variation of Chocolate Fudge with miniature marshmallows.

instructions.text: Prepare as for Chocolate Fudge but stir in 1 cup miniature marshmallows just before pouring mixture into pan.

notes: 126 cals per piece

recipes.title: Peanut Brittle
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: One of America's most well-known candies, became very popular at the end of the 19th century.

instructions.text: Grease large cookie sheet. In heavy 2-quart saucepan over medium heat, heat first 4 ingredients to boiling, stirring until the sugar is dissolved; stir in nuts. Carefully set a candy thermometer in place and continue cooking, stirring frequently, until temperature reaches 300°F, or hard-crack stage (when a small amount of mixture dropped into a bowl of very cold water separates into hard and brittle threads), 20 minutes.
Remove saucepan from heat; immediately stir in the butter or margarine and baking soda; pour the hot mixture at once onto prepared cookie sheet.
With two forks, lift and pull the peanut mixture into a rectangle about 14" by 12"; set aside to cool completely.
With hands, snap candy into small pieces. Store in tightly-covered container to use up within 1 week.

notes: 146 cals per ounce

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Poached Pears
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: sweet white wine or orange juice
medium pears, peeled, halved, and cored; or medium peaches, peeled, halved, and pitted

instructions.text: In a large skillet bring sugar, wine, cinnamon, vanilla, and 3/4 cup water to boiling. Add pears or peaches. Reduce heat. Simmer, covered, for 10 to 15 minutes or till tender. Remove cinnamon. Serve warm or chilled.

notes: Microwave directions: In a 2-quart casserole micro-cook sugar, wine, cinnamon, vanilla, and 3/4 cup water, uncovered, on 100% power (high) 4 to 6 minutes or till boiling. Add fruit and cook, covered, on high for 4 to 6 minutes or till fruit is tender; stir once. Continue as above.
Pears Hélène: Prepare as above using pears. Serve drained and chilled with vanilla ice cream and Hot Fudge Sauce (see recipe, page 139).
Peach Melba: Prepare as above using peaches. Serve drained and chilled with vanilla ice cream and Fruit Sauce made with raspberries (see recipe, page 139).

recipes.title: Apple Dumplings
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: For syrup, mix 1 cup of the sugar, 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon, 1/4 teaspoon nutmeg, and 1 3/4 cups water. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer 5 minutes. Remove from heat; stir in margarine.

For pastry, mix flour and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Cut in shortening till coarse crumbs form. Add 6 to 8 tablespoons water, a little at a time, mixing till moistened. Form into a ball. Roll into an 18x12-inch rectangle; cut into six 6-inch squares.

Peel and core apples or pears. (For peaches, peel, halve, and pit.) Place one fruit on each pastry square. Combine remaining sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Sprinkle over fruit. Moisten edges of pastry; fold corners to center atop fruit. Pinch to seal. Place in an 11x7x1 1/2-inch baking pan. Pour syrup over. Bake in a 375° oven about 45 minutes or till fruit is tender and pastry is brown. Serve with ice cream, if desired.

recipes.title: Fruit Crisp
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Pair your favorite fruit with this crunchy topping.

ingredients.item: sliced, peeled apples, pears, peaches, or apricots; or frozen unsweetened peach slices
vanilla ice cream or light cream (optional)

instructions.text: For filling, thaw fruit, if frozen. Do not drain. Place fruit in an 8x1 1/2-inch round baking dish. Stir in sugar.

For topping, in a mixing bowl combine oats, brown sugar, flour, and nutmeg, ginger, or cinnamon. Cut in margarine or butter till mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in nuts or coconut. Sprinkle topping over filling.
Bake in a 375° oven for 30 to 35 minutes (40 minutes for thawed fruit) or till fruit is tender and topping is golden. Serve warm with ice cream or light cream, if desired.

notes: Microwave directions: Assemble filling as above. Cook filling, covered with vented plastic wrap, on 100% power (high) for 5 to 7 minutes or till fruit is tender, stirring twice. Assemble topping as above. Sprinkle over filling. Cook, uncovered, on high about 3 minutes or till topping is heated through, giving the dish a half-turn once. Serve warm with ice cream or light cream, if desired.
Blueberry Crisp: Prepare as above, except for the filling, combine 4 tablespoons sugar and 3 tablespoons all-purpose flour. Toss with 5 cups fresh or frozen blueberries.
Cherry Crisp: Prepare as above, except for the filling, combine 1/2 cup sugar and 3 tablespoons all-purpose flour. Toss with 5 cups fresh or frozen unsweetened pitted tart red cherries.
Rhubarb Crisp: Prepare as above, except for filling, combine 1 cup sugar and 3 tablespoons all-purpose flour. Toss with 5 cups fresh or frozen unsweetened sliced rhubarb.
Note: If fruit is frozen, thaw, but do not drain.

assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for vanilla ice cream or light cream (optional)

recipes.title: Fruit Cobbler
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: Prepare filling. Keep hot. For topping, mix flour, sugar, baking powder, and, if desired, cinnamon. Cut in margarine till mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Combine egg and milk. Add to flour mixture, stirring just to moisten.

Transfer filling to an 8x8x2-inch baking dish. Drop topping into 6 mounds atop hot filling. Bake in a 400° oven 20 to 25 minutes or till a toothpick inserted into topping comes out clean. Serve warm with ice cream, if desired.

notes: Microwave directions: In an 8x8x2-inch baking dish combine ingredients for Blueberry or Peach Filling. Micro-cook, uncovered, on 100% power (high) for 8 to 10 minutes or till thickened and bubbly, stirring every 2 minutes till slightly thickened, then every minute. Keep hot. Prepare topping as above, except reduce all-purpose flour to 3/4 cup and add 1/4 cup whole wheat flour. Drop topping into 6 mounds atop hot filling, leaving center open. Cook, uncovered, on 50% power (medium) for 8 to 10 minutes or till a cooked texture forms underneath surface of topping, turning dish once.

Blueberry or Peach Filling: In a saucepan combine 1/3 to 3/4 cup sugar and 1 tablespoon cornstarch. Add 1/4 cup water. Stir in 4 cups fresh or frozen blueberries or unsweetened peach slices. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly.

Apple or Pear Filling: Cook and stir 6 cups sliced, peeled apples or pears, 1/3 to 2/3 cup sugar, 3 tablespoons water, and 1 tablespoon lemon juice till boiling. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 5 minutes or till fruit is almost tender, stirring occasionally. Combine 2 tablespoons water and 1 tablespoon cornstarch; add to filling. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly.

Red Cherry or Rhubarb Filling: Mix 6 cups fresh or frozen unsweetened pitted tart red cherries or sliced rhubarb, 1 to 1 1/4 cups sugar, 1/4 cup water, and 4 teaspoons cornstarch. Let stand 10 minutes (20 minutes for frozen fruit). Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly.

missing_inputs: Not in database: desired filling (see below)

recipes.title: Cherries Jubilee
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Your meal will end with pizzazz when you ladle this flaming sauce over ice cream.

instructions.text: Drain cherries, reserving 1/2 cup syrup. Set cherries aside. In a medium saucepan or the blazer pan of a chafing dish combine reserved syrup, sugar, and cornstarch. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir for 2 minutes more. Stir in cherries and heat through.

In a small saucepan heat brandy or kirsch till it almost simmers. (If desired, pour heated brandy into a large ladle.) Carefully ignite brandy and pour over cherry mixture. Serve immediately over ice cream.

assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for vanilla ice cream

recipes.title: Fresh-Fruit Bowl
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: For a tropical flavor, choose the papaya and kiwi fruit or carambola.

ingredients.item: finely shredded lemon or lime peel
cubed honeydew melon, cantaloupe, or papaya
halved strawberries or seedless green grapes; peeled, sliced kiwi fruit; or sliced carambola (star fruit)
toasted coconut or toasted slivered almonds (optional)

instructions.text: Over a bowl, peel and section oranges, reserving juice. Combine reserved juice, sugar or honey, lemon or lime peel, lemon or lime juice, and cinnamon, ginger, or nutmeg. In a large serving bowl place all the fruit except berries. Drizzle juice mixture over fruit. Cover; chill 2 to 24 hours.
To serve, stir in berries. Top with yogurt and coconut or almonds, if desired.

assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for toasted coconut or toasted slivered almonds (optional)

recipes.title: Bananas Foster
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Bananas plus brown-sugar-rum sauce plus vanilla ice cream equal a truly divine dessert.

instructions.text: Peel bananas; halve crosswise, then lengthwise. In a large skillet or the blazer pan of a chafing dish melt margarine or butter over medium heat. Stir in brown sugar. Add bananas. Cook and stir for 3 to 4 minutes or till heated through. In a small saucepan heat rum till it almost simmers. (If desired, pour heated rum into a large ladle.) Carefully ignite rum and pour over bananas. Serve immediately over ice cream.

notes: Peach and Banana Flambé: Prepare as above, except substitute 1 cup sliced, peeled peaches (2 medium) for 1 banana. Sprinkle each serving with 1 tablespoon toasted coconut.

assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for vanilla ice cream

recipes.title: Swedish Fruit Soup
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Make a delicious dessert of soup with dried fruit, raisins, and orange.

ingredients.item: medium orange, peeled, thinly sliced, and quartered

instructions.text: Pit prunes. Cut up large pieces of dried fruit. In a medium saucepan combine mixed dried fruit, water, raisins, and cinnamon. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Meanwhile, combine pineapple juice and tapioca; let stand 5 minutes. Stir into cooked fruit mixture along with jelly and brown sugar. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Remove stick cinnamon. Stir in orange. Serve warm or chilled.

missing_inputs: Not in database: 8-oz package (about 3/4 cup) mixed dried fruit

recipes.title: Crepes Suzette
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Dazzle both family and friends with these folded crepes heated in a buttery orange sauce.

instructions.text: Prepare crepes. Fold each crepe in half, browned side out. Fold in half again, forming a triangle. Set aside.

For orange sauce, in a large skillet or the blazer pan of a chafing dish combine margarine or butter, shredded orange peel, orange juice, sugar, and orange liqueur. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly.
Arrange folded crepes in sauce. Simmer for 3 to 5 minutes or just till heated through, spooning sauce over crepes occasionally.
In a small saucepan heat the brandy till it almost simmers. (If desired, pour heated brandy into a large ladle.) Carefully ignite brandy and pour over crepes.

notes: Pineapple Crepes: Prepare as above, except omit the orange liqueur. Drain one 8-ounce can sliced pineapple (juice pack), reserving juice. Cut the pineapple slices into small pieces. Stir the pineapple pieces and reserved pineapple juice into the uncooked orange juice mixture in the skillet or blazer pan.

missing_inputs: Not in database: Dessert Crepes (see recipe, page 72)

recipes.title: Meringue Shells
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: Let egg whites stand in a large mixing bowl about 1 hour or till they come to room temperature. Meanwhile, cover a baking sheet with plain brown paper. Draw one 9-inch circle or eight 3-inch circles on paper.

For meringue, add vanilla, cream of tartar, and salt to egg whites. Beat with an electric mixer on medium speed till soft peaks form (tips curl). Add sugar, a tablespoon at a time, beating on high speed till very stiff peaks form (tips stand straight) and sugar is almost dissolved (about 7 minutes).

Pipe meringue through a pastry tube onto the circle or circles on the brown paper, building the sides up to form a shell or shells. Or, use the back of a spoon to spread the meringue over circle or circles, building the sides up.

Bake in a 300° oven for 45 minutes for large shell (35 minutes for small shells). Turn off oven. Let shell or shells dry in oven, with door closed, for 1 hour. Remove from paper. Store in an airtight container. If desired, fill shell or shells with ice cream or pudding and top with whipped cream.

notes: Lemon Meringue Torte: Prepare as above, except spread meringue into the bottom of a well-greased 9-inch pie plate. Build up the sides to form a shell. Bake and dry as above for the large shell. For filling, in a saucepan combine 1/2 cup sugar and 2 tablespoons cornstarch. Stir in 3 beaten egg yolks, 1/2 cup water, 1 teaspoon finely shredded lemon peel, and 1/4 cup lemon juice. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir for 2 minutes more. Remove from heat. Cover surface with plastic wrap; cool (mixture will be very thick). To assemble, spread cooled filling in shell. Beat 1 cup whipping cream and 2 tablespoons sugar till soft peaks form. Spread over filling. Chill 5 to 24 hours. Cut with wet knife.

Pavlova: Prepare large Meringue Shell on paper as above. Fill with 5 cups peeled and sliced kiwi fruit, halved strawberries, peeled and sliced peaches, peeled and cut-up papaya, or pineapple chunks, or a combination. Beat 1 cup whipping cream and 1/4 cup sugar till soft peaks form. Dollop whipped cream over fruit. Garnish with additional fruit, if desired. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Chocolate Mousse
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: So luscious and creamy.

instructions.text: In a small heavy saucepan combine the 1/4 cup sugar and the water. Cook and stir over medium-low heat till sugar dissolves. Add chocolate; cook and stir over low heat till chocolate melts. Gradually stir the chocolate mixture into beaten egg yolks. Return mixture to saucepan. Bring to a gentle boil. Cook and stir for 2 minutes more. Cool to lukewarm, stirring occasionally.

In a bowl beat egg whites and cream of tartar with an electric mixer on high speed till soft peaks form (tips curl). Gradually add the 2 tablespoons sugar, beating till stiff peaks form (tips stand straight). Pour the lukewarm chocolate mixture over beaten egg whites; fold in gently.

Beat the 1/2 cup whipping cream till soft peaks form; fold whipped cream into the chocolate and egg white mixture. Spoon into dessert dishes. Cover and chill for 4 to 24 hours before serving. Garnish with whipped cream and chocolate curls or grated chocolate, if desired.

notes: Microwave directions: In a 2-cup measure micro-cook the 1/4 cup sugar and the water, uncovered, on 100% power (high) for 1 to 2 minutes or till sugar dissolves. Stir in chocolate. Cook, uncovered, on high for 1 1/2 to 2 1/2 minutes more or till chocolate melts. Stir; cook for 30 to 60 seconds more or till the mixture is smooth. Place beaten yolks in a small bowl. Stir in the chocolate mixture. Cook, uncovered, on high for 30 to 60 seconds or just till mixture bubbles. Cool to lukewarm. Continue as above.
Mocha Mousse: Prepare as above, except add 1 teaspoon instant coffee crystals to the sugar-water mixture before cooking.
Mint-Chocolate Mousse: Prepare as above, except stir 1 tablespoon crème de menthe or a few drops mint extract into the 1/2 cup whipping cream before whipping.

assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for chocolate curls or grated chocolate (optional)

recipes.title: Chocolate Soufflé
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: Butter the sides of a 2-quart soufflé dish. Sprinkle sides with a little sugar. Set aside.

In a small saucepan melt margarine. Stir in flour. Add milk all at once. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Add chocolate; stir till melted. Remove from heat. Gradually stir chocolate mixture into beaten egg yolks. Set aside.

Beat egg whites and vanilla till soft peaks form (tips curl). Gradually add 1/4 cup sugar, beating till stiff peaks form (tips stand straight). Fold about 1 cup beaten whites into chocolate mixture. Then fold chocolate mixture into remaining beaten whites. Transfer to prepared dish. Bake in a 350° oven 35 to 40 minutes or till a knife inserted near center comes out clean. Serve at once with whipped cream, if desired.

notes: Amaretto Soufflé: Prepare as above, except omit chocolate pieces. Stir 1/4 cup amaretto and 1/4 cup finely chopped toasted almonds into the thickened milk mixture.

recipes.title: Baked Alaska
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: Stir ice cream to soften. Spoon into a 1 1/2-quart bowl lined with clear plastic wrap. Invert ice cream onto cake; remove bowl. Freeze till firm.

For meringue, beat egg whites, vanilla, and cream of tartar till soft peaks form (tips curl). Gradually add sugar, beating till stiff peaks form (tips stand straight). Transfer cake and ice cream to a baking sheet; remove plastic wrap. Spread meringue over all, sealing edge to baking sheet.
Place oven rack in the lowest position. Bake in a 500° oven for 2 to 3 minutes or till golden. Serve immediately.

missing_inputs: Not in database: 9-inch cake layer (any flavor)

recipes.title: Cheesecake Supreme
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Your cheesecake is done when its center appears nearly set but jiggles slightly when gently shaken.

instructions.text: For crust, combine crushed crackers, nuts, and cinnamon. Stir in margarine or butter. Reserve 1/4 cup of the crumb mixture for topping, if desired. Press remaining onto bottom and about 2 inches up sides of an 8- or 9-inch springform pan.

In a mixer bowl combine cream cheese, sugar, flour, vanilla, and, if desired, lemon peel. Beat with an electric mixer till fluffy. Add eggs and yolk all at once, beating on low speed just till combined. Stir in milk. Pour into crust-lined pan. Sprinkle with reserved crumbs, if any. Place on a shallow baking pan in oven. Bake in a 375° oven for 45 to 50 minutes for the 8-inch pan (35 to 40 minutes for the 9-inch pan) or till center appears nearly set when shaken. Cool 15 minutes. Loosen crust from sides of pan. Cool for 30 minutes more; remove sides of pan. Cool completely. Chill at least 4 hours. Serve with Fruit Sauce, if desired.

notes: Sour Cream Cheesecake: Prepare as above, except reduce cream cheese to 2 packages and omit the milk. Add three 8-ounce cartons dairy sour cream with the eggs. Bake in 8-inch pan about 55 minutes (9-inch pan, 50 minutes).
Liqueur Cheesecake: Prepare as above, except substitute white crème de menthe, crème de cacao, coffee liqueur, or amaretto for milk.

Chocolate Swirl Cheesecake: Prepare as above, except omit lemon peel. Stir 2 squares (2 ounces) semisweet chocolate, melted and cooled, into half of the batter. Pour half of each batter mixture into crust; repeat. Use a spatula to gently swirl batters.

missing_inputs: Not in database: Fruit Sauce (see recipe, page 139) (optional)

recipes.title: Strawberry Shortcake
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Next time, try sliced peaches instead of berries.

instructions.text: Stir together berries and 1/4 cup of the sugar; set aside. Stir together remaining sugar, flour, and baking powder. Cut in margarine till mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Combine egg and milk; add all at once to dry ingredients. Stir just to moisten. Spread into a greased 8x1 1/2-inch round baking pan, building up edge slightly. Bake in a 450° oven for 15 to 18 minutes or till toothpick inserted near center comes out clean. Cool in pan 10 minutes. Remove from pan. Split into 2 layers. Spoon the fruit and Whipped Cream between layers and over top. Serve immediately.

assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for Whipped Cream (see recipe, page 140)

recipes.title: Brownie Pudding Cake
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: Stir together flour, the 1/4 cup sugar, 1 tablespoon of the cocoa powder, and the baking powder. Add milk, oil, and vanilla. Stir till smooth. Stir in nuts. Transfer batter to a 1-quart casserole. Combine the 1/3 cup sugar and remaining cocoa powder. Gradually stir in boiling water. Pour evenly over batter. Bake in a 350° oven about 30 minutes or till a toothpick inserted into cake comes out clean. Serve warm.

notes: Mocha Brownie Pudding Cake: Prepare as above, except add 2 teaspoons instant coffee crystals with the boiling water.

recipes.title: Lemon Pudding Cake
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Tastes like lemon meringue pie.

instructions.text: Combine sugar and flour. Stir in lemon peel, juice, and melted margarine. Combine yolks and milk. Add to flour mixture; stir just till combined.

Beat egg whites till stiff peaks form (tips stand straight). Gently fold egg whites into lemon batter. Transfer batter to a 1-quart casserole. Place in a larger pan on oven rack. Add hot water to larger pan to a depth of 1 inch. Bake in a 350° oven about 40 minutes or till golden and top springs back. Serve warm.

recipes.title: Chocolate-Mousse Cake
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: For crust, combine ground nuts, cracker crumbs, margarine, and the 2 tablespoons sugar. Press onto bottom and about 1 1/4 inches up sides of a greased 9-inch springform pan. Set aside.

Cook and stir chocolate and cream over low heat till chocolate melts. Transfer to a large bowl. Combine eggs, the 3/4 cup sugar, and flour; beat 10 minutes or till thick and lemon colored. Fold one-fourth of the egg mixture into the chocolate mixture, then fold chocolate mixture into remaining egg mixture. Pour into crust-lined pan.

Bake in a 325° oven 55 minutes or till puffed around edge and halfway to center (center will be slightly soft). Cool 20 minutes. Remove sides of pan. Cool for 4 hours. Serve with whipped cream, if desired. Chill leftovers.

recipes.title: Plum Pudding
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: slices white bread, torn into pieces
beef suet, ground (2/3 cup), or 2/3 cup shortening
diced mixed candied fruits and peels

instructions.text: In a bowl soak the bread in evaporated milk about 3 minutes or till softened. Beat lightly to break up. Stir in suet or shortening, brown sugar, egg, orange peel, and orange juice. Stir in raisins, dates, fruits and peels, and nuts.

Stir together flour, cinnamon, baking soda, cloves, and mace. Add to fruit mixture; stir till combined. Transfer mixture to a well-greased 6-cup tower mold. Cover with foil, pressing foil tightly against the rim of mold. Place on a rack in a deep kettle. Add boiling water till water reaches 1 inch above the bottom of the mold. Cover kettle. Bring to a gentle boil. Steam for 2 1/2 to 3 hours or till a toothpick inserted near center comes out clean, adding more boiling water, if necessary. Cool 10 minutes; remove mold. Serve immediately. (Or, wrap and store in the refrigerator up to 2 weeks; reheat before serving as directed below.) If desired, heat rum till hot. Ignite with a match and pour over pudding. Serve with Hard Sauce.

notes: To reheat: Wrap pudding in foil and place on a baking sheet. Bake in a 350° oven for 30 to 40 minutes or till heated through.

missing_inputs: Not in database: diced mixed candied fruits and peels
Not in database: Hard Sauce (see recipe, page 140)

recipes.title: Vanilla Pudding
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Rich and creamy Chocolate Pudding spills from a Cream Puff.

ingredients.item: beaten egg yolks or 2 beaten eggs

instructions.text: In a heavy medium saucepan combine sugar and cornstarch or flour. Stir in milk. Cook and stir over medium heat till mixture is thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir for 2 minutes more. Remove from heat. Gradually stir about 1 cup of the hot mixture into beaten egg yolks or eggs.

Return all of the egg mixture to the saucepan. If using egg yolks, bring to a gentle boil; if using whole eggs, cook till nearly bubbly, but do not boil. Reduce heat. Cook and stir for 2 minutes more. Remove from heat. Stir in margarine and vanilla. Pour pudding into a bowl. Cover the surface with clear plastic wrap. Chill. Do not stir.

notes: Chocolate Pudding: Prepare as above, except add 1/3 cup unsweetened cocoa powder to sugar. Use 2 tablespoons cornstarch or 1/4 cup all-purpose flour, 2 2/3 cups milk, and egg yolks (not whole eggs).
Tangy Vanilla Pudding: Prepare as above, except omit margarine or butter. After chilling, stir in one 8-ounce carton dairy sour cream or plain yogurt.
Brandied Pudding: Prepare as above, except substitute 1 to 2 tablespoons brandy, amaretto, coffee liqueur, or orange liqueur for vanilla.

recipes.title: Cream Puffs
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: pudding, whipped cream, ice cream, sherbet, or fresh fruit

instructions.text: In a medium saucepan combine margarine or butter, 1 cup water, and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Bring to boiling. Add flour all at once, stirring vigorously. Cook and stir till mixture forms a ball that doesn't separate. Remove from heat. Cool 10 minutes. Add eggs, one at a time, beating with a wooden spoon after each addition till smooth.

Drop batter by heaping tablespoons, 3 inches apart, onto a greased baking sheet. Bake in a 400° oven for 30 to 35 minutes or till golden. Cool on a wire rack. Split puffs and remove any soft dough from inside. Fill with the pudding, whipped cream, ice cream, sherbet, or fruit. Replace tops. Lightly sift powdered sugar over tops, if desired.

notes: Éclairs: Prepare as above, except spoon batter into a pastry tube fitted with a Number 10 or larger tip. Slowly pipe strips of batter onto a greased baking sheet, making each strip about 4 inches long, 3/4 inch wide, and 1 inch high. Bake, split, and cool as above. Fill with pudding or whipped cream. Frost with Chocolate Glaze (see recipe, page 89). Makes 12.

assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for pudding, whipped cream, ice cream, sherbet, or fresh fruit

recipes.title: Chocolate Pots de Crème
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Savor pot de crème (poh-duh-KREM), a very rich dessert, in small portions.

instructions.text: In a heavy small saucepan combine light cream, chocolate, and sugar. Cook and stir over medium heat about 10 minutes or till mixture comes to a full boil and thickens. Gradually stir about half of the hot mixture into beaten egg yolks; return yolk mixture to saucepan. Cook and stir over low heat for 2 minutes more. Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla. Pour into 4 or 6 pot de crème cups or small dessert dishes. Cover and chill for 2 to 24 hours. Serve with whipped cream, if desired.

recipes.title: Cream Cheese Hearts
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: End a meal in style with these creamy, rich treats.

ingredients.item: vanilla or few drops almond or lemon extract
Fruit Sauce (see recipe, page 139) or fresh fruit

instructions.text: Line six 1/2-cup or eight 1/3-cup heart-shape or other molds with damp cheesecloth squares, allowing the cheesecloth to hang over edges.
Beat cream cheese and vanilla with an electric mixer on medium speed till combined. Gradually add powdered sugar, beating till fluffy. Set aside.
In another bowl beat whipping cream till soft peaks form. Fold into the cream cheese mixture. Spoon into the prepared molds. Cover and chill for 6 to 24 hours.
To serve, invert molds onto a serving plate. Holding onto cheesecloth ends, lift molds from cheesecloth. Peel cheesecloth from shapes. Serve with Fruit Sauce or fruit.

missing_inputs: Not in database: Fruit Sauce (see recipe, page 139) or fresh fruit

recipes.title: Baked Custards
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Caramel Flan, a dressed-up version of Baked Custards, is pictured below right.

instructions.text: Combine eggs, milk, sugar, and vanilla. Beat till well combined but not foamy. Place four 6-ounce custard cups or one 3 1/2-cup soufflé dish in an 8x8x2-inch baking dish on an oven rack. Pour egg mixture into custard cups or dish. Sprinkle with nutmeg or cinnamon, if desired. Pour boiling water into the baking dish around custard cups or dish to a depth of 1 inch.

Bake in a 325° oven for 30 to 45 minutes for custard cups (50 to 60 minutes for dish) or till a knife inserted near the center or centers comes out clean. Serve warm or chilled. If desired, loosen edges of individual custards with a spatula or knife, slipping point of spatula down sides to let air in; invert onto dessert plates.

notes: Caramel Flan: Prepare as above, except in a heavy saucepan cook 1/3 cup sugar over medium-high heat (do not stir) till sugar begins to melt; shake saucepan occasionally. Reduce heat to low and cook till sugar is golden brown; stir frequently. Divide sugar mixture among custard cups. Tilt to coat bottoms. Let stand for 10 minutes. Add egg mixture. Bake individual custards as above. Remove from custard cups to serve.

Baked Rice Pudding: Prepare as above, except stir 1 cup cooked rice and 1/3 cup raisins into egg mixture. Pour into a 1 1/2-quart casserole. Bake as above for 45 to 55 minutes, stirring after 30 minutes. Makes 6 servings. Do not use the microwave directions.

assumptions: Assumed 1 unit for ground nutmeg or cinnamon (optional)

recipes.title: Stirred Rice Pudding
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: In a heavy medium saucepan bring milk to boiling; stir in uncooked rice and raisins. Cover; cook over low heat, stirring occasionally, for 30 to 40 minutes or till most of the milk is absorbed. (Mixture may appear curdled.) Stir in sugar and vanilla. Spoon into dessert dishes. Sprinkle with nutmeg. Serve warm or chilled.

recipes.title: Stirred Custard
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Serve this custard as a rich sauce over fresh fruit or cake.

instructions.text: In a heavy medium saucepan combine eggs, milk or light cream, and sugar. Cook and stir over medium heat. Continue cooking egg mixture till it just coats a metal spoon. Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla. Quickly cool the custard by placing the saucepan in a sink or bowl of ice water for 1 to 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Pour custard mixture into a bowl. Cover surface with clear plastic wrap. Chill till serving time. Serve over cake slices or fruit.

notes: Amaretto Stirred Custard: Prepare as above, except substitute 2 to 3 tablespoons amaretto, orange liqueur, coffee liqueur, rum, or brandy for the vanilla.

missing_inputs: Not in database: sponge cake or fresh fruit

recipes.title: Trifle
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Save a step and use a bakery sponge cake or ladyfingers for the base.

ingredients.item: cut-up, peeled peaches or kiwi fruit; or strawberries, raspberries, or blueberries

instructions.text: Prepare Stirred Custard and cool. Cut cake into 1-inch cubes (you should have 5 cups). Reserve remaining cake for another use. In a 2-quart serving bowl layer half of the cake cubes. Sprinkle with half of the sherry. Dot with half of the preserves. Top with half of the fruit and half of the almonds. Pour half of the Stirred Custard over all. Repeat layers. Cover and chill for 3 to 24 hours.
To serve, beat whipping cream, sugar, and vanilla till soft peaks form. Spread over trifle.

notes: Shortcut Trifle: Prepare as above, except substitute one 4-serving-size package instant vanilla pudding mix, prepared according to package directions, for the Stirred Custard; one 3-ounce package (12) ladyfingers for the cake; and half of a 4-ounce container frozen whipped dessert topping, thawed, for the whipping cream, sugar, and vanilla. Chill up to 4 hours.

missing_inputs: Not in database: Stirred Custard (see recipe, left)
Not in database: strawberry preserves or currant jelly
assumptions: Inferred 1.0 for Hot-Milk Sponge Cake (see recipe, page 85) (standard quantity)

recipes.title: No-Cook Vanilla Ice Cream
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Looks and tastes like soft-serve ice cream.

instructions.text: In a large mixing bowl combine light cream, sugar, and vanilla. Stir till sugar dissolves. Stir in whipping cream. Freeze in a 4- or 5-quart ice-cream freezer according to the manufacturer's directions.

notes: No-Cook Cherry-Nut Ice Cream: Prepare as above, except stir 1 cup chopped pitted dark sweet cherries and 1/2 cup chopped walnuts into cream mixture before freezing.

No-Cook Chocolate-Almond Ice Cream: Prepare as above, except reduce sugar to 1 cup. Stir one 16-ounce can (1 1/2 cups) chocolate-flavored syrup and 1/2 cup chopped toasted almonds into cream mixture before freezing.

No-Cook Chocolate Chip and Mint Ice Cream: Prepare as above, except stir 1 cup miniature semisweet chocolate pieces, several drops of mint extract, and, if desired, a few drops of green or red food coloring into the cream mixture before freezing.

No-Cook Strawberry Ice Cream: Prepare as above, except in a blender container, blend 4 cups fresh or frozen-then-thawed unsweetened strawberries or blueberries till nearly smooth. (You should have 2 cups.) Stir blended berries into cream mixture before freezing.

No-Cook Peach Ice Cream: Prepare as above, except in a blender container, blend 4 cups cut-up, peeled peaches till nearly smooth. (You should have 2 cups.) Stir peaches into cream mixture before freezing.

No-Cook Coffee Ice Cream: Prepare as above, except dissolve 2 to 3 tablespoons instant coffee crystals in the light cream mixture. Stir 1/2 cup miniature semisweet chocolate pieces into cream mixture before freezing, if desired.

Butter-Pecan Ice Cream: Prepare as above, except in a heavy skillet, cook 1/2 cup chopped pecans, 1/4 cup sugar, and 1 tablespoon margarine or butter over medium-high heat (do not stir) till sugar begins to melt, shaking skillet occasionally. Reduce heat to low and cook till sugar turns golden, stirring frequently. Immediately spread on a baking sheet lined with greased foil. Cool; break into chunks. Stir nut mixture into cream mixture before freezing.

recipes.title: Vanilla Ice Cream
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: In a large saucepan combine sugar and gelatin. Stir in light cream. Cook and stir over medium heat till mixture almost boils and sugar dissolves. Stir about 1 cup of the hot mixture into beaten eggs; return all to saucepan. Cook and stir for 2 minutes more. Do not boil. Stir in whipping cream and vanilla. Cool. Freeze in a 4- or 5-quart ice-cream freezer according to manufacturer's directions.

notes: Chocolate Ice Cream: Prepare as above, except stir 6 squares (6 ounces) unsweetened chocolate, melted and cooled, into gelatin mixture after heating. Beat with a rotary beater till combined. Stir 1 cup chopped toasted almonds into the cooled mixture, if desired.

recipes.title: Lemon Sherbet
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: We added just enough lemon peel to give a tangy, refreshing taste.

ingredients.item: finely shredded lemon peel or orange peel

instructions.text: In saucepan mix sugar and gelatin; add 3 cups water. Cook and stir till sugar and gelatin dissolve. Remove from heat. Add lemon peel, milk, lemon juice, and food coloring. (Mixture will look curdled.) Transfer to a 9x9x2-inch baking pan. Cover; freeze 2 to 3 hours or till almost firm. (Or, after mixing ingredients, freeze in a 4- or 5-quart ice-cream freezer according to manufacturer's directions. Omit remaining steps.)
Break frozen mixture into small chunks. Transfer to a chilled bowl. Beat with an electric mixer till smooth but not melted. Return to pan. Cover; freeze till firm.

notes: Orange Sherbet: Prepare as above, except substitute 3 3/4 cups orange juice for water. Omit lemon juice. Substitute orange food coloring for yellow food coloring.
Pineapple Sherbet: Prepare as above, except substitute 3 3/4 cups unsweetened pineapple juice for water. Omit lemon juice.

missing_inputs: Not in database: yellow food coloring

recipes.title: Fruit Ice
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen unsweetened strawberries or raspberries, or sliced peaches or nectarines

instructions.text: In a blender container combine fruit, orange juice, sugar, and, if desired, liqueur. Cover; blend till smooth. Press through a sieve to remove skin or seeds. Add additional orange juice to make 3 cups mixture. Transfer to an 8x4x2-inch or 9x5x3-inch loaf pan. Cover; freeze 4 hours or till firm. Break frozen mixture into small chunks.

Transfer to chilled bowl. Beat with an electric mixer till smooth but not melted. Return mixture to loaf pan. Cover; freeze till firm. To serve, scrape across top with a spoon and mound into dessert dishes.

recipes.title: Choose-a-Fruit Frozen Yogurt
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Double all the ingredients for a 4- or 5-quart ice-cream freezer.

ingredients.item: fresh or frozen unsweetened strawberries, red raspberries, blueberries, or boysenberries; cut-up, peeled peaches or nectarines; or pitted dark sweet cherries

instructions.text: In blender container blend fruit till smooth. Press through a sieve to remove seeds, if necessary. Stir in yogurt and honey. Pour into a 1- to 2-quart ice-cream freezer. Freeze according to manufacturer's directions. Let stand at room temperature for 20 minutes.

recipes.title: Mocha Toffee Squares
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: chocolate-covered English toffee bars, crushed (1/2 cup)

instructions.text: For crust, combine crushed wafers and the melted margarine; press onto bottom of an 8x8x2-inch dish. Dissolve coffee crystals in 1 tablespoon hot water. Beat together 1/2 cup sugar and the 1/2 cup margarine till fluffy. Add egg yolks, one at a time, beating well after each. Add coffee, chocolate, and vanilla; beat till combined. Beat egg whites to soft peaks; gradually add remaining sugar, beating to stiff peaks. Fold chocolate mixture into egg whites. Spread over crust. Sprinkle toffee atop. Cover; freeze 6 hours or till firm. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

recipes.title: Frosty Strawberry Squares
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: For crumb mixture, combine flour, nuts, margarine, and brown sugar. Spread evenly into a shallow baking pan. Bake in a 350° oven for 20 minutes; stir occasionally. Sprinkle two-thirds of the crumbs into a 13x9x2-inch baking pan.

In a large mixing bowl combine egg whites, strawberries, sugar, and lemon juice. Beat with an electric mixer on high speed about 10 minutes or till stiff peaks form (tips stand straight). In a small mixing bowl beat the whipping cream till soft peaks form. Fold whipped cream into strawberry mixture. Spoon evenly over crumbs in baking pan; sprinkle remaining crumbs on top. Cover; freeze at least 6 hours or till firm.

notes: Frosty Cranberry Squares: Prepare as above, except substitute 1 1/2 cups ground cranberries for strawberries and 1 tablespoon frozen orange juice concentrate for lemon juice.
Note: If desired, use one 10-ounce package frozen sliced strawberries, partially thawed, and 2/3 cup sugar.

recipes.title: Ice-Cream Torte
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Combine cake and ice cream in one dessert.

ingredients.item: peppermint, cherry, or chocolate ice cream
crushed striped round peppermint candies, crushed chocolate-covered English toffee, or chopped nuts

instructions.text: For torte, with a serrated knife, slice pound cake horizontally into two layers. In a chilled mixing bowl stir ice cream just to soften. Place bottom cake layer on a baking sheet. Spread ice cream over cake. Top with remaining cake layer. Place torte in freezer.

For frosting, in a small mixing bowl beat cream cheese, margarine or butter, and vanilla with an electric mixer on medium speed for 30 seconds or till fluffy. Gradually add powdered sugar, beating till smooth.

Remove torte from the freezer. Trim ice cream to cake edge, if necessary. Pipe or spread frosting over top and sides of torte. Freeze torte till firm. Place frozen torte in a moisture- and vapor-proof container. Seal and label. Freeze torte for up to 6 months.

To serve, remove torte from freezer and let stand, covered, at room temperature for 10 minutes. Unwrap and place on a serving platter. Sprinkle with crushed peppermint, crushed toffee, or chopped nuts.

missing_inputs: Not in database: frozen loaf pound cake

recipes.title: Chocolaty Velvet Ice Cream
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: This nutty treat needs no ice-cream freezer.

instructions.text: Combine cream, sweetened condensed milk, and chocolate syrup. Beat with an electric mixer till soft peaks form. Fold in chopped nuts. Transfer to an 8x8x2-inch pan; freeze till firm.

recipes.title: "No Regrets" Cheesecake
recipes.description: A creamy cheesecake from Publix.

instructions.text: Beat cream cheese until smooth.
Add sugar and beat until fluffy.
Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each.
Stir in vanilla.
Pour into graham cracker crust.
Bake at 350°F for 40 minutes.
Cool and refrigerate before serving.

assumptions: graham cracker crust: used default unit

recipes.title: Quaker's Best Oatmeal Cookies
recipes.description: Classic oatmeal cookies from the Quaker Oats recipe.

instructions.text: Heat oven to 350°F.
Beat butter and sugars until creamy.
Add eggs and vanilla; beat well.
Add combined flour, baking soda, cinnamon and salt; mix well.
Stir in oats; mix well.
Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake 8 to 9 minutes for a chewy cookie or 10 to 11 minutes for a crisp cookie.
Cool 1 minute on cookie sheet; remove to wire rack.

notes: Add 1 cup raisins, chocolate chips, or chopped nuts if desired.

recipes.title: Buttercups
recipes.description: Individual pie crust cups filled with a sweet coconut filling.

instructions.text: Mix sugar and margarine. Cream. Add rest of ingredients. Mix well.
For ready made pie crust, roll the crust out like you would a pie using 7 by 11 pan. Put crust in bottom, then spread filling over top of crust.
Take next crust, repeat by rolling dough to fit over top of filling. Cut off all remaining pie crust on side just leaving crust to cover all the filling. With fork pierce top, brush with milk.
Oven 350 for 20 minutes or until golden brown.
Cool. Sprinkle with confectionary sugar. Cut into squares.

notes: If you want a larger amount, double recipe and use 13 by 9 pan. You can still use ready crust but will have to piece together.

recipes.title: Carrot Cake
recipes.description: Classic carrot cake with cream cheese frosting.

instructions.text: Mix flour, sugar, baking soda, cinnamon and salt.
Add oil and eggs. Mix well.
Fold in grated carrots and pecans if using.
Pour into greased 9x13 pan or two 9-inch round pans.
Bake at 350°F until toothpick comes out clean.
For frosting: Beat cream cheese and butter until smooth. Add powdered sugar and vanilla. Beat until fluffy.
Frost cooled cake.

recipes.title: Dump Cake
recipes.description: A simple layered dessert - just dump the ingredients in order and bake!

instructions.text: Do NOT grease pan.
Dump pineapple (with juice) into bottom of pan and spread.
Spread coconut across the pineapple layer.
Spread cherry pie filling over coconut.
Sprinkle dry cake mix evenly over the top.
Scatter pecans over cake mix.
Slice butter into squares and place over top of mix.
Bake at 350°F until golden brown on top.

notes: Do not stir layers - just dump and spread each one.

assumptions: cherry pie filling: used default unit
yellow or white cake mix: used default unit
butter or margarine: used default unit

recipes.title: Pumpkin Sheet Cookies
recipes.description: Soft pumpkin cookies baked in a sheet pan with cream cheese frosting.

instructions.text: Mix pumpkin, sugar, salt, pumpkin pie spice, oil, and eggs.
Add dry cake mix and vanilla. Mix well.
Fold in nuts if using.
Spread in greased sheet pan.
Bake until done.
For frosting: Beat cream cheese and butter until smooth.
Add powdered sugar and orange zest. Beat until fluffy.
Frost cooled cookies. Cut into squares.

assumptions: pumpkin pie spice: used default unit
yellow cake mix: used default unit

recipes.title: Pound Cake
recipes.description: Classic Southern pound cake with sour cream.

instructions.text: Grease and flour tube pan.
Cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each.
Sift flour with baking powder.
Add flour mixture alternately with sour cream, beginning and ending with flour.
Stir in vanilla.
Pour into prepared pan.
Bake at 325°F for 1-1/2 hours or until toothpick comes out clean.

recipes.title: Banana Pudding (Bobby Jones)
recipes.description: Classic Southern banana pudding with vanilla wafers and whipped cream.

instructions.text: Dump in bowl with 2 cups milk, beat to firm.
Fold in sour cream.
Fold in whipped cream.
Fold in sliced bananas.
Fold in vanilla wafers.
Refrigerate until ready to serve.

assumptions: vanilla instant pudding: used default unit

recipes.title: Angel Delight
recipes.description: A layered dessert with angel food cake, strawberries, and Jello.

instructions.text: Mix Jello as directed on box.
Put angel food cake squares in bottom of 13x9 dish.
Layer strawberries over cake.
Pour Jello over entire cake and strawberries.
Cover with foil, put in refrigerator until set.
When ready to serve, put Cool Whip over dish. Cut into squares.

recipes.title: Praline Lace Sundaes
recipes.description: Crispy lace cookies shaped into cups and filled with ice cream and praline sauce.

instructions.text: In a saucepan, combine butter, sugar, molasses, cinnamon and orange rind. Bring to a boil.
Remove from heat. Stir in flour. Mix until smooth.
On a large ungreased cookie sheet, drop mixture by tablespoon, making only 2 at a time to allow for spacing.

Bake at 325°F for 12 minutes or until a rich brown. Let cool for 30 to 60 seconds until mixture holds together when moved with spatula. Loosen and place over custard cups. Press gently to mold. Repeat with remaining mixture.
To make sauce, combine all ingredients in a saucepan. Bring to a boil. Cook 3 minutes or until thickened.
Place one scoop ice cream into each cooled cup. Drizzle with hot sauce.

notes: Cups may be made ahead of time. Store in an airtight tin until ready to serve. Sauce may also be made ahead and reheated
Variations: Use lemon sherbet, coffee-flavored or butter-pecan ice cream

assumptions: grated orange rind: used default unit
vanilla ice cream: used default unit

recipes.title: Alan's Basic Flan
recipes.description: Classic caramelized custard flan with vanilla.

instructions.text: To prepare caramelized sugar, in a heavy saucepan, mix sugar and water. Cook over medium-high heat until dark golden in color, 10 to 12 minutes. Mixture should not exceed 340°F on candy thermometer. Remove from heat. Carefully swirl into a 9 1/2-by-2 1/2-inch 5-cup ring mold.
In a 2 1/2-quart saucepan, add milk, half-and-half, cream and vanilla bean. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat. Cool 5 minutes, whisking frequently.
In a large stainless steel or glass bowl, whisk eggs lightly. Gradually whisk in sugar.
Very slowly add milk mixture to egg mixture, beating continuously.
Add vanilla and rum. Mix. Remove beans. Pour into mold. Place in a roasting pan. Fill pan with water 1/2-inch deep.
Bake at 325°F for 45 to 50 minutes. To test for doneness, stick a knife in center. If it comes out clean, flan is done.
Remove mold from pan. Spoon remaining caramelized sugar over top. Cool. Chill 1 1/2 to 2 hours.

notes: Use a candy thermometer when cooking the caramelized sugar. If it cooks too hot or too long it will turn brown and have a burnt flavor

recipes.title: Black Cherry Tart
recipes.description: Elegant cherry tart with cream cheese and graham cracker crust.

instructions.text: Combine cracker crumbs, almonds and cinnamon. Stir in butter. Evenly press mixture into the bottom of an 8-inch tart pan with removable bottom. Bake at 300°F for 15 minutes. Cool.
Beat together cream cheese and honey. Spread evenly over crust.
Cut cherries in half. Arrange, cut-side down, on cheese layer.
In a saucepan, combine 8 tablespoons cherry liquid and cornstarch. Stir in jelly and lemon juice until well combined.
Bring to a boil over low heat, stirring constantly. Reduce heat. Simmer 2 minutes longer or until thickened.
Spoon hot glaze over cherries to cover completely. Chill 2 to 4 hours.

notes: If you need to save time, you may purchase a pre-made graham cracker crust and use canned cherry pie filling to cover the cream cheese layer. For a more spirited flavor, add 1 to 2 tablespoons Kirsch to the glaze

assumptions: soft cream cheese: used default unit
graham cracker crumbs: used default unit

recipes.title: Banana Chocolate Cake
recipes.description: Moist chocolate cake with mashed bananas and cream cheese frosting.

instructions.text: To prepare frosting, cream butter until light. Blend in 1 cup powdered sugar mixture into mashed banana. Gradually add enough powdered sugar until of spreading consistency. Add banana extract. Blend well. Set aside.
In bowl, cream shortening and sugar. Beat in eggs, one at a time.
Mix cocoa with hot water. Blend into creamed mixture.
Sift together flour, soda and salt. Alternately add dry ingredients and mashed bananas to creamed mixture.
Turn batter into 2 greased 8-inch square pans lined with waxed paper.
Bake at 375°F for 35 minutes or until tester comes out clean and cake pulls from sides of pan. Cool completely. Layer.
Frost tops of each layer.
Cut into squares.

notes: For best results, use very soft, ripe bananas; gently mash them with a fork

assumptions: sifted cake flour: used default unit
sifted powdered sugar: used default unit

recipes.title: White Chocolate Chunk Cookies
recipes.description: Buttery cookies studded with white chocolate chunks and walnuts.

instructions.text: In a bowl, combine flour, baking soda and salt.
In a large mixing bowl, cream together butter and sugars until smooth. Add vanilla and egg. Beat until light.
Add flour mixture, chopped chocolate and walnuts. Blend well.
Shape cookies by rounded teaspoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake at 375°F for 8 to 10 minutes until golden.

notes: These cookies are also delicious made with semisweet or milk chocolate chips

recipes.title: Old-Fashioned Butter Cake
recipes.description: Classic dense, moist butter cake made with buttermilk.

instructions.text: In a large bowl, beat together butter and sugar until fluffy.
Beat in vanilla. One at a time, add eggs, beating well after each addition.
In a separate bowl, combine flour, baking soda and salt. Alternately with buttermilk, add to batter, beginning and ending with flour mixture.
Pour batter into a buttered, floured 8-cup fluted pan.
Bake at 350°F for about 1 1/2 hours until tester inserted in center comes out clean.
Allow cake to stand 5 minutes. Remove from pan. Finish cooling on rack.
Dust with powdered sugar.

notes: To easily cream together butter and sugar, use a wooden spoon to press the beat or mixture until the sides of the bowl. Do not overbeat or mixture will curdle and cake will be tough
Good served with hot chocolate, coffee or tea and a scoop of butter-pecan ice cream

recipes.title: Melting Moments
recipes.description: Delicate butter cookies that melt in your mouth, topped with cream cheese icing.

instructions.text: In a mixing bowl, beat butter at low speed until creamy. Slowly add cornstarch and powdered sugar. Turn speed to medium-high. Beat until fluffy.
With wooden spoon, stir in flour. Dough should be quite soft.
Cover. Chill for 45 minutes.
To prepare frosting, blend cream cheese with powdered sugar until creamy and smooth. Mixture will be stiff. Mix in vanilla. Add a few drops of food coloring. Mix well.
Roll dough into 24 1-inch balls. Place 1 1/2 inches apart on ungreased cookie sheets. With finger, press a slight indentation on the top of each cookie.
Bake at 350°F for 10-12 minutes until cookies feel firm but are not browned.
Cool. Top each cookie with a spoonful of icing. Garnish with sliced almonds.

notes: Stir dry ingredients after measuring. In place of the vanilla extract, almond or peppermint may be used. The dough may be prepared one day in advance and refrigerated. Bring to room temperature before shaping cookies

assumptions: soft cream cheese: used default unit
red or green food coloring: used default unit

recipes.title: Pineapple Dream Cake
recipes.description: Light and fluffy cake with pineapple and whipped cream frosting.

instructions.text: Line 9-inch cake pans with foil.
In a large mixing bowl, beat all cake ingredients at medium speed for 4 minutes.
Bake at 350°F for 20 to 25 minutes until cake tester comes out clean and cake pulls from sides of pan. Cool completely.
Invert one layer on flat plate or cake platter. Peel off foil.
To prepare icing, in small mixing bowl, beat pudding mix, pineapple until thick, in a large spoon whipped non-dairy topping. Fold in pineapple mixture.
Ice top of each cake. Layer. Ice sides. Refrigerate cake until ready to serve.

notes: Be sure to line cake pans with foil and grease well as the batter will be very greasy. This cake freezes well. For a special occasion, use another 11 oz. can mandarin oranges to decorate. Be sure cake is well drained and dried before using

assumptions: mandarin orange slices: used default unit
vanilla instant pudding mix: used default unit
non-dairy whipped topping: used default unit

recipes.title: Fruit Pie in Cookie Crust
recipes.description: Fresh fruit pie with a sweet cookie-style crust.

ingredients.item: diced fresh sliced or assorted fruit

instructions.text: To prepare crust, in a bowl, combine butter, sugar and egg yolk. Mix well. Add flour. With hands, work until blended. Press dough firmly on bottom and sides of a 9-inch pie pan. Bake at 400°F for 10 minutes or until edges brown. Cool.
In a heavy saucepan, combine sugar, cornstarch and salt.
Gradually stir in apple juice. Bring to boil over medium heat. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute. Remove from heat.
Stir in lemon rind and lemon juice.
Gently fold in fruit. Turn into cookie crust. Chill for 4 to 5 hours until firm enough to cut.

notes: Sliced or diced fresh apples, pears, strawberries, grapes, bananas and drained orange sections all work well in this recipe
Good served with a scoop of vanilla ice cream

assumptions: grated lemon rind: used default unit
diced fresh sliced or assorted fruit: used default unit

recipes.title: Walnut Chocolate Fudge
recipes.description: Rich chocolate fudge made with apple juice and topped with walnuts.

instructions.text: In a 3-quart saucepan, combine sugar, water and apple juice. Over medium heat, cook, stirring until sugar is dissolved.
Cook until syrup reaches soft-ball stage, 234°F.
Remove from heat. Whisk in chocolate. Blend well. Stir in walnuts.
Spread mixture in foil-lined baking pan. Chill until set.
Turn fudge out of pan. Peel off foil. Cut into squares.

notes: For best results, use an accurate candy thermometer. To store fudge, cover and place in a cool, dry place

assumptions: semisweet chocolate pieces: used default unit
coarsely chopped walnuts: used default unit

recipes.title: Chocolate Strawberry Shortcake
recipes.description: Chocolate shortcake layered with ricotta cheese filling and fresh strawberries.

instructions.text: In a medium bowl, stir together flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking soda and salt.
With a pastry blender, cut in the butter until mixture resembles cornmeal.
In another bowl, combine cream, vanilla and egg. Add to flour mixture. Stir just until moistened. Mixture will be stiff.
Spread mixture in two greased 8- or 9-inch round cake pans.
Bake at 425°F for 10 to 12 minutes until a wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean. Immediately turn out layers onto wire racks. Cool.
For filling, stir together Ricotta cheese, sugar, vanilla and chocolate chips.
Place one cake layer on a serving plate. Spread with half the filling. Layer cake with remaining filling. Garnish with sliced berries.

assumptions: unsweetened cocoa powder: used default unit

recipes.title: Cinnamon Mocha Sheet Cake
recipes.description: Moist chocolate sheet cake flavored with cinnamon and espresso.

instructions.text: In saucepan, melt butter. Stir in cocoa, water and coffee. Beat until smooth.
In a large bowl, combine sugar, flour, eggs and milk. Add cocoa mixture. Mix well.
To cocoa mixture, combine sugar, flour, cinnamon and baking soda.
Pour batter into a greased 10-by-15-inch jelly roll pan.
Bake at 350°F for 18 minutes or until done.
To prepare icing, in a saucepan, melt butter. Stir in coffee. Cook, stirring, until smooth. Slowly beat in powdered sugar. Mix until smooth. Spread over cake while warm. Cool. Cut into squares.

notes: Good served with a scoop of coffee or vanilla-flavored ice cream

assumptions: instant espresso or coffee crystals: used default unit
sifted powdered sugar: used default unit

recipes.title: Caramel Crunch Bars
recipes.description: Buttery shortbread bars topped with caramel and almonds.

instructions.text: In a large mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar. Add egg yolks and vanilla. Stir in flour and salt.
Press dough into a greased and floured 15 3/4-by-10 1/2-inch jelly roll pan.
Bake at 350°F for 25 to 30 minutes until golden.
To prepare topping, in heavy saucepan, combine lemon juice, sugar and cream. Stir over high heat until sugar is dissolved.
Add butter. With rubber scraper, clean down the sides of the pan.
Continue cooking until mixture turns a light caramel color or until a few drops in cold water form a soft ball.
Remove from heat. Add nuts and vanilla.
Pour over baked crust. Return to oven for 2 to 5 minutes until topping bubbles.
Cool. Cut into 1-by-2-inch bars.

recipes.title: Crumb-Topped Blueberry Cake
recipes.description: Moist coffee cake loaded with blueberries and topped with walnut streusel.

instructions.text: In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda and salt. Blend well.
In a large measuring cup, combine eggs, milk, butter and lemon juice. Add to dry ingredients. Mix well.
To prepare topping, in a bowl, combine flour, sugar, butter and walnuts. Blend until mixture is crumbly in appearance.
Turn batter into a buttered 13-by-9-inch baking dish. Sprinkle with blueberries evenly over batter. Sprinkle with topping.
Bake at 375°F for 40 to 45 minutes. Serve warm.

notes: If using frozen blueberries, do not thaw

recipes.title: Peanutty Chocolate Pie
recipes.description: No-bake chocolate peanut butter pie with graham cracker crust.

instructions.text: For Filling: In 2-quart saucepan combine sugar and corn starch. Stirring constantly, bring to boil over medium heat and boil 1 minute. Remove from heat.
Stir in chocolate until smooth. Pour into pie crust. Refrigerate 45 minutes or until cool.

For Topping: In small bowl combine heavy cream and 1/4 cup sugar. With mixer at low speed, blend in 2 tbsp peanut butter until smooth. Beat at medium speed until cream stands in peaks; spread over chocolate layer. Sprinkle with chopped peanuts.
Serve immediately or cover and refrigerate.

assumptions: Argo or Kingsford's Corn Starch: used default unit
semisweet chocolate chips: used default unit
prepared graham cracker crust: used default unit

recipes.title: Strawberry Shortcut Cake
recipes.description: Quick strawberry cake with marshmallow and whipped cream topping.

instructions.text: Generously grease bottom only of a 13x9-inch baking pan; sprinkle marshmallows evenly over bottom of pan. Thoroughly combine completely thawed strawberries and syrup. Thoroughly set aside. (No need to sift flour, measure by lightly spooning into cup and leveling off.) In large mixer bowl, combine remaining ingredients. Blend at low speed until moistened; beat 3 minutes at medium speed, scraping sides of bowl occasionally. Spoon batter evenly over marshmallows in prepared pan. Pour strawberry mixture evenly over batter.
Bake at 350° for 45 to 50 minutes until golden brown and toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.
Serve warm or cool with ice cream or whipped cream.

notes: For use with Pillsbury's Best Self-Rising Flour, omit baking powder and salt.
HIGH ALTITUDE—5200 feet. Decrease baking powder to 2 1/2 teaspoons. Bake at 375° for 40 to 45 minutes.

assumptions: frozen strawberries in syrup: used default unit
strawberry flavored gelatin: used default unit
Pillsbury's Best All Purpose Flour: used default unit

recipes.title: No-Bake Easter Basket Cake
recipes.description: Adorable Easter basket cake made with frozen pound cakes, decorated with bunny cookies and candy.

instructions.text: In bowl set over hot, not simmering water, melt white chocolate with shortening until smooth. Dip 1 side of 1 peanut-shaped cookie in mixture; place dipped side up on wire rack. Press 1 cake decor into icing for nose. Repeat with remaining cookies. Let stand until dry, 15-20 minutes. Roll out each Starburst to a 1/4-inch thick. With clean scissors cut two 1 1/2-inch-long bunny ears. Cut 2 small slits on 1 short side of cookie through to cookie filling. Dip tip of 2 ears into remaining chocolate mixture; insert dipped tips into slits. Transfer semisweet chocolate to plastic food storage bag with corner snipped; pipe eyes and whiskers.

Tint frosting pink with red food coloring. Transfer 1 1/2 cups frosting to plastic food storage bag; set aside. With small amount of frosting attach bottom of 1 pound-cake to serving platter. Attach another cake to first cake with frosting on bottom and 1 vertical side. From vertical side. Attach remaining cakes with frosting as shown. Frost top and sides with remaining frosting.

In bowl toss coconut with green food coloring and a few drops of water; set aside. Press some of M&M's along bottom edge of cake in alternating colors. Press Cookie Stix vertically onto sides of cakes, fitting bottom tip of cookies in crevice formed where 2 M&M's meet. Leave 1 1/2-inch vertical gap on each long side of cake for handle. Press remaining M&M's along top edge of cake in alternating colors. Snip corner of bag of reserved pink frosting; pipe alternating horizontal lines over cookies for basket weave, as shown. Press Bunny Rope onto sides of cake for handle; insert toothpicks through rope into cake to secure. For extra stability prop handle up with toothpicks or long wooden skewer until cake is served. Insert bunny cookies into top of cake (cookies can also help hold up handle). Arrange coconut over candy around cookies.
Basket handle alternative: If you are unable to find Marshmallow Bunny Ropes, flexible straws cut to fit, then threaded with marshmallows and inserted into each other can be used instead, as shown.

notes: Quick Tip: If you're allergic to peanuts, substitute pastel-colored plain M&M's for the peanut variety, plain Cookie Stix for the peanut-flavored and chocolate candy bunnies for the peanut bunny cookies.

assumptions: frozen pound cakes: used default unit
peanut butter-flavored Keebler Cookie Stix: used default unit
flexible straws and large marshmallows: used default unit

recipes.title: Frosty Orange Delight
recipes.description: Frozen orange cream dessert with a cookie crust.

ingredients.item: baked crust made with coconut cream pudding and pie filling mix

ingredients.prep_note: whipped and sweetened with 1/4 cup sugar

ingredients.item: powdered orange flavored instant breakfast drink

instructions.text: In large mixer bowl, combine cream cheese, powdered instant breakfast drink, and sugar at low speed; beat 3 minutes at high speed until smooth and creamy.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Fold in whipped cream and drained mandarin oranges; pour over baked and cooled crust.
Freeze covered with foil, overnight. Remove from freezer 10 minutes before serving.

notes: Basic Crust: 1 cup flour, 1 package (4-serving size) pudding and pie filling mix (not instant), 1/4 tsp salt, 1/3 cup solid shortening, 2 tbsp butter softened, 1 egg. Blend 30 seconds at low speed; blend 1 minute at medium speed. Spread in ungreased 13x9-inch pan. Bake at 350° for 12-15 minutes. Cool completely.

assumptions: powdered orange flavored instant breakfast drink: used default unit

recipes.title: Berry Banana Dessert
recipes.description: Layered frozen dessert with raspberries, bananas, and cream cheese.

ingredients.item: baked crust made with coconut cream pudding and pie filling mix

instructions.text: In large saucepan, combine miniature marshmallows, gelatin, and reserved raspberry syrup. Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until marshmallows are melted.
Chill while preparing cream cheese mixture. In large mixer bowl, combine honey, cream cheese and vanilla at low speed; beat 3 minutes at high speed until smooth and creamy.
Add yogurt and reserved marshmallow mixture; beat at medium speed 1 minute. Slice bananas and spoon drained raspberries over baked and cooled crust.
Pour filling over fruit. Refrigerate 3 hours or until set.

notes: Tip: If desired, 1 cup fresh raspberries sweetened with 1/4 cup sugar can be used for the frozen raspberries, using 1 cup water for raspberry syrup.

assumptions: raspberry flavored or vanilla yogurt: used default unit
red raspberry flavored gelatin: used default unit

recipes.title: Strawberries 'n Cream Cheese Freeze
recipes.description: Frozen strawberry cream cheese dessert with lemon pudding crust.

ingredients.item: baked crust made with lemon pudding and pie filling mix

ingredients.prep_note: whipped and sweetened with 1/4 cup sugar

instructions.text: In large mixer bowl, combine cream cheese and sugar at low speed; beat at high speed for 3 minutes until smooth and creamy. Add reserved syrup; beat 1 minute at medium speed.
Fold in strawberries and whipped cream; pour over baked and cooled crust.
Freeze covered with foil overnight. Remove from freezer 10 minutes before serving.
Tip: If desired, 1 pint fresh strawberries, mashed and sweetened with 1/3 cup sugar can be used for the frozen strawberries. Use juice from mashed fresh strawberries for strawberry syrup.

recipes.title: Original Nestle Toll House Chocolate Chip Cookies
recipes.source_note: Nestle Toll House chocolate chip bag
recipes.description: The classic original chocolate chip cookie recipe.

ingredients.item: Nestle Toll House Semi-Sweet Chocolate Morsels

instructions.text: Combine flour, baking soda and salt in small bowl. Beat butter, granulated sugar, brown sugar and vanilla in large mixer bowl. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.
Gradually beat in flour mixture. Stir in morsels and nuts. Drop by rounded tablespoon onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake in preheated 375°F oven for 9 to 11 minutes or until golden brown. Let stand for 2 minutes; remove to wire racks to cool completely.

notes: Pan Cookie Variation: Prepare dough as above. Spread into greased 15 x 10-inch jelly-roll pan. Bake in preheated 375°F oven for 20 to 25 minutes or until golden brown. Cool in pan on wire rack. Makes about 4 dozen bars.

For High Altitude Baking (5,200 feet): Increase flour to 2 1/2 cups. Add 2 teaspoons water with flour and reduce both granulated sugar and brown sugar to 2/3 cup each. Bake at 375°F, drop cookies for 8 to 10 minutes and pan cookie for 17 to 19 minutes.

assumptions: Nestle Toll House Semi-Sweet Chocolate Morsels: used default unit

recipes.title: Famous Fudge
recipes.source_note: Nestle Toll House chocolate chip bag
recipes.description: Classic creamy chocolate fudge with marshmallows.

ingredients.item: Nestle Toll House Semi-Sweet Chocolate Morsels

instructions.text: Combine butter, evaporated milk, sugar and salt in medium, heavy saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly.
Boil for 4 to 5 minutes, stirring constantly. Remove from heat.
Stir in morsels, nuts and vanilla. Stir vigorously for 1 minute or until marshmallows are melted.
Pour into foil-lined 8-inch square baking pan; chill until firm.

assumptions: Nestle Toll House Semi-Sweet Chocolate Morsels: used default unit

recipes.title: Old Fashioned Oatmeal Cookies
recipes.source_note: Nestle Toll House chocolate chip bag
recipes.description: Classic oatmeal cookies with chocolate chips.

ingredients.item: Nestle Toll House Semi-Sweet Chocolate Morsels

instructions.text: Combine flour, baking soda and salt in small bowl. Beat butter, granulated sugar, brown sugar and vanilla in large mixer bowl until creamy.
Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Gradually beat in flour mixture. Stir in morsels and oats.
Drop by rounded tablespoon onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake in preheated 350°F oven for 8 to 11 minutes or until golden brown. Let stand for 2 minutes; remove to wire racks to cool completely.

assumptions: butter or margarine: used default unit
Nestle Toll House Semi-Sweet Chocolate Morsels: used default unit

recipes.title: Ultimate Chocolate Chocolate Chip Cookies
recipes.source_note: Nestle Toll House chocolate chip bag
recipes.description: Double chocolate cookies with melted chocolate in the batter.

ingredients.item: Nestle Toll House Semi-Sweet Chocolate Morsels

instructions.text: Melt 2 cups morsels in small, heavy saucepan over lowest possible heat. When morsels begin to melt, remove from heat; stir. Return to heat for a few seconds at a time, stirring until smooth. Combine flour, baking soda and salt in medium bowl.

Beat butter, brown sugar, granulated sugar and vanilla in large mixer bowl. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in melted chocolate. Gradually beat in flour mixture. Stir in remaining morsels.
Drop by rounded tablespoon onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake in preheated 375°F oven for 8 to 9 minutes or until cookies are puffed. Cool for 2 minutes; remove to wire racks to cool completely.

assumptions: Nestle Toll House Semi-Sweet Chocolate Morsels: used default unit
butter or margarine: used default unit

recipes.title: Easy Double Chocolate Chip Brownies
recipes.source_note: Nestle Toll House chocolate chip bag
recipes.description: Fudgy brownies loaded with chocolate chips.

ingredients.item: Nestle Toll House Semi-Sweet Chocolate Morsels

instructions.text: Melt 1 cup morsels and butter in large, heavy saucepan over low heat; stir until smooth. Remove from heat. Add eggs; stir well. Add flour, sugar, baking soda and vanilla; stir well.
Stir in remaining morsels and nuts. Spread to greased 13 x 9-inch baking pan.
Bake in preheated 350°F oven for 16 to 20 minutes or until wooden pick inserted in center comes out slightly sticky. Cool completely.

assumptions: Nestle Toll House Semi-Sweet Chocolate Morsels: used default unit
butter or margarine: used default unit

recipes.title: Yuletide Toffee Squares
